Text

In [one of the many little suburbs which cling to [the outskirts of [London]1-london]92-the outskirts of london]91-one of the many little suburbs which cling to the outskirts of london , there is [a silent and grass - grown street , of aspect both quiet and quaint]93-a silent and grass - grown street , of aspect both quiet and quaint . [The houses]94-the houses are crazy , old , and brown , of every height and every size ; many are untenanted . Some years ago one was internally destroyed by fire . [It]95-it was not thought worth rebuilding . [There]96-there [it]95-it still stands , gaunt and grim , looking for all [the world]97-the world , with [its]95-it broken or dust - stained windows , like [a town deserted after a sacking]98-a town deserted after a sacking . [This street]99-this street is surrounded by [populous courts]100-populous courts and [alleys]101-alleys , by [stirring thoroughfares]102-stirring thoroughfares , by [roads full of activity and commerce]103-roads full of activity and commerce ; yet somehow or other , all the noise of life , all its tumult and agitation , here seem to die away to silence and repose . [Few people]104-few people , even amongst [the poor]105-the poor , and [the neighbourhood]106-the neighbourhood is a poor one , care to reside in [it]106-the neighbourhood , while [they]104-few people can be lodged as cheaply close by , and more to [their]104-few people taste . [Some]107-some think that [the old square]108-the old square at the end , with [its]108-the old square ancient , nodding trees , is close and gloomy ; [others]109-others have heard strange noises in [the house]110-the house that has suffered from fire , and are sure [it]110-the house is haunted ; and [some]107-some again do not like the silent , deserted look of [the place]112-the place , and can not get over the fancy that , if [no one]113-no one will live in [it]112-the place , it must be because [it]112-the place is unlucky . And thus [it]112-the place daily decays more and more , and daily seems to grow more silent . The appearance of [the few houses that are inhabited]114-the few houses that are inhabited , says little in favour of [this unfortunate street]115-this unfortunate street . In one , [a tailor]116-a tailor has taken up [[his]116-a tailor abode]117-his abode . [He]116-a tailor is [a pale , serious man]118-a pale , serious man , who stitches at [his]116-a tailor board in the window the whole day long , cheered by the occasional song of a thrush , hopping in its osier cage . [This tailor]119-this tailor , [Samuel Hopkins yclept]19-samuel hopkins yclept , lives by repairing damaged vestments . [He]119-this tailor once made a coat , and boasts — with how much truth is known to [his]119-this tailor own heart — that [he]119-this tailor likewise cut out , fashioned , and fitted , a pair of blue nether garments . Further on , at the corner of [the square]120-the square , stands [the house of [Mrs. Adams]20-mrs. adams]121-the house of mrs. adams , [an aged widow]122-an aged widow , who keeps [a small school]123-a small school , which , on [her]20-mrs. adams brass board , [she]20-mrs. adams emphatically denominates [her]20-mrs. adams " Establishment for [Young Ladies]1484-young ladies . "[20-mrs. adams] [This house]124-this house has an unmistakeable air of literary dirt and neglect ; the area and kitchen windows are encumbered with the accumulated mud and dust of years ; from the attic casement , [a little red - haired servant - girl]125-a little red - haired servant - girl is ever gaping ; and on hot summer afternoons , when the parlour windows are left open , there is a glimpse within of [a dingy school - mistress]126-a dingy school - mistress , and still [more dingy school - room]127-more dingy school - room , with [a few pupils who sit straggling on half - a - dozen benches , conning [their]128-a few pupils who sit straggling on half - a - dozen benches , conning their lessons with a murmuring hum lessons with a murmuring hum]128-a few pupils who sit straggling on half - a - dozen benches , conning their lessons with a murmuring hum . With one exception , there is no other sign of commerce , trade , or profession in [the whole street]129-the whole street . For all an outward glance can reveal to the contrary , [the people who live there]130-the people who live there are so very rich that [they]130-the people who live there do not need to work at all , or so very genteel in [their]130-the people who live there decay , that if [they]130-the people who live there do work , [they]130-the people who live there must do it in a hidden , skulking , invisible sort of fashion , or else be irretrievably disgraced . The solitary exception to which [we]131-we have alluded , exists , or rather existed , for though [we]131-we speak in the present , [we]131-we write in the past by some years , in [one of [the smallest houses in [the street]134-the street]133-the smallest houses in the street]132-one of the smallest houses in the street . [A little six - roomed house [it]135-a little six - roomed house it was , exactly facing the dreary haunted mansion was , exactly facing [the dreary haunted mansion]136-the dreary haunted mansion]135-a little six - roomed house it was , exactly facing the dreary haunted mansion , and exposed to all the noises aforesaid . It was , also , to say the truth , an abode of poor and mean aspect . In the window hung [a dress - maker]137-a dress - maker 's board , on which was modestly inscribed , with a list of prices , the name of — " [RACHEL GRAY]21-rachel . "[137-a dress - maker] It was accompanied with patterns of yellow paper sleeves , trimmed in every colour , an old book of fashions , and beautiful and bright , as if reared in wood or meadow , a pot of yellow crocuses in bloom . [They]138-they were closing now , for evening was drawing in , and [they]138-they knew the hour . [They]138-they had opened to light in [the dingy parlour within]139-the dingy parlour within , and which [we]131-we will now enter . [It]135-a little six - roomed house it was , exactly facing the dreary haunted mansion was but [a little room]140-a little room , and the soft gloom of a spring twilight half - filled [it]135-a little six - roomed house it was , exactly facing the dreary haunted mansion . The furniture though poor and old - fashioned , was scrupulously clean ; and [it]135-a little six - roomed house it was , exactly facing the dreary haunted mansion shone again in the flickering fire - light . A few discoloured prints in black frames hung against the walls ; two or three broken china ornaments adorned the wooden mantel - shelf , which was , moreover , decorated with a little dark - looking mirror in a rim of tarnished gold . By the fire [an elderly woman of grave and stern aspect , but who had once been handsome]141-an elderly woman of grave and stern aspect , but who had once been handsome , sat reading the newspaper . Near the window , [two apprentices]142-two apprentices sewed , under the superintendence of [Rachel Gray]21-rachel . A mild ray of light fell on [her]21-rachel pale face , and bending figure . [She]21-rachel sewed on , serious and still , and the calm gravity of [her]21-rachel aspect harmonized with the silence of the little parlour which nothing disturbed , save the ticking of an old clock behind the door , the occasional rustling of [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray 's newspaper , and the continuous and monotonous sound of stitching . [Rachel Gray]21-rachel looked upwards of thirty , yet [she]21-rachel was younger by some years . [She]21-rachel was [a tall , thin , and awkward woman]143-a tall , thin , and awkward woman , sallow and faded before [her]21-rachel time . [She]21-rachel was not , and had never been handsome , yet there was a patient seriousness in the lines of [her]21-rachel face , which , when it caught the eye , arrested it at once , and kept it long . [Her]21-rachel brow , too , was broad and intellectual ; [her]21-rachel eyes were very fine , though their look was dreamy and abstracted ; and [her]21-rachel smile , when [she]21-rachel did smile , which was not often , for [she]21-rachel was slightly deaf and spoke little , was pleasant and very sweet . [She]21-rachel sewed on , as [we]144-we have said , abstracted and serious , when gradually , for even in observation [she]21-rachel was slow , the yellow crocuses attracted [her]21-rachel attention . [She]21-rachel looked at [them]145-them meditatively , and watched [them]145-them closing , with the decline of day . And , at length , as if [she]21-rachel had not understood , until then , what was going on before [her]21-rachel , [she]21-rachel smiled and admiringly exclaimed : " Now do look at the creatures , [mother]1485-mother ! "[21-rachel] [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray glanced up from [her]22-mrs. gray newspaper , and snuffed rather disdainfully . " [Lawk]23-lawk , [Rachel]21-rachel ! "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel said , " [you]1485-mother do n't mean to call [crocuses creatures]1486-crocuses creatures — do [you]1485-mother ? [I]21-rachel 'll tell [you]1485-mother what though , "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel added , with a doleful shake of the head , " [I]21-rachel do n't know what [[Her]22-mrs. gray Majesty]1487-her majesty thinks ; but [I]21-rachel say [the country]1488-the country ca n't stand it much longer . "[21-rachel] [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray had been cook in [[a Prime Minister]146-a prime minister 's household]147-a prime minister 's household , and this had naturally given [her]22-mrs. gray a political turn . " [The Lord]1489-the lord has taught [you]150-the other apprentice , "[21-rachel] murmured [Rachel]21-rachel , bending over the flowers with something like awe , and a glow spread over [her]22-mrs. gray sallow cheek , and there came a light to [her]22-mrs. gray large brown eyes . Of [the two apprentices]148-the two apprentices — [one a sickly , fretful girl of sixteen]149-one a sickly , fretful girl of sixteen , heard [her]21-rachel not ; [she]149-one a sickly , fretful girl of sixteen went on sewing , and the very way in which [she]149-one a sickly , fretful girl of sixteen drew [her]149-one a sickly , fretful girl of sixteen needle and thread was peevish . [The other apprentice]150-the other apprentice did hear [Rachel]21-rachel , and [she]150-the other apprentice looked , or rather stared at [the dress - maker]151-the dress - maker , with grim wonder . Indeed , there was something particularly grim about [this young maiden]152-this young maiden — a drear stolidity that defies describing . [A pure Saxon [she]152-this young maiden was]153-a pure saxon she was — no infusion of [Celtic]24-celtic , or [Danish]25-danish , or [Norman]26-norman blood had lightened the native weight of [her]152-this young maiden nature . [She]152-this young maiden was young , yet [she]152-this young maiden already went through life settling everything , and living in a moral tower of most uninviting aspect . But though [Jane]27-jane settled everything , [she]27-jane did not profess to understand everything ; and when , as happened every now and then , [Rachel Gray]21-rachel came out with such remarks as that above recorded , [Jane]27-jane felt confounded . " [She]21-rachel could n't make out [Miss Gray]28-miss gray — that [she]21-rachel could n't . "[21-rachel] " [I]29-mary 'm so tired ! "[29-mary] peevishly said [Mary]29-mary , [the fretful apprentice]154-the fretful apprentice . At once [Rachel]21-rachel kindly observed : " Put by [your]29-mary work , [dear]1490-dear . "[21-rachel] Again [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray snuffed , and came out with : " [Lawk]23-lawk ! [she]21-rachel 's always grummy ! "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel piously thought , " [I]21-rachel am not lazy , nor sickly , and [I]21-rachel ca n't see much difference between the two — that [I]21-rachel ca n't . "[21-rachel] [Rachel]21-rachel 's work lay in [her]21-rachel lap ; [she]21-rachel sat looking at the crocuses until [she]21-rachel fell in a dream far in the past . For the past is [[our]156-we realm]157-our realm , free to all , high or low , who wish to dwell in it . There [we]156-we may set aside the bitterness and the sorrow ; there [we]156-we may choose none but the pleasing visions , [the bright , sunny spots where it is sweet to linger]158-the bright , sunny spots where it is sweet to linger . [The Future]2-the future , fair as Hope may make it , is a dream , [we]156-we claim it in vain . "[156-we] But [the Past]3-the past is [ours]156-we to call up at [our]156-we will . It is vivid and distinct as truth . In good and in evil , it is irrevocable ; the divine seal has been set upon it for evermore . In that Book — a pure and holy one was [hers]21-rachel — though not without a few dark and sad pages — [Rachel Gray]21-rachel often read . And now , the sight of the yellow flower of spring took [her]21-rachel back , to a happy day of [her]21-rachel childhood . [She]21-rachel saw [herself]21-rachel [a little girl]159-a little girl again , with [[her]21-rachel younger sister]160-her younger sister [Jane]27-jane , and [the whole school to which [they]162-they belonged , out on a holiday treat in [a green forest]163-a green forest]161-the whole school to which they belonged , out on a holiday treat in a green forest . Near [that forest]164-that forest there was [a breezy field]165-a breezy field ; and there it was that [Rachel]21-rachel first saw the yellow crocuses bloom . [She]21-rachel remembered [her]21-rachel joy , [her]21-rachel delight at the wonderful beauty of the wild field flowers — how [she]21-rachel and [Jane]27-jane heaped [their]162-they laps with [them]166-them , and sat down at the task ; and how , when tired with the pleasant labour , [they]162-they rested , as many yellow crocuses as before seemed to blow and play in the breeze around [them]162-they . And [she]21-rachel remembered , too , how , even then , there passed across [her]21-rachel childish mind , a silent wonder at [their]162-they multitude , an undefined awe for the power of [the Almighty Hand who made the little flower , and bade it bloom in [the green fields]168-the green fields , beneath the misty azure of a soft spring sky]167-the almighty hand who made the little flower , and bade it bloom in the green fields , beneath the misty azure of a soft spring sky . And then swiftly followed other thoughts . [A stylish footman , who quickly detected that [she]21-rachel was shy and nervous , entertained [himself]203-a stylish footman , who quickly detected that she was shy and nervous , entertained himself and his companions and [[his]203-a stylish footman , who quickly detected that she was shy and nervous , entertained himself and his companions companions]204-his companions]203-a stylish footman , who quickly detected that she was shy and nervous , entertained himself and his companions , by making [her]21-rachel ten times more so . [His]203-a stylish footman , who quickly detected that she was shy and nervous , entertained himself and his companions speech was rude — [his]203-a stylish footman , who quickly detected that she was shy and nervous , entertained himself and his companions jests were insolent . [Rachel]21-rachel was meek and humble ; but [she]21-rachel could feel insult ; and that pride , from which few of [God]31-god 's creatures are free , rose within [her]21-rachel , and flushed [her]21-rachel pale cheek with involuntary displeasure . At length , the infliction ceased . [[Mrs. Moxton]35-mrs. moxton 's visitors]205-mrs. moxton 's visitors left ; [Rachel]21-rachel was called in . [Her]21-rachel first impulse had been to complain of [the footman]206-the footman to [[his]206-the footman mistress]207-his mistress ; but mercy checked the temptation ; it might make [him]206-the footman lose [his]206-the footman place . [Poor Rachel]36-poor rachel ! [she]21-rachel little knew that [this footman]208-this footman could have been insolent to [[his]206-the footman mistress]207-his mistress [herself]21-rachel , had [he]206-the footman so chosen . [He]208-this footman was six foot three , and , in [his]208-this footman livery of brown and gold , looked splendid . In short , [he]208-this footman was invaluable , and not to be parted with on any account . [Mrs. Moxton]35-mrs. moxton was habitually [a well - bred , good - natured woman]210-a well - bred , good - natured woman ; but every rule has its exceptions . [Rachel]21-rachel found [her]35-mrs. moxton very much out of temper . To say the truth , one of [her]21-rachel recent visitors was in the Mrs. Brown style ; [Mrs. Moxton]35-mrs. moxton had been provoked and irritated ; and [Rachel]21-rachel paid for it . " Now , [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , "[35-mrs. moxton] [she]35-mrs. moxton said , with solemn indignation , " what do [you]28-miss gray mean by bringing back work in this style ? That flounce is at least an inch too high ! [I]35-mrs. moxton thought [you]28-miss gray [an intelligent young person]1505-an intelligent young person — but really , really ! "[35-mrs. moxton] " It 's very easily altered , [ma'am]1506-ma'am , "[21-rachel] said [Rachel]21-rachel , submissively . " [You]28-miss gray need , not trouble , "[35-mrs. moxton] gravely replied [Mrs. Moxton]35-mrs. moxton . "[35-mrs. moxton] " [I]37-mrs. morton shall not be able to call to - morrow , [ma'am]1506-ma'am ; and if it were convenient now — "[37-mrs. morton] " It is not convenient now ! "[37-mrs. morton] said [Mrs. Morton]37-mrs. morton , rather haughtily . It was night when [she]21-rachel stood once more in [the street]134-the street . Above the pale outline of [the houses]94-the houses spread a sky of dark azure . A star shone in it , a little star ; but it burned with as brilliant a light as [any great planet]215-any great planet . [Rachel]21-rachel gazed at it earnestly , and the shadow passed away . " What matter ! "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel thought , " even though [a man in livery]1508-a man in livery made a jest of [me]21-rachel — even though [a lady in silk]1509-a lady in silk was scornful . Besides , "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel added , checking a thought which might , [she]21-rachel feared , be too proud , " besides , who , and what am [I]21-rachel , that [I]21-rachel should repine ? "[21-rachel] [Rachel]21-rachel went on ; but [she]21-rachel did not turn homewards . [She]21-rachel left [the broad and airy strait]216-the broad and airy strait , where [Mrs. Moxton]35-mrs. moxton lived . [She]21-rachel entered [a narrow one]217-a narrow one , long and gloomy . [It]217-a narrow one led [her]21-rachel into [a large and gas - lit square]218-a large and gas - lit square . [She]21-rachel crossed [it]218-a large and gas - lit square without looking right or left : a thought led [her]21-rachel on like a spell . Through [streets]219-streets and [alleys]101-alleys , by [lanes]221-lanes and [courts]222-courts — on [she]21-rachel went , until at length [she]21-rachel stood in [the heart of [a populous neighbourhood]224-a populous neighbourhood]223-the heart of a populous neighbourhood . [Cars]225-cars were dashing along [the pavement]226-the pavement ; [night vendors]227-night vendors were screaming at [[their]227-night vendors stalls]228-their stalls , where tallow lights flared in the night wind . [Drunken men]229-drunken men were shouting in [gin palaces]230-gin palaces , [wretched looking women]231-wretched looking women were coming out of [[pawnbroker]232-pawnbroker 's shops]233-pawnbroker 's shops , and [precocious London children]234-precocious london children were pouring into [a theatre]235-a theatre , where [their]234-precocious london children morals were to be improved , and [their]234-precocious london children understandings were to be enlightened , at the moderate rate of a penny a head . [Rachel]21-rachel sighed at all [she]21-rachel saw , and divined . " Poor things ! "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel thought , " if [they]234-precocious london children only knew better . "[21-rachel] But this compassionate feeling did not exclude a sort of fear . [Rachel]21-rachel kept as much as [she]21-rachel could in [the gloomy part of [the streets]237-the streets]236-the gloomy part of the streets ; [she]21-rachel shrank back nervously from [every rude group]238-every rude group , and thus [she]21-rachel at length succeeded in attracting the very thing [she]21-rachel most wished to shun — observation . [Three or four women]239-three or four women , rushing out of [a public - house]240-a public - house , caught sight of [her]21-rachel timid figure . At once , one of [them]239-three or four women — [she]21-rachel was more than half - intoxicated — burst out into a loud shouting laugh , and , seizing [Rachel]21-rachel 's arm , swung [her]21-rachel round on [the pavement]226-the pavement . " Let [me]21-rachel go ! "[21-rachel] said [Rachel]21-rachel " [I]21-rachel am in a hurry . "[21-rachel] [She]21-rachel trembled from head to foot , and vainly tried to put on the appearance of a courage [she]21-rachel felt not . " Give [me]242-the woman something for drink then , "[242-the woman] insolently said [the woman]242-the woman . [Rachel]21-rachel 's momentary fear was already over ; [she]21-rachel had said to [herself]21-rachel , " and what can happen to [me]21-rachel without [God]31-god 's will ? "[21-rachel] and the thought had nerved [her]21-rachel . [She]21-rachel looked very quietly at [the woman]242-the woman 's flushed and bloated face , and as quietly [she]21-rachel said : " [You]242-the woman have drunk too much already ; let [me]21-rachel go . "[21-rachel] " No [I]21-rachel wo n't , "[21-rachel] hoarsely replied [[her]21-rachel tormentor]244-her tormentor , and [she]21-rachel used language which , though it could not stain the pure heart of [her]21-rachel who heard it , brought the blush of anger and shame to [her]21-rachel cheek . " Let [me]21-rachel go ! "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel said , trembling this time with indignation . "[245-one of the woman 's companions who had hitherto looked on apathetically] [Rachel]21-rachel hastened away , followed by the derisive shout of [the whole group]247-the whole group . [She]21-rachel turned down [the first street [she]21-rachel found]248-the first street she found ; [it]248-the first street she found was dark and silent , yet [Rachel]21-rachel did not stop until [she]21-rachel reached the very end of [it]248-the first street she found ; then [she]21-rachel paused to breathe a while , but when [she]21-rachel put [her]21-rachel hand in [her]21-rachel pocket for [her]21-rachel handkerchief it was gone ; with it had disappeared [her]21-rachel purse , and two or three shillings . [Rachel]21-rachel saw and understood it all — [the friend of [Molly]29-mary]249-the friend of molly , [[her]21-rachel officious deliverer]250-her officious deliverer , was a pick - pocket [She]21-rachel hung down [her]21-rachel head and sighed , dismayed and astonished , not at [her]21-rachel loss , but at the sin . " Ah ! dear [Lord Jesus]39-jesus , "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel thought , full of sorrow , " that [thou]1511-thou shouldst thus be crucified anew by the sins of [[thy]1511-thou people]1512-thy people ! "[21-rachel] Then followed the perplexing inward question : " Oh ! why is there so much sin ? "[21-rachel] " God knows best , "[21-rachel] was the inward reply , and once more calm and serene , [Rachel]21-rachel went on . At first , [she]21-rachel hardly knew where [she]21-rachel was . [She]21-rachel stood in [a dark thoroughfare where [three streets]252-three streets met]251-a dark thoroughfare where three streets met — [three narrow streets that scarcely broke on the surrounding gloom]253-three narrow streets that scarcely broke on the surrounding gloom . Hesitatingly [she]21-rachel took the first . It happened to be that which [she]21-rachel wanted . When [Rachel]21-rachel recognized it , [her]21-rachel pace slackened , [her]21-rachel heart beat , [her]21-rachel colour came and went , [she]21-rachel was much moved ; [she]21-rachel prayed too — [she]21-rachel prayed with [her]21-rachel whole heart , but [she]21-rachel walked very slowly . And thus [she]21-rachel reached at length [a lonely little street]254-a lonely little street not quite so gloomy as that which [she]21-rachel had been following . [She]21-rachel paused at [the corner shop]255-the corner shop for a moment . [It]255-the corner shop was a second - hand [ironmonger]256-ironmonger 's ; rusty iron locks , and rusty tongs and shovels , and rusty goods of every description kept grim company to tattered books and a few old pictures , that had contracted an iron look in [their]252-three streets vicinity . A solitary gas - light lit the whole . [Rachel]21-rachel stopped and looked at the books , and at the pictures , but only for a few seconds . If [she]21-rachel stood there , it was not to gaze with passing curiosity on those objects ; [she]21-rachel knew them all of old , as [she]21-rachel knew every stone of [that street]257-that street ; it was to wait until the flush of [her]21-rachel cheek had subsided , and the beating of [her]21-rachel heart had grown still . At length [she]21-rachel went on . When [she]21-rachel reached the middle of [the street]134-the street [she]21-rachel paused ; [she]21-rachel stood near [a dark house]259-a dark house , shrouded within the gloom of [its]259-a dark house doorway . Opposite [her]21-rachel , on the other side of the way , was [a small shop lit from within]260-a small shop lit from within . From where [she]21-rachel stood , [Rachel]21-rachel could see everything that passed in [that abode]261-that abode . [A carpenter]262-a carpenter lived [there]96-there , for [the place]112-the place was full of rough deal boards standing erect against the wall , and the floor was heaped high with shavings . Presently a door within opened , [the master of [the shop]266-the shop]265-the master of the shop entered [it]266-the shop , and set [himself]265-the master of the shop to work by the light of a tallow candle . [He]265-the master of the shop was [a tall , thin man]267-a tall , thin man , grey - headed and deeply wrinkled , but strong and hale for [his]265-the master of the shop years . As [he]265-the master of the shop bent over [his]265-the master of the shop work , the light of the candle vividly defined [his]265-the master of the shop angular figure and sharp features . [Rachel]21-rachel looked at [him]265-the master of the shop ; [her]21-rachel eyes filled with tears , [she]21-rachel brushed them away with [her]21-rachel hand , for they prevented [her]21-rachel from seeing , but they returned thicker and faster . " Oh ! [[my]21-rachel father]1513-my father , [[my]21-rachel father]1513-my father ! "[21-rachel] [Her]21-rachel heart seemed full to bursting ; [her]21-rachel eyes overflowed , [her]21-rachel breathing was broken by sobs , and in the simple and pathetic words of Scripture , [she]21-rachel turned away [her]21-rachel head , and raised [her]21-rachel voice and wept aloud . [Rachel Gray]21-rachel was [the daughter of [the grey - headed carpenter]269-the grey - headed carpenter]268-the daughter of the grey - headed carpenter by [a first wife]270-a first wife ; soon after whose death [he]269-the grey - headed carpenter had married again . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray was [[his]269-the grey - headed carpenter second wife]271-his second wife , and [the mother of [[his]269-the grey - headed carpenter youngest daughter]273-his youngest daughter]272-the mother of his youngest daughter . [She]22-mrs. gray was kind in [her]22-mrs. gray way , but that was at the best a harsh one . [Rachel]21-rachel was [a timid , retiring child , plain , awkward , and sallow , with nothing to attract the eye]274-a timid , retiring child , plain , awkward , and sallow , with nothing to attract the eye , and little to please the fancy . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray did not use [her]21-rachel ill certainly , but neither did [she]22-mrs. gray give [her]21-rachel any great share in [her]21-rachel affections . And why and how should [a step - mother]275-a step - mother have loved [Rachel]21-rachel when [[her]275-a step - mother own father]276-her own father did not ? when almost from [her]21-rachel birth [she]21-rachel had been to [him]269-the grey - headed carpenter as though [she]21-rachel did not exist — as [a being who , uncalled for and unwanted , had come athwart [his]269-the grey - headed carpenter life]277-a being who , uncalled for and unwanted , had come athwart his life . Never had [he]269-the grey - headed carpenter , to [her]21-rachel knowledge , taken [her]21-rachel in [his]269-the grey - headed carpenter arms , or on [his]269-the grey - headed carpenter knee ; never had [he]269-the grey - headed carpenter kissed or caressed [her]21-rachel ; never addressed to [her]21-rachel one word of fondness , or even of common kindness . Neither , it is true , had [he]269-the grey - headed carpenter ill - used nor ill - treated [her]21-rachel ; [he]269-the grey - headed carpenter felt no unnatural aversion for [his]269-the grey - headed carpenter own flesh and blood , nothing beyond a deep and incurable indifference . For [her]21-rachel , [his]269-the grey - headed carpenter heart remained as [a barren and arid soil]278-a barren and arid soil on which the sweet flower of love could never bloom . There was but [one being in this narrow circle who really and fondly loved [Rachel Gray]21-rachel]279-one being in this narrow circle who really and fondly loved rachel gray . And this was [Jane]27-jane , [[her]21-rachel little half - sister]280-her little half - sister . [Rachel]21-rachel was [[her]21-rachel elder]281-her elder by full five years . When [she]21-rachel was told one morning that [Jane]27-jane was born , [she]21-rachel heard the tidings with silent awe , then with eager curiosity , climbed up on a chair to peep at the rosy baby fast asleep in its cradle . From that day , [she]21-rachel had but one thought — [[her]21-rachel little sister]282-her little sister . How describe the mingled love and pride with which [Rachel]21-rachel received [the baby]283-the baby , when it was first confided to [her]21-rachel care , and when to [her]21-rachel was allotted the delightful task of dragging about in [her]21-rachel arms [a heavy , screaming child]284-a heavy , screaming child ? And who but [Rachel]21-rachel found [Jane]27-jane 's first tooth ? Who but [Rachel]21-rachel taught [Jane]27-jane to speak ; and taught [her]27-jane how to walk ? Who else fulfilled for [the helpless infant and wilful child]285-the helpless infant and wilful child every little office of kindness and of love , until at length there woke in [her]21-rachel own childish heart some of that maternal fondness born with [woman]286-woman , the feeling whence [her]21-rachel deepest woes and [her]21-rachel highest happiness alike must spring . When [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father was unkind , when [[her]21-rachel step - mother]288-her step - mother was hasty , [Rachel]21-rachel turned for comfort to [[her]21-rachel little sister]282-her little sister . In [her]21-rachel childish caresses , and words , and ways , [she]21-rachel found solace and consolation . [She]21-rachel did not feel it hard that [she]21-rachel was to be [the slave of [a spoiled child]291-a spoiled child]290-the slave of a spoiled child , to wash , comb , and dress [her]291-a spoiled child , to work for [her]291-a spoiled child , to carry [her]291-a spoiled child , to sing to [her]291-a spoiled child , to play with [her]291-a spoiled child , and that , not when [she]21-rachel liked , but when it pleased [Jane]27-jane . All this [Rachel]21-rachel did not mind — [Jane]27-jane loved [her]21-rachel . [She]27-jane knew it , [she]27-jane was sure of it ; and where there is love , there can not be tyranny . Thus [the two sisters]292-the two sisters grew up together , until one day , without previous warning , [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray went off to [America]6-america , and coolly left [[his]40-thomas gray wife]293-his wife and [children]294-children behind . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray was [a good and an upright woman]295-a good and an upright woman ; [she]22-mrs. gray reared [[[her]22-mrs. gray husband]296-her husband 's child]297-her husband 's child like [her]22-mrs. gray own , and worked for [both]298-both , without ever repining at the double burden . When [[her]22-mrs. gray husband]296-her husband returned to [England]7-england , after three years ' absence , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray lost no time in compelling [him]296-her husband to grant [her]22-mrs. gray a weekly allowance for [herself]22-mrs. gray , and for the support of [[her]22-mrs. gray children]300-her children . [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray could not resist the claim ; but [he]40-thomas gray gave what the law compelled [him]40-thomas gray to give , and no more . [He]40-thomas gray never returned to live with [[his]40-thomas gray wife]293-his wife ; [he]40-thomas gray never expressed a wish to see [either of [[his]40-thomas gray daughters]303-his daughters]302-either of his daughters . [He]40-thomas gray had been back some years when [little Jane]27-jane died at thirteen . [She]27-jane died , dreaming of [heaven]304-heaven , with [her]27-jane hand in that of [Rachel]21-rachel , and [her]27-jane head on [Rachel]21-rachel 's bosom . [She]27-jane died , blessing [[her]27-jane eldest sister]305-her eldest sister with [her]27-jane last breath , with love for [her]305-her eldest sister in the last look of [her]27-jane blue eyes , in the last smile of [her]27-jane wan lips . It was [a happy death - bed]306-a happy death - bed — one to waken hope , not to call forth sorrow ; and yet what became of the life of [Rachel]21-rachel when [Jane]27-jane was gone ? For a long time it was a dreary void — a melancholy succession of days and weeks and months , from which the happy light had fled — from which something sweet and delightful was gone for ever . For , though it may be sweeter to love , than to be loved , yet it is hard always to give and never to receive in return ; and when [Jane]27-jane died , [Rachel]21-rachel knew well enough that all the love [she]21-rachel had to receive upon [earth]307-earth , had been given unto [her]21-rachel . Like the lost Pleiad , " seen no more below , "[22-mrs. gray] the bright star of [her]27-jane life had left the sky . It burned in other heavens with more celestial light ; but it shone no longer over [her]27-jane path — to cheer , to comfort , to illume . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray was kind ; after [her]22-mrs. gray own fashion , [she]22-mrs. gray loved [Rachel]21-rachel . [They]308-they had grieved and suffered together from the same sorrows , and kindred griefs can bind the farthest hearts ; but beyond this there was no sympathy between [them]308-they , and [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray 's affection , such as it was , was free from a particle of tenderness . [She]22-mrs. gray was not naturally [a patient]309-a patient or [an amiable woman]310-an amiable woman ; and [she]22-mrs. gray had endured great and unmerited wrongs from [[Rachel]21-rachel 's father]311-rachel 's father . Perhaps , [she]22-mrs. gray would have been more than human , had [she]22-mrs. gray not occasionally reminded [[her]22-mrs. gray step - daughter]312-her step - daughter of [Mr. Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray 's misdeeds , and now and then taunted [her]312-her step - daughter with a " [He]276-her own father never cared about [you]312-her step - daughter — [you]312-her step - daughter know . "[21-rachel] Aye — [Rachel]21-rachel knew it well enough . [She]21-rachel knew that [[her]21-rachel own father]276-her own father loved [her]21-rachel not — that though [he]276-her own father had cared little for [Jane]27-jane , not being [a tender - hearted man]314-a tender - hearted man , still that [he]276-her own father had cared somewhat , for [that younger , and more favoured child]315-that younger , and more favoured child . That before [he]276-her own father left [England]7-england , [he]276-her own father would occasionally caress [her]27-jane ; that when [she]27-jane died , tears had flowed down [his]276-her own father stern cheek on hearing the tidings , and that the words had escaped [him]276-her own father : " [I]276-her own father am sorry [I]276-her own father was not there . "[276-her own father] All this [Rachel]21-rachel knew . [Her]21-rachel mind was too noble , and too firm for jealousy ; [her]21-rachel heart too pious , and too humble for rebellious sorrow ; but yet [she]21-rachel found it hard to bear , and very hard to be reminded of it as a reproach and a shame . Was it not enough that [she]21-rachel could not win the affection [she]21-rachel most longed for ? [She]21-rachel was devoted to [[her]21-rachel step - mother]288-her step - mother ; [she]21-rachel had fondly loved [[her]21-rachel younger sister]160-her younger sister ; but earlier born in [her]21-rachel heart than these two loves , deeper , and more solemn , was the love [Rachel]21-rachel felt for [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father . That instinct of nature , which in [him]276-her own father was silent , in [her]21-rachel spoke strongly . That share of love which [he]276-her own father denied [her]21-rachel , [she]21-rachel silently added to [her]21-rachel own , and united both in one fervent offering . Harshness and indifference had no power to quench a feeling , to which love in kindness had not given birth . [She]21-rachel loved because it was [her]21-rachel destiny ; because , as [she]21-rachel once said [herself]21-rachel , when speaking of another : " [A daughter]1518-a daughter 's heart clings to [[her]1518-a daughter father]287-her father with boundless charity . "[21-rachel] Young as [she]21-rachel was when [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray left [[his]40-thomas gray home]319-his home , [Rachel]21-rachel remembered [him]40-thomas gray well . [His]40-thomas gray looks , the very tones of [his]40-thomas gray voice , were present to [her]21-rachel . Not once , during the years of [his]40-thomas gray absence , did the thought of [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father cease to haunt [her]21-rachel heart . When , from the bitter remarks of [[her]21-rachel step - mother]288-her step - mother , [she]21-rachel learned that [he]40-thomas gray had returned , and where [he]40-thomas gray had taken up [[his]40-thomas gray home]319-his home , [she]21-rachel had no peace until [she]21-rachel succeeded in obtaining a glimpse of [him]40-thomas gray . Free , as are [all the children of [the poor]105-the poor]323-all the children of the poor , [she]21-rachel made [her]21-rachel way to [the street where [he]40-thomas gray lived]325-the street where he lived , and many a day walked for weary miles in order to pass by [[[her]21-rachel father]287-her father 's door]327-her father 's door . But [she]21-rachel never crossed the threshold , never spoke to [him]40-thomas gray , never let [him]40-thomas gray know who [she]21-rachel was , until the sad day when [she]21-rachel bore to [him]40-thomas gray the news of [[her]21-rachel sister]328-her sister 's death . [He]40-thomas gray received [her]21-rachel with [his]40-thomas gray usual coldness — in such emotion as [he]40-thomas gray showed , [she]21-rachel had no share , like [strangers]329-strangers [they]330-they had met — like [strangers]329-strangers [they]330-they parted . But , though [his]40-thomas gray coldness and [her]21-rachel own timidity prevented nearer advances , [they]330-they did not prevent [Rachel]21-rachel from often seeking [the remote neighbourhood and gloomy street where [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father dwelt]332-the remote neighbourhood and gloomy street where her father dwelt . It was a pleasure , though a sad one , to look on [his]40-thomas gray face , even if [she]21-rachel went not near [him]40-thomas gray ; and thus it happened , that on this dark night [she]21-rachel stood in the sheltering obscurity of the well - known doorway , gazing on [the solitary old man]334-the solitary old man , yet venturing not to cross [the narrow street]335-the narrow street . The wind blew from the east . It was cold and piercing ; yet it could not draw [Rachel]21-rachel from [her]21-rachel vigil of love . Still [she]21-rachel looked and lingered , wishing [she]21-rachel knew not what ; and hoping against hope . Thus [she]21-rachel stayed , until [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray left [his]40-thomas gray work , put up the shutters , then left [the house]110-the house by the private door , and slowly walked away to [the nearest public - house]337-the nearest public - house . [The shop]266-the shop was once more a blank in [the dark street]339-the dark street . [Rachel]21-rachel looked at [the deserted dwelling]340-the deserted dwelling and sighed ; than softly and silently [she]21-rachel stole away . It was late when [Rachel]21-rachel reached [home]1499-home . [She]21-rachel found [[her]21-rachel step - mother]288-her step - mother sitting up for [her]21-rachel , rigid , amazed y indignant — so indignant , indeed , that though [she]288-her step - mother rated [Rachel]21-rachel soundly for [her]288-her step - mother audacity in presuming to stay out so long without previous leave obtained , [she]288-her step - mother quite forgot to inquire particularly why [she]288-her step - mother had not come [home]1499-home earlier . A series of disasters had been occasioned by [Rachel]21-rachel 's absence ; [Jane]27-jane and [Mary]29-mary had quarrelled , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray had been kept an hour waiting for [her]22-mrs. gray supper , the beer had naturally become flat and worthless , and whilst [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray was sleeping — and how could [she]22-mrs. gray help sleeping , being quite faint and exhausted with [her]22-mrs. gray long vigil — [puss]41-puss had got up on the table and walked off with [Rachel]21-rachel 's polony . There was a touch of quiet humour in [Rachel]21-rachel , and with a demure smile , [she]21-rachel internally wondered why it was precisely [her]21-rachel polony that had been selected by puss , but aloud [she]21-rachel merely declared that [she]21-rachel could make an excellent supper on bread and beer . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , who held the reins of domestic management in [[their]344-their little household]345-their little household , assured [her]21-rachel that [she]21-rachel had better , for that nothing else was [she]21-rachel going to get ; [she]22-mrs. gray sat down heroically determined to eat the whole of [her]22-mrs. gray polony in order to punish and provoke [[her]22-mrs. gray step - daughter]312-her step - daughter ; but somehow or other the half of that dainty had , before the end of the meal , found its way to the plate of [Rachel]21-rachel , who , when [she]21-rachel protested against this act of generosity , was imperiously ordered to hold [her]21-rachel tongue , which order [she]21-rachel did not dare to resist ; for if [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray 's heart was mellow , [her]21-rachel temper was sufficiently tart . [The apprentices]347-the apprentices had long been gone to bed ; as soon as supper was over , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray intimated to [Rachel]21-rachel the propriety of following [their]344-their example . [Rachel]21-rachel ventured to demur meekly . " [I]21-rachel can not , [mother]1485-mother — [I]21-rachel have work to finish . "[21-rachel] " Then better have sat at [home]1499-home and finished it , than have gone gadding about , and nearly got a pitch plaster on [your]21-rachel mouth , "[22-mrs. gray] grumbled [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , who was [a firm believer in pitch plasters , and abductions , and highway robberies , and all sorts of horrors]348-a firm believer in pitch plasters , and abductions , and highway robberies , and all sorts of horrors . " Mind [you]21-rachel do n't set [the house]110-the house a fire , "[22-mrs. gray] [she]22-mrs. gray added , retiring . " Why , [mother]1485-mother , "[21-rachel] said [Rachel]21-rachel , smiling , " [you]1485-mother treat [me]21-rachel like [a child]1524-a child , and [I]21-rachel am twenty - six . "[21-rachel] " What about that ? when [you]1485-mother ai nt got no more sense than [a baby]1525-a baby . "[21-rachel] [Rachel]21-rachel did not venture to dispute , a proposition so distinctly stated . [She]21-rachel remained up , and sat sewing until [her]21-rachel work was finished ; [she]21-rachel then took out from [some secret repository]349-some secret repository a small end of candle , lit it , and extinguished the long candle , by the light of which [she]21-rachel had been working . From [her]21-rachel pocket [she]21-rachel took a small key ; it opened a work - box , whence [she]21-rachel drew a shirt collar finely stitched ; [she]21-rachel worked until [her]21-rachel eyes ached , but [she]21-rachel heeded it not , until they closed with involuntary fatigue and sleep , and still [she]21-rachel would not obey the voice of wearied nature ; still [she]21-rachel stitched for love , like [the poor shirtmaker for bread]350-the poor shirtmaker for bread , until , without previous warning , [her]21-rachel candle end suddenly flickered , then expired in its socket , and left [her]21-rachel in darkness . [Rachel]21-rachel gently opened the window , and partly unclosed the shutter ; the moon was riding in the sky above [the old house]351-the old house opposite , [her]21-rachel pale clear light glided over [its]351-the old house brown walls and [the quiet street]352-the quiet street , down into [the silent parlour of [Rachel]21-rachel]353-the silent parlour of rachel . [She]21-rachel looked around [her]21-rachel , moved at seeing familiar objects under an unusual aspect . In that old chair [she]21-rachel had often seen [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father sitting ; on such a moonlight night as this [she]21-rachel and [Jane]27-jane , then already declining , had sat by the window , and looking at that same sky , had talked with youthful fervour of high and eternal things . And now [Jane]27-jane knew the divine secrets [she]27-jane had guessed from afar , and [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray , alas ! was [a stranger]355-a stranger and an alien in [[his]40-thomas gray own home]356-his own home . " Who knows , "[21-rachel] thought [Rachel]21-rachel , " but [he]40-thomas gray will return some day ? Who knows — who can tell ? Life is long , and hope is eternal . Ah ! if [he]40-thomas gray should come back , even though [he]40-thomas gray never looked at [me]21-rachel , never spoke , blessed , thrice blessed , should ever be held the day … "[21-rachel] And a prayer , not framed in words , but in deep feelings , gushed like a pure spring from [her]21-rachel inmost heart . But , indeed , when did [she]21-rachel not pray ? When was [God]31-god divided from [her]21-rachel thoughts ? When did prayer fail to prompt the kind , gentle words that fell from [her]21-rachel lips , or to lend its daily grace to a pure and blameless life ? For to [her]21-rachel , [God]31-god was not what [He]31-god , alas ! is to [so many]357-so many — [an unapproachable Deity]358-an unapproachable deity , to be worshipped from afar , in fear and trembling , or a cold though sublime abstraction . No , [Jesus]39-jesus was [[her]21-rachel friend]359-her friend , [[her]21-rachel counsellor]360-her counsellor , [her]21-rachel refuge . There was familiarity and tenderness in [her]21-rachel very love for [Him]39-jesus ; and , though [she]21-rachel scarcely knew it [herself]21-rachel , a deep and fervent sense of [His]39-jesus divine humanity of those thirty - three years of earthly life , of toil , of poverty , of trouble , and of sorrow which move [our]361-us very hearts within [us]361-us , when [we]361-us look from [Bethlehem]8-bethlehem to [Calvary]9-calvary , from the lowly birth in [the Manger]10-the manger to the bitter death on the Cross . [We]361-us might ask , were these the pages to raise such questions , why [Jesus]39-jesus is not more loved thus — as [a friend]362-a friend , and [a dear one]363-a dear one , rather than as [a cold master to be served]364-a cold master to be served , not for love , but for wages . But let it rest . Sufficient is it for [us]361-us to know that not thus did [Rachel Gray]21-rachel love [him]39-jesus , but with a love in which humility and tenderness equally blended . After a meditative pause , [she]21-rachel quietly put away [her]21-rachel things by moonlight , then again closed shutter and window , and softly stole up to [the room which [she]21-rachel shared with [[her]21-rachel step - mother]288-her step - mother]365-the room which she shared with her step - mother . [She]21-rachel soon fell asleep , and dreamed that [she]21-rachel had gone to live with [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father , who said to [her]21-rachel , " [Rachel]21-rachel ! [Rachel]21-rachel ! "[287-her father] So great was [her]21-rachel joy , that [she]21-rachel awoke . [She]21-rachel found [[her]21-rachel mother]174-her mother already up , and scolding [her]174-her mother because [she]174-her mother still slept . " [Mother]42-mother , "[21-rachel] asked [Rachel]21-rachel , leaning up on one elbow , " was it [you]42-mother who called [me]21-rachel , [Rachel]21-rachel ? "[21-rachel] " Why ai nt [I]22-mrs. gray been a calling of [you]21-rachel this last hour ? "[22-mrs. gray] asked [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , with much asperity . [Rachel]21-rachel checked a sigh , and rose . " Get up [Jane]27-jane — get up [Mary]29-mary , "[22-mrs. gray] said [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , rapping soundly at the room door of [the two apprentices]148-the two apprentices . " Let [them]148-the two apprentices sleep a little longer , [poor young things]1526-poor young things ! "[21-rachel] implored [Rachel]21-rachel . " No , that [I]21-rachel wo n't , "[21-rachel] replied [[her]21-rachel mother]174-her mother , with great determination , " [lazy little creatures]1527-lazy little creatures . "[21-rachel] And to the imminent danger of [her]21-rachel own knuckles , [she]21-rachel rapped so pertinaciously , that [Jane]27-jane and [Mary]29-mary were unable to feign deafness , and replied , [the former]371-the former acting as [spokeswoman]372-spokeswoman , that [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray need n't be making all that noise ; for that [they]148-the two apprentices heard [her]21-rachel , and were getting up . " [I]22-mrs. gray thought [I]22-mrs. gray 'd make [them]148-the two apprentices hear [me]22-mrs. gray , "[22-mrs. gray] muttered [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , hobbling down [stairs]373-stairs . There are [some beings who lead lives so calm , that when they look back on years]374-some beings who lead lives so calm , that when they look back on years , [they]374-some beings who lead lives so calm , that when they look back on years seem to read the story of a few days ; and of these was [Rachel Gray]21-rachel . Life for [her]21-rachel flowed dull , monotonous and quiet , as that of [a nun in [her]375-a nun in her cloister cloister]375-a nun in her cloister . The story of one day was the story of the next . A few hopes , a few precious thoughts [she]21-rachel treasured in [her]21-rachel heart ; but outwardly , to work , to hear idle gossip , to eat , drink , and sleep , seemed [her]21-rachel whole portion , [her]21-rachel destiny from mom till night , from birth to the grave . Like every day passed this day . When it grew so dark that [she]21-rachel could see no more to work , [she]21-rachel put [her]21-rachel task by , and softly stole away to [a little back room up - stairs]376-a little back room up - stairs . It was [a very small room indeed , with a bed , where [the apprentices]347-the apprentices slept]377-a very small room indeed , with a bed , where the apprentices slept ; a chest of drawers , a table , and two chairs:—many [a closet]379-a closet is larger . [Its]376-a little back room up - stairs solitary window looked out on [the little yard below]380-the little yard below ; low walls , against which grew [Rachel]21-rachel 's stocks and wall - flowers , enclosed [it]376-a little back room up - stairs . From [the next house]381-the next house , there came the laughter and the screams too of [children]294-children , and of [babies]383-babies ; and from [a neighbouring forge]384-a neighbouring forge , a loud , yet not unmusical clanking , with which now and then , blended the rude voices of [the men , singing snatches of popular songs]385-the men , singing snatches of popular songs . Dimmed by the smoke of [the forge]386-the forge , and by the natural heaviness of a [London]1-london atmosphere , the sky enclosed all ; yet , even through the smoke and haze , fair rosy gleams of the setting sun shone in that [London]1-london sky , and at the zenith there was a space of pure , ethereal blue — soft , and very far from sinful and suffering earth , where glittered in calm beauty a large and tranquil star . [Rachel]21-rachel sat by the window . [She]21-rachel listened to [earth]307-earth : [she]21-rachel looked at [Heaven]304-heaven . [Her]21-rachel heart swelled with love , and prayer , and tenderness , and hope . Tears of delight filled [her]21-rachel eyes ; [she]21-rachel murmured to [herself]21-rachel verses from psalms and hymns — all praising [God]31-god , all telling the beauty of [God]31-god 's creation . Oh ! pure and beautiful , indeed , would be the story of these [your]389-you evening musings , if [we]390-we could lightly tell it here , [Rachel Gray]21-rachel . [Reader]391-reader , if to learn how a fine nature found its way through darkness and mist , and some suffering to the highest , and to the noblest of the delights [God]31-god has granted to [man]392-man — the religious and the intellectual ; if , [we]390-we say , to learn this give [you]389-you pleasure , [you]389-you may read on to the end of the chapter ; if not , pass on at once to the next . These pages were not written for [you]389-you ; and even though [you]389-you should read them , feel and understand them , [you]389-you never will . [Our]390-we life is twofold ; and of that double life , which , like all of [us]390-we , [Rachel]21-rachel bore within [her]21-rachel , [we]390-we have as yet said but little . [She]21-rachel was now twenty six ; [a tall , thin , sallow woman , ungraceful , of shy manners , and but little speech ; but with a gentle face , a broad forehead , and large brown eyes]393-a tall , thin , sallow woman , ungraceful , of shy manners , and but little speech ; but with a gentle face , a broad forehead , and large brown eyes . By trade , [she]21-rachel was [a dress - maker , of small pretensions]394-a dress - maker , of small pretensions ; [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father had forsaken [her]21-rachel early , and [[her]21-rachel step - mother]288-her step - mother had reared [her]21-rachel . This much , knew the little world in which moved [Rachel Gray]21-rachel , this much , and no more . [We]390-we may add , that [this some little world]397-this some little world had , in [its]397-this some little world wisdom , pronounced [Rachel Gray]21-rachel [a fool]398-a fool . [Her]21-rachel education had been very limited . [She]21-rachel knew how to read , and [she]21-rachel could write , but neither easily nor well . For though [God]31-god had bestowed on [her]21-rachel the rare dower of a fine mind , [He]31-god had not added to it the much more common , though infinitely less precious gift , of a quick intellect . [She]21-rachel learned slowly , with great difficulty , with sore pain and trouble . [[Her]21-rachel teachers]399-her teachers , one and all , pronounced [her]21-rachel dull ; [[her]21-rachel step - mother]288-her step - mother was ashamed of [her]21-rachel , and to [her]288-her step - mother dying day thought [Rachel]21-rachel no better than [a simpleton]401-a simpleton . [Rachel]21-rachel felt this keenly ; but [she]21-rachel had no means of self - defence . [She]21-rachel had not the least idea of how [she]21-rachel could prove that [she]21-rachel was not [an idiot]402-an idiot . One of the characteristics of childhood and of youth is a painful inability , an entire powerlessness of giving the form of speech to its deepest and most fervent feelings . The infirmity generally dies off with years , perhaps because also dies off the very strength of those feelings ; but even as they were to last for ever with [Rachel Gray]21-rachel , so was that infirmity destined to endure . Shy , sensitive , and nervous , [she]21-rachel was a noble book , sealed to all save [God]31-god . At eleven , [her]21-rachel education , such as it was , was over . [Rachel]21-rachel had to work , and earn [her]21-rachel bread . [She]21-rachel was reared religiously , and [hers]403-hers was a deeply religious nature . The misapplication of religion narrows still more a narrow mind , but religion , taken in its true sense , enlarges a noble one . Yet , not without strife , not without suffering , did [Rachel]21-rachel make [her]21-rachel way . [She]21-rachel was ignorant , and [she]21-rachel was alone ; how to ask advice [she]21-rachel knew not , for [she]21-rachel could not explain [herself]21-rachel . Sometimes [she]21-rachel seemed to see the most sublime truths , plain as in a book ; at other times , they floated dark and clouded before [her]21-rachel gaze , or vanished in deep obscurity , and left [her]21-rachel alone and cast down . [She]21-rachel suffered years , until , from [her]21-rachel very sufferings , perfect faith was born , and from faith unbounded trust in [God]31-god , after which [her]21-rachel soul sank in deep and blessed peace . And now , when rest was won , there came the want for more . Religion is love . [Rachel]21-rachel wanted thought , [that child of the intellect]404-that child of the intellect , as love is [the child of the heart]405-the child of the heart . [She]21-rachel did not know [herself]21-rachel what it was that [she]21-rachel needed , until [she]21-rachel discovered and possessed it — until [she]21-rachel could read a book , a pamphlet , a scrap of verse , and brood over it , like a bird over [her]21-rachel young , not for hours , not for days , but for weeks — blest in that silent meditation . [Her]21-rachel mind was tenacious , but slow ; [she]21-rachel read few books — many would have disturbed [her]21-rachel . Sweeter and pleasanter was it to [Rachel]21-rachel to think over what [she]21-rachel did read , and to treasure it up in [the chambers of [her]21-rachel mind]406-the chambers of her mind , than to fill those chambers with heaps of knowledge . Indeed for knowledge [Rachel]21-rachel cared comparatively little . In such as displayed more clearly the glories of [God]31-god 's creation [she]21-rachel delighted ; but [man]392-man 's learning , [man]392-man 's science , touched [her]21-rachel not . To think was [her]21-rachel delight ; a silent , solitary , forbidden pleasure , in which [Rachel]21-rachel had to indulge by stealth . For all this time , and especially since the death of [[her]21-rachel sister]328-her sister , [she]21-rachel suffered keenly from [home]1499-home troubles , from a little domestic persecution , painful , pertinacious , and irritating . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray vaguely felt that [[her]22-mrs. gray daughter]175-her daughter was not like [other girls]412-other girls , and not knowing that [she]175-her daughter was in reality very far beyond most ; feeling , too , that [Rachel]21-rachel was wholly unlike [herself]21-rachel , and jealously resenting the fact , [she]22-mrs. gray teased [her]175-her daughter unceasingly , and did [her]22-mrs. gray best to interrupt the fits of meditation , which [she]22-mrs. gray did not scruple to term " moping . "[22-mrs. gray] When [her]21-rachel mind was most haunted with some fine thought , [Rachel]21-rachel had to talk to [[her]21-rachel step - mother]288-her step - mother , to listen to [her]288-her step - mother , and to take care not to reply at random ; if [she]21-rachel failed in any of these obligations , half - an - hour 's lecture was the least penalty [she]21-rachel could expect . Dear to [her]21-rachel , for this reason ; were the few moments of solitude [she]21-rachel could call [her]21-rachel own ; dear to [her]21-rachel was [that little room , where [she]21-rachel could steal away at twilight time and think in peace]414-that little room , where she could steal away at twilight time and think in peace . Very unlike [her]21-rachel age was [this ignorant dress - maker of the nineteenth century]415-this ignorant dress - maker of the nineteenth century . Ask [the men]416-the men and [women of the day]417-women of the day to read volumes ; why , there is not a season but [they]416-the men go through the Herculean labour of swallowing down histories written faster than time flies , novels by the dozen , essays , philosophic and political , books of travels , of science , of statistics , besides the nameless host of reviews , magazines , and papers , daily and weekly . Ask [them]416-the men to study : why , what is there [they]416-the men do not know , from the most futile accomplishment to the most abstruse science ? Ask [them]416-the men too , if [you]418-you like , to enter life , to view it under all its aspects ; why , [they]416-the men have travelled over [the whole earth]419-the whole earth ; and life , [they]416-the men know from [the palace]420-the palace down to [the hovel]421-the hovel ; but bid [them]416-the men think ! [They]416-the men stare aghast : it is the task of [Sisyphus]43-sisyphus — the labour of [the Danaide]44-the danaide ; as fast as thought enters [their]416-the men mind , it goes out again . Bid [them]416-the men commune , one day with [God]31-god and [their]416-the men own hearts — [they]416-the men reply dejectedly that [they]416-the men can not ; for [their]416-the men intellect is quick and brilliant , but [their]416-the men heart is cold . And thought springs from the heart , and in [her]422-her heart had [Rachel Gray]21-rachel found it . The task impossible to [them]416-the men was to [her]422-her easy and delightful . Time wore on ; deeper and more exquisite grew what [Rachel]21-rachel quaintly termed to [herself]21-rachel " the pleasure of thinking . "[21-rachel] And oh ! [she]21-rachel thought sometimes , and it was a thought that made [her]21-rachel heart bum , " Oh ! that [people]1503-people only knew the pleasures of thinking ! Oh ! if [people]1503-people would only think ! "[21-rachel] And mom , and noon , and night , and bending over [her]21-rachel work , or sitting at peaceful twilight time in [the little back room]423-the little back room , [Rachel]21-rachel thought ; and thus [she]21-rachel went on through life , between [those two fair sisters]424-those two fair sisters , Thought and [Prayer]45-prayer . [Reader]46-reader , hare [you]46-reader known [many thinkers]425-many thinkers ? [We]426-we confess that [we]426-we hare known [many men]427-many men and [women of keen and great intellect]428-women of keen and great intellect , [some geniuses]429-some geniuses ; but only [one real thinker]430-one real thinker have [we]426-we known , [only one who really thought for thought]431-only one who really thought for thought 's own sake , and that one was [Rachel Gray]21-rachel . And now , if [she]21-rachel moves through this story , thinking much and doing little , [you]46-reader know why . It was not merely in meditation that [Rachel]21-rachel indulged , when [she]21-rachel sought [the little room]432-the little room . [The divine]433-the divine did not banish [the human]434-the human from [her]21-rachel heart ; and [she]21-rachel had [friends]435-friends known to [her]21-rachel , but from [that back room]436-that back room window ; but [friends]435-friends [they]435-friends were , and , in [their]435-friends way and degree , [valued ones]438-valued ones . First , came [[the neighbour]439-the neighbour 's children]440-the neighbour 's children . By standing up on an old wooden stool in [the yard]441-the yard , [they]440-the neighbour 's children could see [Rachel]21-rachel at [her]21-rachel window , and [Rachel]21-rachel could see [them]440-the neighbour 's children . [They]440-the neighbour 's children were rude and ignorant little things enough , and no better than [young heathens]442-young heathens , in rearing and knowledge ; yet [they]440-the neighbour 's children liked to hear [Rachel]21-rachel singing hymns in a low voice ; [they]440-the neighbour 's children even caught from [her]21-rachel , scraps of verses , and sang them in [their]440-the neighbour 's children own fashion ; and when [Rachel]21-rachel , hearing this , took courage to open a conversation with [them]440-the neighbour 's children , and to teach [them]440-the neighbour 's children as well as [she]21-rachel could , [she]21-rachel found in [them]440-the neighbour 's children [voluntary and sufficiently docile pupils]443-voluntary and sufficiently docile pupils . [Their]444-their intercourse , indeed , was brief , and limited to a few minutes every evening that [Rachel]21-rachel could steal up to [[her]21-rachel little room]445-her little room , but it was cordial and free . [Another friend]446-another friend had [Rachel]21-rachel , yet one with whom [she]21-rachel had never exchanged speech . There existed , at the back of [[Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray 's house]447-mrs. gray 's house , [a narrow court]448-a narrow court , inhabited by [the poorest of [the poor]105-the poor]449-the poorest of the poor . Over part of [this court]451-this court , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray 's back windows commanded a prospect which [few]452-few would have envied — yet it had proved to [Rachel]21-rachel the source of the truest and the keenest pleasure . From [her]21-rachel window , [Rachel]21-rachel could look clearly into a low damp cellar opposite , the abode of [a little old Frenchwoman , known in [the neighbourhood]106-the neighbourhood]453-a little old frenchwoman , known in the neighbourhood , as " mad Madame [Rose]47-madame rose . "[453-a little old frenchwoman , known in the neighbourhood] [Madame Rose]47-madame rose , as [she]47-madame rose called [herself]47-madame rose , was [a very diminutive old woman — unusually so , but small and neat in all [her]47-madame rose limbs]455-a very diminutive old woman — unusually so , but small and neat in all her limbs , and brisk in all [her]47-madame rose movements . [She]47-madame rose was dry , too , and brown as a nut , with a restless black eye , and a voluble tongue , which [she]47-madame rose exercised mostly in [her]47-madame rose native language — not that [Madame Rose]47-madame rose could not speak English ; [she]47-madame rose had resided some fifteen years in [London]1-london , and could say ' yes ' and ' no , ' & c. , quite fluently . [Her]47-madame rose attire looked peculiar , in [this country]456-this country , but it suited [[her]47-madame rose person]457-her person excellently well ; it was simply that of [a French peasant woman , with high peaked cap , and kerchief , both snow - white , short petticoats , and full , a wide apron , clattering wooden shoes , and blue stockings]458-a french peasant woman , with high peaked cap , and kerchief , both snow - white , short petticoats , and full , a wide apron , clattering wooden shoes , and blue stockings . What wind of fortune had wafted this little French fairy to [a [London]1-london cellar]459-a london cellar , [no one]113-no one ever knew . How [she]47-madame rose lived , was almost as great a mystery . Every Sunday morning , [she]47-madame rose went forth , with a little wooden stool , and planted [herself]47-madame rose at the door of [the French chapel]461-the french chapel ; [she]47-madame rose asked for nothing , but took what [she]47-madame rose got . Indeed , [her]47-madame rose business there did not seem to be to get anything , but to make [herself]47-madame rose busy . [She]47-madame rose nodded to [every one who went in or out]462-every one who went in or out , gave unasked - for information , and assisted [the policeman]463-the policeman in keeping [the carriages]464-the carriages in order . [She]47-madame rose darted in and out , among wheels and horses , with reckless audacity ; and once , to the infinite wrath of [a fat liveried coachman]465-a fat liveried coachman , [she]47-madame rose suspended [herself]47-madame rose — [she]47-madame rose was rather short — from the aristocratic reins [he]465-a fat liveried coachman held , and boldly attempted to turn the heads of [his]465-a fat liveried coachman horses . On week days , [Madame Rose]47-madame rose stayed in [[her]47-madame rose cellar]466-her cellar , and knitted . It was this part of [her]47-madame rose life which [Rachel]21-rachel knew , and it was the most beautiful ; for [this little , laughed - at being , who lived upon charity]467-this little , laughed - at being , who lived upon charity , was , [herself]47-madame rose , all charity . Never yet , for five years that [Rachel]21-rachel had watched [her]47-madame rose , had [she]21-rachel seen [Madame Rose]47-madame rose alone in [[her]47-madame rose cellar]466-her cellar . [Poor girls , who looked very much like [out - casts]470-out - casts]469-poor girls , who looked very much like out - casts , [old and infirm women]471-old and infirm women , [helpless children]472-helpless children , had successively shared [the home]473-the home , the bed , and the board of [Madame Rose]47-madame rose . For [her]47-madame rose seemed written the beautiful record , " [I]21-rachel was naked , and [ye]47-madame rose clothed [me]21-rachel ; [I]21-rachel was hungry , and [ye]47-madame rose fed [me]21-rachel : athirst , and [ye]47-madame rose gave [me]21-rachel drink ; and [I]21-rachel was houseless , and [you]47-madame rose sheltered [me]21-rachel . "[21-rachel] With humble admiration , [Rachel]21-rachel saw a charity and a zeal which [she]21-rachel could not imitate . Like [Mary]29-mary , [she]21-rachel could sit at the feet of [the Lord]1489-the lord , and , looking up , listen , rapt and absorbed , to the divine teaching . But the spirit of [Martha]48-martha , the holy zeal and fervour with which [she]48-martha bade welcome to [[her]48-martha heavenly guest]475-her heavenly guest , were not among the gifts of [Rachel Gray]21-rachel . Yet , the pleasure with which [she]21-rachel stood in the corner of [her]21-rachel own window , and looked down into [the cellar of [Madame Rose]47-madame rose]476-the cellar of madame rose , was not merely that of religious sympathy or admiration . As [she]21-rachel saw it this evening , with the tallow light that burned on the table , rendering every object minutely distinct , [Rachel]21-rachel looked with another feeling than that of mere curiosity . [She]21-rachel looked with the artistic pleasure [we]477-we feel , when [we]477-we gaze at some clearly - painted Dutch picture , with [its]478-its back - ground of soft gloom , and its homely details of domestic life , relieved by touches of brilliant light . Poor as [this cellar]479-this cellar was , [a painter]480-a painter would have liked [it]479-this cellar well ; [he]480-a painter would surely have delighted in the brown and crazy clothes - press , that stood at the further end , massive and dark ; in the shining kitchen utensils that decorated the walls ; in the low and many - coloured bed ; in the clean , white deal table ; in the smouldering fire , that burned in that dark grate , like a red eye ; especially would [he]480-a painter have gloried in the quaint little figure of [Madame Rose]47-madame rose . [She]21-rachel had been cooking [her]21-rachel supper , and [she]21-rachel now sat down to it . In doing so , [she]21-rachel caught sight of [Rachel]21-rachel 's figure ; [they]481-they were acquainted — that is to say , that [Madame Rose]47-madame rose , partly aware of the interest [Rachel]21-rachel took in such glimpses as [she]21-rachel obtained of [her]21-rachel own daily life , favoured [her]21-rachel with tokens of recognition , whenever [she]21-rachel caught sight of [her]21-rachel , far or near . [She]21-rachel now nodded in friendly style , laughed , nodded again , and with that communicativeness which formed part of [her]21-rachel character , successively displayed every article of [her]21-rachel supper for [Rachel]21-rachel 's inspection . First , came a dishful of dark liquid — onion soup it was — then , a piece of bread , not a large one ; then , two apples ; then a small bit of cheese — for [Madame Rose]47-madame rose was [a Frenchwoman]482-a frenchwoman , and [she]47-madame rose would have [her]47-madame rose soup , and [her]47-madame rose dish , and [her]47-madame rose dessert , no matter on what scale , or in what quantity . But the supper of [Madame Rose]47-madame rose did not alone attract the attention and interest of [Rachel]21-rachel . For a week , [Madame Rose]47-madame rose had enjoyed [[her]47-madame rose cellar]466-her cellar to [herself]47-madame rose ; [[her]47-madame rose last guest]484-her last guest , [an old and infirm woman]485-an old and infirm woman , having died of old age ; but , since the preceding day , [she]47-madame rose had taken in [a new tenant]486-a new tenant — [an idiot girl , of some fourteen years of age , whom [[her]486-a new tenant father]287-her father , [an inhabitant of [the court]490-the court]489-an inhabitant of the court , had lately forsaken , and whom [society]491-society , [that negligent step - mother of [man]392-man]492-that negligent step - mother of man , had left to [her]47-madame rose fate]487-an idiot girl , of some fourteen years of age , whom her father , an inhabitant of the court , had lately forsaken , and whom society , that negligent step - mother of man , had left to her fate . And now , with tears of emotion and admiration , [Rachel]21-rachel watched [the little Frenchwoman feeding [[her]47-madame rose adopted child]495-her adopted child]494-the little frenchwoman feeding her adopted child ; having first girt its neck with a sort of bib , [Madame Rose]47-madame rose armed [herself]47-madame rose with a long handled spoon , and standing before it — [she]47-madame rose was too short to sit — [she]47-madame rose deliberately poured a sufficient quantity of onion soup down its throat a proceeding which [the idiot girl]496-the idiot girl received with great equanimity , opening and shutting [her]486-a new tenant mouth with exemplary regularity and seriousness . So absorbed was [Rachel]21-rachel in looking , that [she]21-rachel never heard [[her]21-rachel mother]174-her mother calling [her]21-rachel from below , until the summons was , for a third time , angrily repeated . " Now , [Rachel]21-rachel , what are [you]21-rachel doing up there ? "[22-mrs. gray] asked the sharp voice of [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , at the foot of [the staircase]498-the staircase ; " moping , as usual ! Eh ? "[22-mrs. gray] [Rachel]21-rachel started , and hastened down [stairs]373-stairs , a little frightened . [She]21-rachel had remained unusually long . What if [[her]21-rachel mother]174-her mother should suspect that [she]21-rachel had gone up for the purpose of thinking ? [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray had no such suspicion , fortunately ; else [she]22-mrs. gray would surely have been horror - struck at the monstrous idea , that [Rachel]21-rachel should actually dare to think ! The very extravagance of the supposition saved [Rachel]21-rachel It was not to be thought of . The candle was lit . "[21-rachel] [We]515-we must apologize for using italics , but without [their]516-their aid [we]515-we never could convey to [[our]515-we readers]517-our readers a proper idea of the awful solemnity with which [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray emphasized [her]22-mrs. gray address . [Mary]29-mary was fast asleep ; [her]29-mary hands were folded over the coverlet of variegated patchwork ; [her]29-mary head lay slightly turned on the white pillow ; the frill of [her]29-mary cap softly shaded [her]29-mary pale young face , now slightly flushed with sleep . " Oh , [Lord]1553-lord ! how beautiful is the love [Thou]1554-thou hast put into the hearts of [Thy]1554-thou creature ! "[21-rachel] thought [Rachel Gray]21-rachel ; and though it had not been [her]21-rachel lot to win that love , the thought was to [her]21-rachel so sweet and so lovely , that [she]21-rachel bore without repining [her]21-rachel expected scolding . " [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray had never heard of such a think — never . "[21-rachel] [The rich man]524-the rich man has [his]524-the rich man intellect , and its pleasures ; [he]524-the rich man has [his]524-the rich man books , [his]524-the rich man studies , [his]524-the rich man club , [his]524-the rich man lectures , [his]524-the rich man excursions ; [he]524-the rich man has [foreign lands]525-foreign lands , splendid cities , [galleries]526-galleries , museums , ancient and modern art : [the poor man]527-the poor man has [[his]527-the poor man child]528-his child , solitary delight of [his]527-the poor man hard tasked life , only solace of [[his]527-the poor man cheerless home]529-his cheerless home . [He]51-mr. jones was twenty - one , when [the grocer in whose shop [his]51-mr. jones youth had been spent]532-the grocer in whose shop his youth had been spent , died [a bankrupt]533-a bankrupt , leaving [one child]534-one child , [a daughter]1518-a daughter , [a pale , sickly young creature of seventeen]536-a pale , sickly young creature of seventeen , called [Mary Smith]29-mary . [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones had veneration large . [Miss Smith]54-miss smith gave gracious consent . [They]543-they were married , and lived most happily together . [Poor little Mary]29-mary 's temper was none of the best ; but [Richard]51-mr. jones made every allowance : " Breaking down of the business — other 's death — having to marry [a poor fellow]1555-a poor fellow like [him]51-mr. jones , & c. "[51-mr. jones] In short , [he]51-mr. jones proved the most humble and devoted of [husbands]544-husbands , toiled like [a slave]545-a slave to keep [[his]51-mr. jones wife]293-his wife like [a lady]547-a lady , and never forgot the honour [she]293-his wife had conferred upon [him]51-mr. jones ; to this honour [Mrs. Jones]55-mrs. jones added , after three years , by presenting [him]51-mr. jones with [a sickly baby]548-a sickly baby , which , to [[its]548-a sickly baby mother]549-its mother 's name of [Mary]29-mary , proudly added that of [[its]548-a sickly baby maternal grandfather]550-its maternal grandfather [Smith]29-mary . [He]51-mr. jones reared [[his]51-mr. jones little baby]556-his little baby alone and unaided . During [[his]51-mr. jones wife]293-his wife 's lifetime , [he]51-mr. jones had been employed in [a large warehouse]560-a large warehouse ; but now , in order to stay at [home]1499-home , [he]51-mr. jones turned [basket - maker]562-basket - maker .
