"[51-mr. jones] Ay ; [the shop]266-the shop and [Mary!—ambition]56-mary!—ambition and love ! Ever since [he]51-mr. jones had dealt tea and sugar in [[Mr. Smith]57-mr. smith 's establishment]577-mr. smith 's establishment , [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones had been haunted with the desire to become [a tradesman]578-a tradesman , and do the same thing in [a shop of [his]51-mr. jones own]579-a shop of his own . But , conscious of the extravagant futility of this wish , [Jones]51-mr. jones generally consoled [himself]51-mr. jones with the thought that [[grocer]580-grocer 's shops]581-grocer 's shops were as thick as mushrooms , and that , capital or no capital , there was no room for [him]51-mr. jones . And now , as [he]51-mr. jones walked [home]1499-home , dreaming , [he]51-mr. jones could not but sigh , for there was [room]583-room , [he]51-mr. jones could not doubt it — but where was [the capital]584-the capital ? [He]51-mr. jones was still vaguely wondering in [his]51-mr. jones own mind , by what magical process the said capital could possibly be called up , when [he]51-mr. jones reached [[his]51-mr. jones own home]356-his own home . "[588-yours] [Yours]588-yours , " S. S. "[588-yours] This laconic epistle signified that [the firm in whose warehouse [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones was employed]589-the firm in whose warehouse richard jones was employed , had stopped payment [Rich men]590-rich men lost [their]590-rich men thousands , and eat none the worse a dinner ; [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones lost [his]51-mr. jones week 's wages , [his]51-mr. jones future employment , and remained stunned with the magnitude of the blow . [His]51-mr. jones first thought flew to [[his]51-mr. jones child]528-his child . " How shall [I]51-mr. jones pay [Miss Gray]28-miss gray for [[my]51-mr. jones little [Mary]29-mary 's keep]1570-my little mary 's keep ? "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones exclaimed , inwardly . Thank [God]31-god ! "[51-mr. jones] But , though this was some sort of comfort , the future still looked so dark and threatening , that [Jones]29-mary spent a sleepless night , tossing in [his]51-mr. jones bed , and groaning so loudly , that [[his]51-mr. jones landlady]593-his landlady forsook [her]593-his landlady couch to knock at [his]51-mr. jones door , and inquire , to [his]51-mr. jones infinite confusion , " if [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones felt poorly , and if there was anything [she]593-his landlady could do for [him]51-mr. jones , and if [he]51-mr. jones would like some hot ginger ? "[593-his landlady] To which [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones replied , with thanks , " that [he]51-mr. jones was quite well , much obliged to [her]593-his landlady all the same . "[51-mr. jones] After this significant hint , [he]51-mr. jones managed to keep quiet . Towards morning , [he]51-mr. jones fell asleep , and dreamed [he]51-mr. jones had found a purse full of guineas , and that [he]51-mr. jones was going to open [[a grocer]1560-a grocer 's shop]1561-a grocer 's shop , to be called the Teapot . [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones was sober , intelligent enough for what [he]51-mr. jones had to do , and not too intelligent — which is a great disadvantage ; [he]51-mr. jones bore an excellent character ; and yet , somehow or other , when [he]51-mr. jones searched for employment , there seemed to be no zoom for [him]51-mr. jones ; and had [he]51-mr. jones been [a philosopher]596-a philosopher , which , most fortunately for [his]51-mr. jones peace of mind , [he]51-mr. jones was not , [he]51-mr. jones must inevitably hare come to the conclusion , that in [this world]597-this world [he]51-mr. jones was not wanted . [We]598-we are not called upon to enter into the history of [his]51-mr. jones struggles . [He]51-mr. jones maintained a sort of precarious existence , now working at this , now working at that ; for [he]51-mr. jones was [a Jack of all trades]599-a jack of all trades , and could torn [his]51-mr. jones hand to anything , but certain of no continual employment . How [he]51-mr. jones went through it all , still paying [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , still keeping up a decent appearance , contracting no debts , the pitying eye which alone looks down on the bitter trials of [the poor]105-the poor , also alone knows . The poorer [a man]601-a man gets , the more [he]601-a man thinks of wealth and money ; the narrower does [the world]97-the world close around [him]601-a man , and all the wider grows the world of [his]601-a man charms . [The shop]266-the shop , which had only been a dormant idea in [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones 's mind , now became a living phantom ; day and night , mom and noon it haunted [him]51-mr. jones . When [he]51-mr. jones had nothing to do — and this was , unfortunately , too often the case — [he]51-mr. jones sought intuitively [the suburb where [Rachel Gray]21-rachel dwelt]604-the suburb where rachel gray dwelt ; ascertained , over and over , that within the mile circuit of that central point there did not exist [one grocer 's shop]605-one grocer 's shop , and finally determined that the precise spot where , for public benefit and its own advantage , [[a grocer]1560-a grocer 's shop]1561-a grocer 's shop should be , was just round the corner of [the street]134-the street next to that of [Rachel Gray]21-rachel , in [a dirty little house , now occupied by a rag and bottle establishment]609-a dirty little house , now occupied by a rag and bottle establishment , with very dirty windows , and a shabby black doll dangling like [a thief]610-a thief , over the doorway ; spite of which enticing prospect , [the rag and bottle people]611-the rag and bottle people seemed to thrive but indifferently , if one might judge from [the sulky , ill - tempered looking woman , whom [Jones]51-mr. jones always saw within , sorting old rags , and scowling at [him]51-mr. jones whenever [she]612-the sulky , ill - tempered looking woman , whom jones always saw within , sorting old rags , and scowling at him whenever she caught him in the act of peering in caught [him]51-mr. jones in the act of peering in]612-the sulky , ill - tempered looking woman , whom jones always saw within , sorting old rags , and scowling at him whenever she caught him in the act of peering in . There 's [a man]601-a man , [Sir]1577-sir , and [he]601-a man prowls around [the shop]266-the shop . ' Well , and what have [you]51-mr. jones got to say to that , [I]631-the old man should like to know ? "[631-the old man] [Jones]51-mr. jones , who never had a very ready tongue , and who was quite confounded at the accusation , remained dumb . " [I]631-the old man 'll tell [you]51-mr. jones what [you]51-mr. jones are , though , "[631-the old man] cried [the old man]631-the old man , [his]631-the old man voice rising still higher with [his]631-the old man wrath ; " [you]51-mr. jones are [a crawling , creeping , low , sneaking fellow]1607-a crawling , creeping , low , sneaking fellow ! "[631-the old man] " Now , [old gentleman]1608-old gentleman ! [I]51-mr. jones did n't ask to come in , did [I]51-mr. jones ? "[51-mr. jones] Spite of the excellence of the reasoning thus popularly expressed , [Jones]51-mr. jones perceived that [the old man]631-the old man was going to renew [his]631-the old man offensive language , and as [he]51-mr. jones wisely mistrusted [his]51-mr. jones own somewhat hasty temper , [he]51-mr. jones prudently walked [downstairs]522-downstairs , and let [himself]51-mr. jones out . But then [he]51-mr. jones reached [the street]134-the street , [the old man]631-the old man 's head was already out of the first - floor window , and [Jones]51-mr. jones turned the corner pursued with the words " creeping , "[51-mr. jones] " crawling . "[51-mr. jones] [He]631-the old man lost the rest . [Rachel]21-rachel sat alone , working and thinking . [The dull street]658-the dull street was silent ; the sound and stir of morning , alive elsewhere , reached it not ; but the sky was clear and blue , and on [that azure field]659-that azure field mounted the burning sun , gladdening [the very house - roofs]660-the very house - roofs as [he]631-the old man went , and filling with light and life [the quiet parlour of [Rachel Gray]21-rachel]661-the quiet parlour of rachel gray . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray was [an ignorant woman]662-an ignorant woman , and [she]22-mrs. gray spoke bad English ; but [her]22-mrs. gray literary tastes were superior to [her]22-mrs. gray education and to [her]22-mrs. gray language . [Her]22-mrs. gray few books were good — they were priceless ; they included the poetical works of one [John Milton]62-john milton . Whether [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray understood [him]62-john milton in all [his]62-john milton beauty and sublimity , [we]663-we know not , but at least , [she]22-mrs. gray read [him]62-john milton , seriously , conscientiously — and [many a fine lady]664-many a fine lady can not say as much . [Rachel]21-rachel , too , read [Milton]62-john milton , and loved [him]62-john milton as [a fine mind]665-a fine mind must ever love [that noble poet]666-that noble poet . That very morning , [she]21-rachel had been reading one of [his]62-john milton sonnets , too little read , and too little known . [We]663-we will give it here , for though , of course , all [[our]663-we readers]517-our readers are already acquainted with it , it might not be present to [their]517-our readers memory . " When [I]21-rachel consider how [my]21-rachel light is spent Ere half [my]21-rachel days , in this dark world and wide , And that one talent which is death to hide , Lodg'd with [me]21-rachel useless , though [my]21-rachel soul more bent , To serve therewith [[my]21-rachel Maker]1611-my maker , and present [My]21-rachel true account , lest [he]1611-my maker , returning , chide ; ' Doth [God]31-god exact day - labour , light denied ? ' [I]21-rachel fondly ask : but Patience to prevent That murmur , soon replies , ' [God]31-god doth not need [Either man]1612-either man 's work , or [his]1612-either man own gifts ; who best Bear [his]1612-either man mild yoke , [they]1613-they serve [him]1612-either man best ; [his]1612-either man state Is kingly ; thousands at [his]1612-either man bidding speed , And post o'er land and [ocean]1614-ocean without rest ; [They]1613-they also serve , who only stand and wait ' "[21-rachel] " ' [They]1613-they also serve who only stand and wait , ' "[21-rachel] thought [Rachel]21-rachel , brooding over the words , as was [her]21-rachel wo nt , " and that is [my]21-rachel case . "[21-rachel] [Her]21-rachel work dropt on [her]21-rachel lap ; and so deep was [her]21-rachel abstraction , that [she]21-rachel heard not the door opening , and saw not [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones , until [he]51-mr. jones stood within a few paces of [her]21-rachel chair . " [Mary]29-mary is very well , "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel said , hastily , and half smiling at the supposed alarm which had , [she]21-rachel thought , brought [him]51-mr. jones so suddenly in upon [her]21-rachel . " Of course [she]29-mary is — of course [she]29-mary is , "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones replied , nodding ; then , drawing a chair near to [Rachel]21-rachel 's , [he]51-mr. jones sat down upon it , and , bending forward , with [his]51-mr. jones two hands resting on [his]51-mr. jones knees , [he]51-mr. jones said , in a deep , impressive whisper , " [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , may [I]51-mr. jones speak to [you]28-miss gray ? " Yes , [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones firmly replied ; and , slightly clearing [his]51-mr. jones throat , [he]51-mr. jones thus began : " [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , [I]51-mr. jones ai nt a known [you]28-miss gray very long ; but there ai nt another in this wide world whom [I]51-mr. jones respect as [I]51-mr. jones do [you]28-miss gray . Now , this is the whole story : — "[51-mr. jones] From [a boy]668-a boy , [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , [I]0-i have wished to be in business . [I]0-i was in business at [[Mr. Smith]57-mr. smith 's]669-mr. smith 's , [Mr. Smith]57-mr. smith was [the grandfather of [[my]0-i little Mary]1566-my little mary]670-the grandfather of my little mary , but not on [my]0-i account ; and that 's not quite the same thing , [you]672-you see . [I]0-i found out , too , that [the rag and bottle shop round the corner]678-the rag and bottle shop round the corner was just the place for [me]0-i , and [the people]679-the people left , too ; but bless [you]672-you . Well , [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , to make a long story short , [a cousin of mine]680-a cousin of mine has just died , and left [me]0-i all [she]680-a cousin of mine had , poor thing , and that was sixty pound . [Rachel the simpleton]21-rachel — [Rachel]21-rachel [the slighted and laughed - at dressmaker]1621-the slighted and laughed - at dressmaker ? [Poor fellow]1623-poor fellow ! [he]51-mr. jones had an excellent hearty some faith , much charity , but [the world]97-the world 's net was around [him]51-mr. jones . [His]51-mr. jones life was not like that of [Rachel Gray]21-rachel — [a heaven upon [earth]307-earth]1625-a heaven upon earth . And [Rachel , who laboured under the disadvantages of a narrow education]1627-rachel , who laboured under the disadvantages of a narrow education , and a narrow life , who had not enough knowledge and enough experience of human nature to understand clearly that there were states of mind worlds lower than [her]21-rachel own , did not suspect that [she]21-rachel had given [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones the worst of all advice — that which [the receiver]1628-the receiver can not follow . Alas ! who talks of [God]31-god now ! who listens like [Adam]63-adam in [Eden]12-eden to the voice of [the Lord]1489-the lord , and treasures in [his]1630-his or [her]1631-her own heart that source of all knowledge ? And [we]1632-we complain that [God]31-god goes away from [us]1632-we ; that [His]51-mr. jones face is dark , and behind the cloud ; that in the days of adversity [we]1632-we find [him]51-mr. jones not . [Jones]51-mr. jones rose confused , muttered thanks , then hastily changed the subject by asking to see [[his]51-mr. jones daughter]555-his daughter . Even as [he]51-mr. jones spoke , the door opened , and [Mary]29-mary entered . [She]29-mary did not show much pleasure or surprise on seeing [[her]29-mary father]287-her father ; it was not that [she]29-mary did not love [him]287-her father , but [she]29-mary was [a spoiled child]291-a spoiled child , too much accustomed to [his]287-her father fondness and devotion to set great value on either . [She]29-mary complained of the heat , then of the cold , sat down , got up again , and gave [herself]29-mary all the airs of [a precocious woman]1636-a precocious woman . [[Her]29-mary father]287-her father , leaning on [his]287-her father stick , looked at [her]29-mary with admixing fondness , and occasionally nodded and winked at [Rachel]21-rachel , as if inviting [her]21-rachel to admire likewise . At length , with a half stifled sigh — for [he]287-her father never parted from [[his]287-her father darling]558-his darling without regret — [he]287-her father again said [he]287-her father must go . "[692-father] And is it thus , indeed , that [fathers]693-fathers love [[their]693-fathers daughters]694-their daughters ? " thought [Rachel Gray]21-rachel , as [she]21-rachel sat alone in [the little back room]423-the little back room on the evening of that day . "[692-father] And is it thus , indeed ! Oh ! [[my]0-i father]1513-my father — [[my]0-i father]1513-my father ! " [She]21-rachel laid down the book [she]21-rachel had been attempting to read . [She]21-rachel leaned [her]21-rachel brow upon [her]21-rachel hand ; [she]21-rachel envied none , but [her]21-rachel heart felt full to over - flowing . Since the night when [she]21-rachel had gone to look at [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father , as [we]1643-we have recorded , [Rachel]21-rachel had not felt strong or courageous enough to attempt more . [Her]21-rachel nature was timid , sensitive and shrinking to a fault , and circumstances had made it doubly so , yet the repeated sight of [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones 's devoted love for [[his]287-her father child]528-his child , inspired [her]21-rachel with involuntary hope . [She]21-rachel had grown up in the belief of [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father 's rooted indifference ; might [she]21-rachel not have been mistaken ? was it not possible that [[his]287-her father daughter]555-his daughter could become dear to [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray , as [other daughters]1647-other daughters were dear to [[their]1647-other daughters father]1516-their father ? [Rachel]21-rachel had always cherished the secret hope that it would one day be so , but because that hope was so precious , [she]21-rachel had deferred risking it , lest it should perish irretrievably . [She]21-rachel now felt inwardly urged to make the attempt . Why should [she]21-rachel not , like [the prodigal son]1649-the prodigal son , rise and go to [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father ? "[0-i] [I]0-i will , " [she]21-rachel thought , clasping [her]21-rachel hands , [her]21-rachel cheeks flushing , [her]21-rachel eyes kindling , "[0-i] yes , [I]0-i will go to - morrow , and [[my]0-i father]1513-my father shall know [[his]1513-my father daughter]555-his daughter ; and , perhaps , who knows , perhaps [God Almighty]31-god will bless [me]0-i . " Here the sound of a sudden tumult in [the little court]1651-the little court close by , broke on the dream of [Rachel Gray]21-rachel . [She]21-rachel looked , and [she]21-rachel saw and heard [Madame Rose]47-madame rose gesticulating and scolding , to the infinite amusement of [a crowd of [boys]1653-boys]1652-a crowd of boys , who where teazing [the idiot girl]496-the idiot girl . The wrath of [Madame Rose]47-madame rose was something to see . Having first placed [[her]47-madame rose protege]1655-her protege behind [herself]47-madame rose for safety — as if [her]47-madame rose own little body could do much for the protection of another twice its size — [Madame Rose]47-madame rose next put [herself]47-madame rose in an attitude , then expostulated with , then scolded , then denounced [the persecutors of the helpless idiot]1656-the persecutors of the helpless idiot ; after which washing [her]47-madame rose hands of [them]1656-the persecutors of the helpless idiot , [she]47-madame rose walked backwards to [[her]47-madame rose cellar]466-her cellar , scorning to turn [her]47-madame rose back to [the foe]1658-the foe . But [the enemy]1659-the enemy , nothing daunted , showed evident intentions of besieging [her]47-madame rose in [[her]47-madame rose stronghold]1660-her stronghold , and though [Madame Rose]47-madame rose made [her]47-madame rose appearance at the window , armed with a broomstick , [she]47-madame rose failed to strike that terror into the hearts of [[her]47-madame rose assailants]1661-her assailants , which the formidable nature of the weapon warranted . Fortunately , however , for the peace of [the little French lady]1662-the little french lady , [that valiant knight - errant of modern times]1663-that valiant knight - errant of modern times , [the policeman]463-the policeman , having made [his]463-the policeman appearance at the entrance of [the court]490-the court , a scutter , then a rushing flight , were the immediate consequence . Ignorant of this fact , [Madame Rose]47-madame rose ascribed the result entirely to [her]47-madame rose own prowess , and in all peace of mind proceeded to cook [her]47-madame rose supper . Then followed the little domestic scenes which [Rachel]21-rachel liked to watch . As [Rachel]21-rachel looked , [she]21-rachel took a bold resolve , and this was to pay [Madame Rose]47-madame rose a visit . [They]1666-they had met , the day before , in [the street]134-the street ; and [Madame Rose]47-madame rose had addressed a long and voluble discourse to [Rachel]21-rachel , in French , concluding with an invitation to visit [her]47-madame rose , which [Rachel]21-rachel had understood , and smilingly accepted . And now was the favourable moment to carry this project into effect . From [the little room]432-the little room , [Rachel]21-rachel heard [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown 's loud voice below in [the parlour]510-the parlour . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray was fully engaged , and not likely to mind [[her]22-mrs. gray daughter]175-her daughter 's absence . Unheeded , [Rachel]21-rachel slipped out . A few minutes brought [her]21-rachel round to [the little courts]1671-the little courts and to [the house inhabited by [Madame Rose]47-madame rose]1672-the house inhabited by madame rose . It was dingy , noisy , and dirty ; and as [she]21-rachel groped and stumbled down [the dark staircase]1673-the dark staircase , [Rachel]21-rachel half repented haying come . The voice of [Madame Rose]47-madame rose directed [her]21-rachel to the right door — for there were several . [She]21-rachel knocked gently ; a shrill "[31-god] entrez , " which [she]21-rachel rightly interpreted as a summons to enter , was uttered from within ; and pushing the door open , [Rachel]21-rachel found [herself]21-rachel in the abode and presence of [Madame Rose]47-madame rose . [She]21-rachel was received with a storm of enthusiasm , that rather bewildered than pleased [her]21-rachel . [Madame Rose]47-madame rose welcomed [her]21-rachel in a torrent of speech , with a multiplicity of nods , and winks , and shrugs , and exclamations , so novel in the experience of [Rachel Gray]21-rachel , that [she]21-rachel began to wonder how much truth there might be in the epithet occasionally bestowed on [Madame Rose]47-madame rose . For , first of all , [she]21-rachel insisted on cooking a dish of onion soup for [her]21-rachel expressly , a kindness which [Rachel]21-rachel had all the trouble in [the world]97-the world to resist ; and next , this point settled , [she]21-rachel was loud and unceasing in the praise of [the poor idiot girl]1675-the poor idiot girl , who sat mowing in [her]21-rachel chair . [Rachel]21-rachel went and sat near [her]1675-the poor idiot girl , and spoke to [her]1675-the poor idiot girl , but [she]21-rachel only got an unintelligible murmur for a reply . [Madame Rose]47-madame rose shook [her]47-madame rose head , as much as to say that the attainments of [Mimi]64-mimi — so [she]47-madame rose called [her]64-mimi — did not include speech . But [Mimi]64-mimi was very good — very good indeed , only [she]64-mimi could not talk , which was "[31-god] bien dommage , " added [Madame Rose]47-madame rose , as , had [she]64-mimi only been able to speak , [Mimi]64-mimi would certainly have done it charmingly . "[31-god] [You]699-you should see [her]700-her eating onion soup , " enthusiastically added [Madame Rose]47-madame rose . "[699-you] It is beautiful ! " Then , seeing that [Rachel]21-rachel was engaged in scrutinizing , with a pitying glance , the ragged attire of [[her]21-rachel protege]1655-her protege , [Madame Rose]47-madame rose jealously informed [her]21-rachel that , as yet , the toilette of [Mimi]64-mimi had been a little neglected , certainly ; but that , "[31-god] with time , and the help of [God]31-god , " added [Madame Rose]47-madame rose , "[64-mimi] [Mimi]64-mimi should want for nothing . " "[0-i] [I]0-i have an old dress at [home]1499-home , that will just do for [her]700-her , " timidly said [Rachel]21-rachel "[0-i] Shall [I]0-i bring it to - morrow night ? " [Madame Rose]47-madame rose coughed dubiously — [she]47-madame rose had not understood ; but a perfect knowledge of the English tongue , in all its most delicate intricacies , was one of [her]47-madame rose vanities . So , bending [her]47-madame rose head of one side , and patting [her]47-madame rose ear , as if to imply that there lay the fault , [she]47-madame rose evidently requested [Rachel]21-rachel to repeat [She]21-rachel did so ; and this time , [Madame Rose]47-madame rose caught enough of [her]47-madame rose meaning to misunderstand [her]47-madame rose . "[0-i] [I]0-i understand — [I]0-i understand ! " [she]47-madame rose exclaimed , triumphantly ; and settling [Mimi]64-mimi in [her]64-mimi chair , [she]47-madame rose told [her]64-mimi to be good , for that [she]47-madame rose was only going to fetch [her]64-mimi an elegant dress presented to [her]47-madame rose by the goodness of [Mademoiselle]65-mademoiselle , and that [she]47-madame rose would be back in an incredibly short space of time ; after which exhortation , [Madame Rose]47-madame rose prepared to accompany [Rachel]21-rachel . In vain , [poor Rachel]21-rachel , alarmed at the prospect of [[her]21-rachel mother]174-her mother 's anger , endeavoured to explain that [she]21-rachel would bring the dress . [Madame Rose]47-madame rose , still triumphantly asserting that [she]47-madame rose understood , insisted on going out with [[her]47-madame rose guest]1678-her guest , and actually walked with [her]1678-her guest to [her]47-madame rose very door . In great trepidation , [Rachel]21-rachel opened it , and unconscious of peril or offence , [Madame Rose]47-madame rose entered , clattering along [the passage]1679-the passage in [her]47-madame rose wooden shoes ; but [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown 's voice was just then at the loudest ; the noise was not heeded . [Rachel]21-rachel took [her]1678-her guest up - stairs to [the little back - room]1680-the little back - room , and left [her]1678-her guest there , whilst [she]21-rachel looked in [the room which [she]21-rachel shared with [[her]21-rachel mother]174-her mother]1681-the room which she shared with her mother , for the dress [she]47-madame rose wished to give [Mimi]64-mimi ; [she]21-rachel soon came back with it , tied in a parcel , and now devoutly wished that [she]21-rachel could see [Madame Rose]47-madame rose safe out of [the place]112-the place . But [Madame Rose]47-madame rose was in no mood to go . [She]47-madame rose had recognized [the room]182-the room and window where [she]47-madame rose so often saw [Rachel]21-rachel ; and [she]47-madame rose intimated as much , by a lively pantomime ; first taking up a book , [she]47-madame rose held it before [her]47-madame rose , pretending to read ; then [she]47-madame rose pointed to [her]47-madame rose forehead , to imply that [Rachel]21-rachel was [a thinker]1685-a thinker ; and finally , to the horror and dismay of [Rachel]21-rachel , [Madame Rose]47-madame rose shut [her]47-madame rose eyes , opened [her]47-madame rose mouth , and warbled a sufficiently correct imitation of the old hundredth . The window was open ; and even [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown 's voice could not drown these strange tones . [They]1686-they reached the ear of [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray ; and before [Rachel]21-rachel had fairly recovered from the surprise and alarm into which the musical outburst of [Madame Rose]47-madame rose had thrown [her]21-rachel , [[her]21-rachel step - mother]288-her step - mother appeared at the door of [the little back room]423-the little back room , and , in stern and indignant accents , asked to know the meaning of what [she]288-her step - mother heard and saw . But , before [Rachel]21-rachel could reply , the French costume of [Madame Rose]47-madame rose had betrayed [her]21-rachel . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray was of Scotch descent , and [she]22-mrs. gray had some of the old puritan spirit , to which , in the course of a long life , [she]22-mrs. gray had added a plenteous store of stubborn English prejudices . [Madame Rose]47-madame rose was "[0-i] [an idolatrous furriner]702-an idolatrous furriner ! " "[703-a french beggar] [a French beggar]703-a french beggar ! " too ; and that [she]47-madame rose should have darkened [her]47-madame rose doors!—that [she]47-madame rose should be familiarly sitting under [[her]47-madame rose roof]1689-her roof — chattering and singing in [a back room]1690-a back room , with [[her]47-madame rose daughter]175-her daughter , was an intolerable insult , a wrong not to be borne . "[703-a french beggar] [I]0-i am amazed at [you]704-you , [Rachel]21-rachel ! " [she]0-i said , [her]0-i voice quivering with indignation . "[0-i] [I]0-i am amazed at [you]704-you . How dare [you]704-you do sich a thing ! " The tones and the attitude of [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray were not to be misunderstood ; nor was [little Madame Rose]47-madame rose so dull as to mistake [them]1692-them . [She]0-i saw that [her]0-i presence was not welcome , and , with great dignity , rose and took [her]0-i leave . Crimson with pain and shame , [Rachel]21-rachel followed [her]0-i out . [She]21-rachel gave [Madame Rose]47-madame rose an humble and imploring glance , as [they]1693-they parted at the door , as much , as to say , "[704-you] [You]704-you know [I]0-i could not help it . " But the appeal was not needed . To [her]21-rachel surprise , [Madame Rose]47-madame rose remained very good - humoured . [She]47-madame rose even laughed and shrugged [her]47-madame rose shoulders , French fashion , and indulged in a variety of pantomimic signs , closing with one more intelligible than the rest : a significant tap of [her]47-madame rose forefinger on [her]47-madame rose brown forehead , and by which [Madame Rose]47-madame rose plainly intimated it to be [her]47-madame rose firm conviction that the intellect of [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray was unfortunately deranged . Thus [they]1693-they parted . Violent were the reproaches with which [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray greeted [[her]22-mrs. gray daughter]175-her daughter 's reappearance . [She]22-mrs. gray exacted a strict and rigid account of the rise and progress of [Rachel]21-rachel 's acquaintance with [that "[0-i] mad French beggar]1695-that " mad french beggar ; " was horror - struck on learning that the back - room window had been made the medium ; and not satisfied with prohibiting future intercourse , took the most effective means to prevent it , by locking up [the guilty zoom]1696-the guilty zoom , and putting the key in [her]21-rachel pocket . To all this [Rachel]21-rachel submitted ; though , when [she]21-rachel saw the door of [[her]21-rachel much - loved retreat]1697-her much - loved retreat closing on [her]21-rachel , [her]21-rachel heart ached . But when , in the height of [her]22-mrs. gray anger , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray railed at [the poor little Frenchwoman]1698-the poor little frenchwoman , as little better than [an idolater]1699-an idolater or [an infidel]1700-an infidel , [Rachel]21-rachel felt as if it touched [her]21-rachel honour , not to suffer this slur on [[her]21-rachel humble friend]1701-her humble friend . "[0-i] [Mother]42-mother , " [she]0-i said , with some firmness , "[42-mother] [you]42-mother can not tell what [she]705-her is ; for [you]42-mother know nothing of [her]705-her , save by idle reports . [I]0-i have watched [her]705-her life day after day , and [I]0-i have seen that it is holy . And , [mother]1485-mother , " added [Rachel]21-rachel , slightly colouring , from the fervour with which [she]21-rachel felt and spoke , "[1485-mother] [you]1485-mother know it as [I]0-i do : all holiness comes from [God]31-god . " Unable to contradict , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray sniffed indignantly . Hard indeed were the days that followed for [Rachel Gray]21-rachel . The old quarrel had began anew . Why was [she]21-rachel not like [every one]1702-every one ? Why did [she]21-rachel pick up strange acquaintances?—above all , why did [she]21-rachel mope , and want to be in [the little back room]423-the little back room ? It was strange , and [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray was not sure that it was not wicked . If so , it was a wickedness of which [she]22-mrs. gray effectually deprived [Rachel]21-rachel , by keeping [the back room]1704-the back room locked , and the key in [her]21-rachel pocket . But , hard as this was , it was not all . Amongst [Rachel]21-rachel 's few treasures , were little pamphlets , tracts , old sermons , scraps of all sorts , a little hoard collected for years , but to their owner priceless . [She]21-rachel did not read them daily ; [she]21-rachel had not time ; but when [she]21-rachel was alone , [she]21-rachel took them oat , now and then , to look at and think over . On the day that followed the affair of [Madame Rose]47-madame rose , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray discovered [Rachel]21-rachel 's board . "[31-god] More of [Rachel]21-rachel 's rubbish ! " [she]22-mrs. gray thought , and [she]22-mrs. gray took the papers to [the kitchen]1705-the kitchen , and lit the fire with them forthwith . "[31-god] Oh , [mother]1485-mother ! what have [you]1485-mother done ! " cried [Rachel]21-rachel , when [she]21-rachel discovered [her]1485-mother loss . "[1485-mother] Well , what about it ? " tartly asked [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray . A few silent , unheeded tears [Rachel]21-rachel shed , but no more was said . But [her]21-rachel very heart ached ; and , perhaps , because it did ache , [her]21-rachel longing to go and see [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father returned all the stronger . The whole day , the thought kept [her]21-rachel in a dream . "[1485-mother] [I]0-i never saw [you]21-rachel so mopish , " angrily exclaimed [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , "[0-i] never ! " [Rachel]21-rachel looked up in [[her]21-rachel mother]174-her mother 's face , and smiled so pleasantly , that [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray was a little softened , [she]22-mrs. gray [herself]22-mrs. gray knew not why ; but the smile was so very sweet . And again [Rachel]21-rachel sat up that night , when all were sleeping in [the little house]1708-the little house ; again [she]21-rachel burned [her]21-rachel precious candle ends , and sat and sewed , to finish the last of the half - dozen of fine linen shirts , begun a year before , purchased with the few shillings [she]21-rachel could spare now and then from [her]21-rachel earnings , and sewed by stealth , in hours robbed from the rest of the night , after the fatigue of the day . But , spite of all [her]21-rachel efforts to keep awake , [she]21-rachel fell asleep over [her]21-rachel task . When [she]21-rachel awoke , daylight gleamed through the chinks of the shutters ; it was morning . [She]21-rachel opened the window in some alarm ; but felt relieved to perceive that it was early yet . [The street]134-the street was silent ; every window was closed ; the sky , still free from smoke was calm and pure ; there was a peace in this stillness , which moved the very heart of [Rachel Gray]21-rachel . [She]21-rachel thought of the calm slumbers of [the two millions]1710-the two millions , who , in a few hours , would fill [the vast city]1711-the vast city , with noise , agitation and strife ; and [she]21-rachel half sadly wondered that for the few years [man]392-man has to spend [here below]1713-here below , for the few wants and cravings [he]392-man derives from nature , [he]392-man should think it needful to give away the most precious hours of a short life , and devote to ceaseless toil every aspiration and desire of [his]392-man heart . It was too late to think of going to bed , which would , besides , have exposed [her]21-rachel to discovery . So , after uniting [her]21-rachel morning and evening prayers in one long and fervent petition of Hope and Love , [she]21-rachel went back to [her]21-rachel work , finished the little there was to do , then carefully folded up the six shirts , and tied them up in a neat parcel . When this was done , [Rachel]21-rachel busied [herself]21-rachel with [her]21-rachel usual tasks about [the house]110-the house , until [[her]21-rachel mother]174-her mother came down . It was no uncommon thing for [Rachel]21-rachel to get up early , and do the work , while [[her]21-rachel mother]174-her mother still slept ; and , accordingly , that [she]21-rachel should have done so , as [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray thought , drew forth from [her]21-rachel no comment on this particular morning . Everything , indeed , seemed to favour [her]21-rachel project ; for , in the course of the day , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray and [Jane]27-jane went out . [Rachel]21-rachel remained alone with [Mary]29-mary . "[0-i] Why , how merry [you]708-you are to - day , [Miss]1495-miss ! " said [Mary]29-mary , looking with wonder at [Rachel]21-rachel , as [she]29-mary busied [herself]29-mary about [the house]110-the house , singing by snatches . "[1495-miss] It is such a fine day , " replied [Rachel]21-rachel ; [she]21-rachel opened the parlour window ; in poured the joyous sunshine — the blue sky shone above [the dull brick street]1718-the dull brick street , and [the tailor]1719-the tailor 's thrush began to sing in its osier cage . "[1495-miss] A day to make one happy , " continued [Rachel]21-rachel ; and [she]21-rachel smiled at [her]21-rachel own thoughts ; for on such a beautiful day , how could [she]21-rachel but prosper ? "[29-mary] [Mary]29-mary , " [she]0-i resumed , after a pause , "[29-mary] [you]29-mary will not be afraid , if [I]0-i go out , and leave [you]29-mary awhile alone , will [you]29-mary ? " "[29-mary] [La]4-la , bless [you]29-mary ! no , [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , " said [Mary]29-mary , smiling . "[28-miss gray] Are [you]29-mary afraid when [you]29-mary are alone ? " [she]29-mary added , with a look of superiority ; for [she]29-mary , too , seeing [every one else around [her]29-mary]1720-every one else around her do it , unconsciously began to patronize [Rachel]21-rachel . "[28-miss gray] Oh , no ! " simply replied [Rachel Gray]21-rachel , too well disciplined into humility to feel offended with the pertness of [a child]1524-a child , "[28-miss gray] [I]0-i am never afraid ; but then , [I]0-i am so much older than [you]29-mary . However , since [you]29-mary do not mind it , [I]0-i shall go out . Either [Jane]27-jane or [[my]0-i mother]710-my mother will soon be in , and so [you]29-mary will not long remain alone , at all events . " "[29-mary] La , bless [you]29-mary ! [I]0-i do n't mind , " replied [Mary]29-mary , again looking superior . And now , [Rachel]21-rachel is gone out . [She]21-rachel has been walking an hour and more . Again , [she]21-rachel goes through [a populous neighbourhood]224-a populous neighbourhood , and through [crowded streets]1723-crowded streets ; but this time , in the broad daylight of a lazy summer afternoon . [Rachel]21-rachel is neither nervous nor afraid — not , at least , of anything around [her]21-rachel . On [she]21-rachel goes , [her]21-rachel heart full of hope , [her]21-rachel mind full of dreams . On [she]21-rachel goes : [street]1724-street after [street]1724-street is passed ; at length , is reached [the street where [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray]1726-the street where thomas gray , [the father of [Rachel]21-rachel]1727-the father of rachel , lives . [She]21-rachel stops at [the second - hand ironmonger]1728-the second - hand ironmonger 's and looks at the portraits and the books , and feels faint and hopeless , and almost wishes that [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father may not be within . [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray was at [his]40-thomas gray work , and there was a book by [him]40-thomas gray at which [he]40-thomas gray glanced now and then , [Tom Paine]66-tom paine 's "[0-i] Rights of [Man]392-man . " There was an empty pewter pot too , and a dirty public - house paper , from which [we]1730-we do not mean to have it inferred that [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray was given to intoxication . [He]40-thomas gray was essentially [a sober , steady man]1731-a sober , steady man , vehement in nothing , not even in politics , though [he]40-thomas gray was [a thorough Republican]1732-a thorough republican . [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray was planing sturdily , enjoying the sunshine , which fell full on [his]40-thomas gray meagre figure . It was hot ; but as [he]40-thomas gray grew old [he]40-thomas gray grew chilly , when , suddenly , a dark shadow came between [him]40-thomas gray and the light . [He]40-thomas gray looked up , and saw [a woman]564-a woman standing on the threshold of [[his]40-thomas gray shop]1734-his shop . [She]564-a woman was young and simply clad , tall and slender , not handsome , and very timid looking . "[392-man] Walk in [ma'am]13-ma'am , " [he]40-thomas gray said , civilly enough . [The stranger]1735-the stranger entered ; [he]40-thomas gray looked at [her]564-a woman , and [she]564-a woman looked at [him]40-thomas gray . "[392-man] Want anything ? " [he]40-thomas gray asked , at length . [She]564-a woman took courage and spoke . "[21-rachel] [My]0-i name is [Rachel]21-rachel , " [she]564-a woman said . [He]40-thomas gray said nothing . "[21-rachel] [Rachel Gray]21-rachel , " [she]564-a woman resumed . [He]40-thomas gray looked at [her]564-a woman steadily , but [he]40-thomas gray was still silent . "[21-rachel] [I]0-i am [[your]712-your daughter]713-your daughter , " [she]564-a woman continued , in faltering accents . "[713-your daughter] Well ! [I]0-i never said [you]0-i was not ; " [he]40-thomas gray answered rather drily . "[0-i] Come , [you]0-i need not shake so ; there 's a chair there . Take it and at down . " [Rachel]21-rachel obeyed ; but [she]21-rachel was so agitated that [she]21-rachel could not utter one word . [[Her]21-rachel father]287-her father looked at [her]21-rachel for awhile , then resumed [his]40-thomas gray work . [Rachel]21-rachel did not speak — [she]21-rachel literally could not . Words would have choked [her]21-rachel ; so it was [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray who opened the conversation . "[0-i] Well , and how 's [the old lady]714-the old lady ? " [he]40-thomas gray asked . "[714-the old lady] [[My]0-i mother]710-my mother is quite well , thank [you]0-i . [Sir]1577-sir , " replied [Rachel]21-rachel The name of [father]692-father was too strange to be used thus at first . "[1577-sir] And [you]0-i — how do [you]0-i get on ? [You]0-i 're [a milliner]717-a milliner , [stay - maker]718-stay - maker — ain't [you]0-i ? " "[717-a milliner] [I]0-i am [a dress - maker]137-a dress - maker ; but [I]0-i can do other work , " said [Rachel]21-rachel , thinking this , [poor girl]514-poor girl ! a favourable opening for [her]21-rachel present . "[0-i] [I]0-i have made these for [you]0-i , " [she]0-i added , opening and untying [her]0-i parcel ; and displaying the shirts to [[her]0-i father]287-her father 's view , and as [she]0-i did so , [she]0-i gazed very wistfully in [his]287-her father face . [He]287-her father gave [them]1740-them a careless look . "[0-i] Why , [[my]0-i good girl]720-my good girl , " [he]287-her father said , "[720-my good girl] [I]0-i have dozens of shirts — dozens ! " And [he]287-her father returned to [his]287-her father work , a moment interrupted . Tears stood in [Rachel]21-rachel 's eyes . "[0-i] [I]0-i am sorry , " [she]0-i began , "[0-i] but — but [I]0-i did not know ; and then [I]0-i thought — [I]0-i thought [you]0-i might like them . " "[0-i] ' Taint of much consequence , " [he]287-her father philosophically replied , "[720-my good girl] thank [you]720-my good girl all the same . [Jim]33-mrs. james , " [he]287-her father added , hailing [a lad who was passing by]1741-a lad who was passing by , "[33-mrs. james] just tell [them]721-them at [the ' Rose]722-the ' rose ' to send down a pint of half - and - half , will [you]720-my good girl ? [I]0-i dare say [you]720-my good girl 'll have something before [you]720-my good girl go , " [he]287-her father continued , addressing [[his]287-her father daughter]555-his daughter . "[0-i] If [you]720-my good girl 'll just look in there , " [he]287-her father added , jerking [his]287-her father head towards [the back parlour]640-the back parlour , "[720-my good girl] [you]720-my good girl 'll find some bread and cheese on the table , there 's a plate too . " [Rachel]21-rachel rose and eagerly availed [herself]21-rachel of this invitation , cold though it was ; [she]21-rachel felt curious too , to inspect , [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father 's domestic arrangements . [She]21-rachel was almost disappointed to find everything so much more tidy than [she]21-rachel could have imagined . [She]21-rachel had hoped that [her]21-rachel services as [house - keeper]1745-house - keeper might be more required , either then , or at some future period of time . [She]21-rachel sat down , but [she]21-rachel could not eat . "[720-my good girl] Here 's the half - and - half , " said [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father from [the shop]266-the shop . [Rachel]21-rachel went and took it ; [she]21-rachel poured out some in a glass , but [she]21-rachel could not drink ; [her]21-rachel heart was too full . "[720-my good girl] [You]720-my good girl 'd better , " said [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father , who had now joined [her]21-rachel . "[720-my good girl] [I]0-i can not , " replied [Rachel]21-rachel , feeling ready to cry , "[0-i] [I]0-i am neither hungry nor thirsty , thank [you]723-you . " "[0-i] Oh ! ai nt [you]720-my good girl ? " said [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father , "[0-i] yet [you]720-my good girl have a long walk [home]1499-home , [you]720-my good girl know . " It was the second time [he]287-her father said so . [Rachel]21-rachel looked up into [his]287-her father face ; [she]21-rachel sought for something there , not for love , not for fondness , but for the shadow of kindness , for that which might one day become affection — [she]21-rachel saw nothing but cold , hard , rooted indifference . The head of [Rachel]21-rachel sank on [her]21-rachel bosom , "[720-my good girl] The will of [God]31-god be done , " [she]21-rachel thought . With a sigh [she]21-rachel rose , and looked up in [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father 's face . "[31-god] Good bye , [father]692-father , " [she]21-rachel said , for [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father [she]21-rachel would call [him]287-her father once at least . "[692-father] Good bye , [Rachel]21-rachel , " [he]287-her father replied . [She]21-rachel held out [her]21-rachel hand ; [he]287-her father took it with the same hard indifference [he]287-her father had shown from the beginning . [He]287-her father did not seek to detain [her]21-rachel ; [he]287-her father did not ask [her]21-rachel to come again . [His]287-her father farewell was as cold as had been [his]287-her father greeting . [Rachel]21-rachel left [him]287-her father with a heart full to bursting . [She]21-rachel had not gone ten steps when [he]287-her father called [her]21-rachel . [She]21-rachel hastened back ; [he]287-her father stood on the threshold of [[his]287-her father shop]1734-his shop , a newspaper in [his]287-her father hand . "[21-rachel] Just take that paper , and leave it at the ' Rose , ' will [you]726-you ? [You]726-you ca n't miss the ' Rose'—it 's [the public - house]727-the public - house round the left - hand corner . " "[726-you] Yes , [father]692-father , " meekly said [Rachel]21-rachel . [She]21-rachel took the paper from [his]287-her father hand , turned away , and did as [she]21-rachel was bid . [Her]21-rachel errand fulfilled , [Rachel]21-rachel walked [home]1499-home . There were no tears on [her]21-rachel cheek , but there was a dull pain at [her]21-rachel heart ; an aching sorrow that dwelt there , and that — do what [she]21-rachel would — would not depart . In vain [she]0-i said to herself—"It[692-father] was just what [I]0-i expected ; of course , [I]0-i could not think it would come all in a day . Besides , if it be the will of [God]31-god , must [I]0-i not submit ? " still disappointment murmured : "[692-father] Oh ! but it is hard ! not one word , not one look , not one wish to see [me]0-i again ; nothing — nothing . " It was late when [Rachel]21-rachel reached [home]1499-home . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , confounded at [[her]22-mrs. gray step - daughter]312-her step - daughter 's audacity in thus again absenting [herself]22-mrs. gray without leave , had , during the whole day , amassed a store of resentment , which now burst forth on [Rachel]21-rachel 's head . [The irritable old lady]1756-the irritable old lady scolded [herself]1756-the irritable old lady into a violent passion . [Rachel]21-rachel received [her]21-rachel reproaches with more of apathy than of [her]21-rachel usual resignation . [They]1757-they were alone ; [Jane]27-jane and [Mary]29-mary had retired to [[their]1757-they room]1758-their room . [Rachel]21-rachel sat by the table where the supper things were laid , [her]21-rachel head supported by [her]21-rachel hand . At the other end of the table sat [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray erect , sharp , bitter ; scolding and railing by turns , and between both burned a yellow tallow candle unsnuffed , dreary looking , and but half lighting [the gloomy little parlour]1759-the gloomy little parlour . "[729-you] And so [you]729-you wo n't say where [you]729-you have been , [[you]729-you good - for - [nothing creature]731-nothing creature]730-you good - for - nothing creature , " at length cried [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , exasperated by [[her]22-mrs. gray daughter]175-her daughter 's long silence . [Rachel]21-rachel looked up in [[her]21-rachel step - mother]288-her step - mother 's face . "[729-you] [You]732-you did not ask [me]0-i where [I]0-i had been , " [she]0-i said deliberately . "[732-you] [I]0-i have been to see [[my]0-i father]1513-my father . " Not one word could [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray utter . The face of [Rachel]21-rachel , pale , desolate , and sorrow - stricken , told the whole story . [Rachel]21-rachel added nothing . [She]21-rachel , lit another candle , and merely saying , in [her]21-rachel gentle voice — "[732-you] Good night , [mother]1485-mother , " [she]21-rachel left [the room]182-the room . As [Rachel]21-rachel passed by [the little room of]1763-the little room of [the apprentices]347-the apprentices , [she]21-rachel saw a streak of light gliding out on [the landing]1765-the landing , through the half - open door . [She]21-rachel pushed it , and entered . [Jane]27-jane sat reading by the little table ; [Mary]29-mary lay in bed , but awake . "[1485-mother] [I]0-i did not know [you]735-you were up , " said [Rachel]21-rachel to [Jane]27-jane , "[735-you] and seeing a light , [I]0-i felt afraid of fire . " "[0-i] Not much fear of fire , " drily answered [Jane]27-jane . [Rachel]21-rachel did not heed [her]735-you — [she]21-rachel was bending over [Mary]29-mary . "[0-i] How are [you]735-you to - night , [Mary]29-mary ? " [she]21-rachel asked . "[29-mary] Oh ! [I]0-i am quite well , " pettishly answered [Mary]29-mary . [Rachel]21-rachel smoothed [the young girl]1766-the young girl 's hair away from [her]1766-the young girl cheek . [She]21-rachel remembered how dearly , how fondly loved was [that peevish child]1767-that peevish child ; and [she]21-rachel may be forgiven if [she]21-rachel involuntarily thought the contrast between that love , and [her]21-rachel own portion of indifference , bitter . "[0-i] [Mary]29-mary , " [she]21-rachel softly whispered , "[735-you] did [you]735-you say [your]735-you prayers to - night ? " "[735-you] Why , of course [I]0-i did . " "[0-i] And , [Mary]29-mary , did [you]735-you pray for [[your]735-you father]736-your father ? " "[735-you] [I]0-i wish [you]735-you would let [me]0-i sleep , " crossly said [the young girl]1766-the young girl . "[735-you] Oh ! [Mary]29-mary — [Mary]29-mary ! " exclaimed [Rachel]21-rachel , and there was tenderness and pathos in [her]21-rachel voice ; "[29-mary] [Mary]29-mary , [I]0-i hope [you]29-mary love [[your]29-mary father]736-your father — [I]0-i hope [you]29-mary love [him]736-your father . " "[0-i] Who said [I]0-i did n't ? " "[0-i] Ah ! but [I]0-i fear [you]29-mary do not love [him]736-your father as much as [he]736-your father loves [you]29-mary . " "[0-i] To be sure [I]0-i do n't , " replied [Mary]29-mary , who had grown up in the firm conviction that [children]294-children were [domestic idols , of which]1770-domestic idols , of which [fathers]693-fathers were [the born worshippers]1772-the born worshippers . "[0-i] But [you]29-mary must try — but [you]29-mary must try , " very earnestly said [Rachel]21-rachel . "[29-mary] Promise [me]0-i that [you]29-mary will try , [Mary]29-mary . " [She]0-i spoke in a soft , low voice ; but [Mary]29-mary , wearied with the discourse , turned [her]29-mary head away . "[29-mary] [I]0-i ca n't talk , [my]0-i back aches , " [she]0-i said peevishly . "[0-i] [Mary]29-mary 's back always aches when [she]29-mary do n't want to speak , " ironically observed [Jane]27-jane . "[29-mary] [You]29-mary mind [your]29-mary own business , will [you]29-mary ! " cried [Mary]29-mary , reddening , and speaking very fast . "[29-mary] [I]0-i do n't want [your]29-mary opinion , at all events ; and if [I]0-i did — " "[0-i] [I]0-i thought [you]29-mary could n't talk , [your]29-mary back ached so , " quietly put in [Jane]27-jane . [Mary]29-mary burst into peevish tears . [Jane]27-jane laughed triumphantly . [Rachel]21-rachel looked at [them]738-we both with mild reproach . "[27-jane] [Jane]27-jane , " [she]21-rachel said , "[27-jane] it is wrong — very wrong — to provoke another . [Mary]29-mary , [God]31-god did not give [us]738-we tears — and they are a great gift of [his]31-god mercy — to shed them so for a trifle . Do it no more . " [The two girls]1773-the two girls remained abashed . [Rachel]21-rachel quietly left [the room]182-the room . [She]21-rachel went to [her]21-rachel own . [She]21-rachel had prayed long that morning , but still longer did [she]21-rachel pray that night . For alas!—who knows it not — the wings of Hope would of [themselves]1775-themselves raise [us]738-we to [Heaven]304-heaven ; but hard it is for poor resignation to look up from [this sad earth]1777-this sad earth . [We]738-we were made to endure . [A Heathen philosopher]1778-a heathen philosopher held the eight of [the just man]1779-the just man 's suffering , worthy of [the Gods]67-the gods , and [Christianity]68-christianity knows nothing more beautiful , more holy , than the calm resignation of [the pure and the lowly]1780-the pure and the lowly , to the will of [[their]738-we Divine Father]1781-their divine father . It was the will of [Heaven]30-heaven that [Rachel]21-rachel should not be beloved of [[her]21-rachel earthly father]1782-her earthly father . [She]21-rachel bore [her]21-rachel lot — not without sorrow ; but , at least , without repining . Perhaps , [she]21-rachel was more silent , more thoughtful , than before ; but [she]21-rachel was not less cheerful , and in one sense [she]21-rachel was certainly not less happy . Affliction patiently borne for the love of the hand that inflicts it , loses half its sting . The cup is always bitter — and doubly bitter shall it seem to [us]738-we , if [we]738-we drink it reluctantly ; but if [we]738-we courageously dram it , [we]738-we shall find that the last drop is not like the rest It is fraught with a Divine sweetness — it is a precious balsam , and can heal the deepest and most envenomed wound . This pure drop [Rachel]21-rachel found in [her]21-rachel cup . It strengthened and upheld [her]21-rachel through [her]21-rachel trial . "[31-god] It is the will of [God]31-god , " [she]21-rachel repeated to herself—"It[31-god] is the will of [God]31-god ; " and those simple words , which held a meaning so deep , were to [Rachel]21-rachel fortitude and consolation . And in the meanwhile , the little world around [her]21-rachel , unconscious of [her]21-rachel sufferings and [her]21-rachel trials — for even [[her]21-rachel mother]174-her mother could not wholly divine them — went on its ways . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray grumbled , [Jane]27-jane was grim , [Mary]29-mary was peevish , and [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown occasionally dropped in "[31-god] to keep [them]739-them going , " as [she]21-rachel said [herself]21-rachel . As to [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones , [we]1784-our will not attempt to describe the uneasiness of mind [he]51-mr. jones endured in endeavouring to follow out [Rachel]21-rachel 's advice . [He]51-mr. jones did not understand its spirit , which , indeed , [she]21-rachel could not have explained . [They]1785-their who make the will of [God]31-god [their]1785-their daily law , are guided , even in apparently worldly matters,—not indeed , so as never to commit mistakes , which were being beyond humanity , but so , at least , as to err as little as possible concerning [their]1785-their true motives of action . [Our]1784-our passions are [our]1784-our curse , spiritual and temporal ; and the mere habit of subduing [them]1785-their gives prudence and humility in all things:—wisdom thus becomes one of the rewards which [God]31-god grants to [the faithful servant]1786-the faithful servant . But of this , what did [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones — [the most unspiritual of good men]1787-the most unspiritual of good men , know ? After three days spent in a state of distracting doubt , [he]51-mr. jones came to the conclusion that it was , and must be the will of [Heaven]30-heaven that [he]51-mr. jones should have [a shop]684-a shop . [Poor fellow]1623-poor fellow ! if [he]51-mr. jones took [his]51-mr. jones own will for that of [the Almighty]1790-the almighty , did [he]51-mr. jones fall into a very uncommon mistake ? Once , [his]51-mr. jones mind was made up , [he]51-mr. jones turned desperate , went and secured [the shop]266-the shop . [He]51-mr. jones had all the time been in a perfect fever , lest some other should forestall [him]51-mr. jones , after which [he]51-mr. jones became calm . "[31-god] Did not much care about [Miss Gray]28-miss gray 's opinion — did not see why [he]740-he should care about [any one]741-any one 's opinion , " and in this lofty mood it was that [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones went and gave a loud , clear , and distinct knock at [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray 's door . Dinner was over — [the apprentices]347-the apprentices were working — [Rachel]21-rachel was dreaming , rather sadly , [poor girl]514-poor girl ! for [she]21-rachel thought of what was , and of what might have been . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray was reading the newspaper , when the entrance of [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones , admitted by [[his]51-mr. jones daughter]555-his daughter , disturbed [the quiet little household]1795-the quiet little household . At once [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray flew into politics . "[740-he] Well , [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones , " [she]0-i cried , "[51-mr. jones] and how are [you]51-mr. jones ? [I]0-i suppose [you]51-mr. jones know [they]742-they are raising the taxes — and then such rates as [we]743-we have , [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones — such rates ! " [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray was habitually [a Tory]1796-a tory , and not [a mild one]1797-a mild one ; but on the subject of taxes and rates , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray was , [we]743-we are sorry to say , [a violent radical]1798-a violent radical . "[0-i] [She]0-i could n't abide [them]742-they , " [she]0-i declared . "[0-i] And so [they]742-they axe raising the taxes , are [they]742-they ! " echoed [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones , chuckling . "[742-they] Eh ! but that wo n't do for [me]0-i , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray . [I]0-i 'm turning householder — and hard by here too ! " [he]51-mr. jones added , winking . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray did not understand at all . [She]22-mrs. gray coughed , and looked puzzled . [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones saw that [Rachel]21-rachel had not spoken to [her]22-mrs. gray . [He]51-mr. jones continued winking , chuckling , and rubbing [his]51-mr. jones hands as [he]51-mr. jones spoke . "[0-i] [I]0-i am going into business , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray . " [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray was profoundly astonished ; [Mary]29-mary 's work dropped on [her]22-mrs. gray lap as [she]22-mrs. gray stared with open mouth and eyes at [[her]22-mrs. gray father]287-her father , who chucked [her]22-mrs. gray chin for [her]22-mrs. gray . "[22-mrs. gray] Yes , " [he]51-mr. jones resumed , addressing [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray ; "[22-mrs. gray] [I]0-i had always a turn that way . " "[0-i] Oh , [you]0-i had ! " "[0-i] Always , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray ; but [I]0-i had n't got no capital ; and for [a man]601-a man to go into business without capital , why , [ma'am]1506-ma'am , it 's like [a body that ai nt got no soul]746-a body that ai nt got no soul . " "[1506-ma'am] Do n't talk so , [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones , " said [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , to whom the latter proposition sounded atheistical , "[51-mr. jones] do n't ! " "[51-mr. jones] Well , but what 's [a man without capital]747-a man without capital ? " asked [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones , unconscious of [his]51-mr. jones offence , "[22-mrs. gray] why , nothink , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , nothink ! Well , but that 's not the question — [I've]0-i got capital now , [you]22-mrs. gray see , and so [I]0-i am going to set up [a grocery business in [the rag and bottle shop round the corner]678-the rag and bottle shop round the corner]748-a grocery business in the rag and bottle shop round the corner ; and [I]0-i hare called to secure [your]22-mrs. gray custom — that 's all , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray . " [He]51-mr. jones winked and chuckled again . [Rachel]21-rachel could not help smiling . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray was grave and courteous , like [any foreign potentate congratulating [[his]51-mr. jones dear brother]1801-his dear brother]1800-any foreign potentate congratulating his dear brother , [Monsieur mon frere]1802-monsieur mon frere , on some fortunate event of [his]51-mr. jones reign . "[22-mrs. gray] [I]0-i called to tell [you]22-mrs. gray that , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , " resumed [Jones]51-mr. jones ; "[0-i] and , also , to ask a favour of [Miss Gray]28-miss gray . [I]0-i should be so much obliged to ' [her]28-miss gray , if [she]28-miss gray could spare [[my]0-i little Mary]1566-my little mary for half an hour or so , just to look over [the house]110-the house with [me]0-i . " "[28-miss gray] Of course [she]28-miss gray can , " replied [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray for [[her]22-mrs. gray meek daughter]1803-her meek daughter . "[28-miss gray] Go and put on [your]22-mrs. gray bonnet , [Mary]29-mary . ' " [Mary]29-mary , whom the tidings of [[the grocer]1804-the grocer 's shop]1805-the grocer 's shop had most agreeably excited , rose with great alacrity to obey , and promptly returned , with [her]29-mary bonnet on . It was [Rachel]21-rachel who let [them]1806-them out . "[22-mrs. gray] [You]22-mrs. gray need not be in a hurry to come back , [dear]1490-dear , " [she]0-i whispered ; "[22-mrs. gray] there 's not more work than [Jane]27-jane and [I]0-i can well manage . " [Mary]29-mary 's only reply to this kind speech , was a saucy toss of the head . [The little thing]1807-the little thing already felt [an heiress]1808-an heiress . "[0-i] How much money have [you]1490-dear got , [father]692-father ? " [she]29-mary promptly asked , as [they]1806-them went down [the street]134-the street , "[692-father] Sixty pounds , [[my]0-i dear]1542-my dear . " "[692-father] Law ! that ai n't much , " said [Mary]29-mary , as if [she]29-mary had rolled in guineas all [her]29-mary life . "[692-father] Well , it is n't , " [he]692-father replied candidly , and exactly in the same spirit ; for if there is a thing [people]1503-people promptly get used to , it is money . [Mary]29-mary had always been [[her]29-mary father]287-her father 's confidante ; [he]692-father now opened [his]692-father whole heart to [her]29-mary , and was thereby much relieved . To [his]692-father great satisfaction , [Mary]29-mary condescended to approve almost without restriction , all [he]692-father had done . [She]29-mary accompanied [him]692-father over [the house]110-the house and [shop]1589-shop — thought "[692-father] the whole concern rather dirty , " but kindly added , "[692-father] that when it was cleaned up a bit , it would do ; " and finally gave it as [her]29-mary opinion , "[692-father] that there was n't a better position in [the whole neighbourhood]755-the whole neighbourhood . " "[0-i] Of course there ai n't , " said [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones , sitting down on the counter . "[0-i] [The goodwives]756-the goodwives must either buy from [me]0-i , or walk a mile . Now it stands to reason that , rather than walk a mile , with [babies]383-babies crying at [home]1499-home , and [husbands]544-husbands growling — it stands to reason , [I]0-i say , that [they]756-the goodwives 'll buy from [me]0-i . Do n't it , [Mary]29-mary ? " "[29-mary] Of course it does . " "[29-mary] Well , that ai n't all . [You]29-mary see [I]0-i know something of business . The interest of capital in business ranges from ten to a hundred per cent according to luck ; now [I]0-i am lucky being alone , so [we]760-we 'll say fifty per cent , which is moderate , ai n't it , [Mary]29-mary ? " "[29-mary] Of course it is , " replied [that infallible authority]1814-that infallible authority . "[29-mary] Well then : capital , sixty pounds ; interest , fifty per cent . Why , in no time , like , [I]0-i shall double [my]0-i capital ; and when it 's doubled , [I]0-i shall double it again — and so [I]0-i 'll go on doubling and doubling until [I]0-i 'm tired — and then [we]760-we 'll stop . Wo n't [we]760-we , [Mary]29-mary ? " [The little thing]1807-the little thing laughed ; [[her]29-mary father]287-her father gave [her]29-mary a kiss ; got up from the counter , and with the golden vision of endless doubling of capital before [him]287-her father , walked out of [the shop]266-the shop . What [airs little Mary]29-mary took ; how [Jane]27-jane taunted and twitted [her]29-mary , how [Rachel]21-rachel had to interfere ; how even [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown chose to comment on the startling fact of [[a new grocer]1818-a new grocer 's shop]1819-a new grocer 's shop , and what predictions [she]32-mrs. brown made , [we]760-we leave to the imagination of [the reader]1820-the reader . [We]760-we deal with the great day , or rather with the eve of the great day . It was come . [Rachel]21-rachel , [[her]29-mary mother]174-her mother , [Mary]29-mary , and [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones were all busy giving [the shop]266-the shop its last finishing touch ; on the next morning the Teapot was to open . "[29-mary] Well , [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , ' tain't amiss , is it ? " said [Jones]51-mr. jones , looking around [him]51-mr. jones with innocent satisfaction . [He]51-mr. jones was , as [we]760-we have said before , a sort of Jack - of - all - trades , and to [him]51-mr. jones the Teapot doubly owed its existence . [He]51-mr. jones had painted the walls ; [he]51-mr. jones had fixed up the shelves in their places ; the drawers and boxes [his]51-mr. jones own hands had fashioned . [We]760-we will not aver that [a professional glazier and carpenter]1823-a professional glazier and carpenter might not have done all this infinitely better than [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones , but who could have worked so cheap or pleased [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones so well ? And thus with harmless pleasure [he]51-mr. jones could look around [him]51-mr. jones and repeat : "[28-miss gray] Well , [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , ' tain't amiss , is it ? " "[28-miss gray] Amiss ! " put in [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , before [[her]22-mrs. gray daughter]175-her daughter could speak , "[0-i] [I]0-i should think not . [You]761-your 're [a clever man]762-a clever man , [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones , to have done all that with [your]761-your own hands , out of [your]761-your own head . " [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones rubbed [his]51-mr. jones forehead , and passed [his]51-mr. jones hand through [his]51-mr. jones stubby hair . "[51-mr. jones] Well , [Ma'am]1506-ma'am , ' tain't amiss , though [I]0-i say it that should n't , and though ' tain't much . " "[692-father] Not much , [father]692-father ! " zealously cried [Mary]29-mary , not relishing so much modesty , "[692-father] why , did n't [you]692-father nail them shelves with [your]692-father own hands ? " "[692-father] Well , [child]765-child , " candidly replied [[her]29-mary father]287-her father , "[692-father] [I]0-i think [I]0-i may say [I]0-i did . " "[28-miss gray] And did n't [you]692-father paint the walls ? " triumphantly exclaimed [Mary]29-mary , without heeding [his]692-father orders . "[692-father] Who else did , [I]0-i should like to know ? " "[692-father] And the counter ! who made the counter ? " "[0-i] Not [I]0-i , [Mary]29-mary . [I]0-i only polished it up . " "[0-i] Well , but what was it before [you]692-father polished it up , [father]692-father ? " asked [the pertinacious daughter]1826-the pertinacious daughter . "[692-father] Not much to speak of ; that 's the truth . Why , bless [you]29-mary , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , " [he]692-father added , turning confidentially towards [her]29-mary , "[22-mrs. gray] [you]29-mary never saw such a poor object as that counter was in all [your]29-mary born days . It caught [my]0-i eye at the corner of one of [them second - hand shops in [the New Cut]770-the new cut]769-them second - hand shops in the new cut . [The man]771-the man was standing at the door , whistling , with [his]771-the man hands in [his]771-the man pockets . ' That 's fire - wood , ' says [I]0-i to [him]771-the man . ' No ' tain't , it 's as good a counter as ever a sovereign was changed on . ' ' [[My]0-i good man]772-my good man , ' says [I]0-i , ' it 's firewood , and [I]0-i 'll give [you]771-the man five shillings for it . ' Law , but [you]773-you should have seen how [he]771-the man looked at [me]0-i . Well , to cut a long story short , [he]771-the man swore it was a counter , and [I]0-i swore it was firewood , and so , at length , [I]0-i give [him]771-the man ten shillings for it , and brought it [home]1499-home and cleaned it down , and scraped the dirt , inch thick , off , and washed it , and painted it , and polished it , and look at it now , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , look at it now ! " "[22-mrs. gray] It 's just like mahogany ! " enthusiastically cried [Mary]29-mary , "[22-mrs. gray] ai n't it . [Miss Gray]28-miss gray ? " "[28-miss gray] Not quite , [dear]1490-dear , " mildly said [Rachel]21-rachel , who was truth itself , "[28-miss gray] but it looks very nice . " [Jones]51-mr. jones wagged [his]51-mr. jones head , winked , and touching [his]51-mr. jones nose with [his]51-mr. jones right hand forefinger , [he]51-mr. jones whispered knowingly : "[51-mr. jones] That was business , [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , and in business , [you]28-miss gray know — hem ! " "[28-miss gray] But the Teapot , [father]692-father , " cried [Mary]29-mary , "[692-father] where 's the Teapot ? " "[692-father] Why , here 's the Tea - pot , " exclaimed [Jones]29-mary , suddenly producing this masterpiece of art , and holding it up aloft to the gaze of [the beholders]1827-the beholders . Such a Teapot had never been seen before , and , most probably , will never be seen again , to the end of time . Its shape [we]1828-we will not , because [we]1828-we can not describe . It confounded [Rachel]21-rachel , and startled even [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray . [She]22-mrs. gray coughed , and looked at it dubiously . "[692-father] Where 's the lid ? " [she]22-mrs. gray said . "[692-father] Why , here 's the lid ; but it do n't take off , [you]51-mr. jones know . " "[51-mr. jones] Oh ! [I]0-i see . And that 's the handle . " "[692-father] The handle ! bless [you]51-mr. jones , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , it 's the spout . " "[22-mrs. gray] Well , but where 's the handle , then ? " "[22-mrs. gray] Why , here 's the handle , to be sure , " replied [Jones]29-mary , rather nettled , "[28-miss gray] do n't [you]28-miss gray see ? " [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray said [she]22-mrs. gray did ; but [we]1828-we are inclined to believe [she]22-mrs. gray did not . However , [Jones]29-mary was satisfied ; and , setting down the wooden Teapot — [we]1828-we forgot to say that it was flaming red — on the counter , [he]692-father surveyed [it]1829-it complacently . "[28-miss gray] [I]0-i spent a week on that Teapot , " [he]692-father said "[0-i] did n't [I]0-i , [Mary]29-mary ? " "[29-mary] Ten days , [father]692-father . " "[692-father] Well , [one]779-one must not grudge time or trouble , must one , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray ? And now , [ladies]780-ladies , [we]781-we 'll put away the Teapot , and step into [the parlour]510-the parlour , and have a cup of tea , eh ? " With the cup of tea , came a discussion of the morrow 's prospects , and of the ultimate destinies of the Teapot — the upshot of which was , that [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones was [an enterprising public man]1830-an enterprising public man , and destined to effect a salutary revolution in [the whole neighbourhood]755-the whole neighbourhood . Such , at least , was the opinion of [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , warmly supported by [Mary]29-mary . [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones was silent , through modesty ; [Rachel]21-rachel , because [she]21-rachel was already thinking of other things . [They]781-we parted late , though the Teapot was to open early . There is a report that it opened with dawn , [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones not having been able to shut [his]51-mr. jones eyes all night for excitement . But it is more important to record that , until its close , late on the following evening , the Teapot was not one moment empty . [Mary]29-mary had remained at [home]1499-home , to assist [[her]29-mary father]287-her father ; and [she]29-mary went through the day with perfect composure ; but [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones was fairly overpowered : the cup of [his]51-mr. jones honours was too full ; the sum of [his]51-mr. jones joy was too great . [He]51-mr. jones blundered , [he]51-mr. jones stammered , [he]51-mr. jones was excited , and looked foolish . Altogether , [he]51-mr. jones did not feel happy , until [the shop]266-the shop was shut , and all was fairly over . [He]51-mr. jones then sat down , wiped [his]51-mr. jones forehead , and declared , that since [he]51-mr. jones was married to [[his]51-mr. jones dear little [Mary]29-mary 's blessed mother]1835-his dear little mary 's blessed mother , [he]51-mr. jones had never gone through such a trying day — never . "[779-one] It 's a fine thing [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones has undertaken , " gravely observed [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray to [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown . But [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown was inclined to look at the shady side of the Tea - pot . "[51-mr. jones] La bless [you]51-mr. jones ! " [she]0-i kindly said , "[51-mr. jones] it 'll never do . [I]0-i said so from the first , and [I]0-i say so the last , it 'll never do ! " "[0-i] Oh , yes it will ! " grimly observed [Jane]27-jane ; "[0-i] it will do for [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones , [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown . " "[32-mrs. brown] [I]0-i hope not , [Jane]27-jane , " said [Rachel]21-rachel , gravely ; "[27-jane] and [I]0-i would rather , " [she]0-i added , with some firmness , and venturing for once on a reproof , "[0-i] [I]0-i would rather [you]51-mr. jones did not think so much of what evil may happen to [others]109-others . Sufficient to any of [us]784-us is it to look forward to [our]784-us own share of evil days . " [She]0-i raised [her]0-i voice as [she]0-i began ; but it sank low ere [she]0-i concluded . Surprised at [herself]0-i for having said so much , [she]0-i did not look round , but resumed [her]0-i work , a moment interrupted . [The room]182-the room remained deeply silent [Jane]27-jane was crimson . For once , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray thought [[her]22-mrs. gray daughter]175-her daughter had spoken sensibly ; and for once , [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown found nothing to say . A week had passed over the Teapot , and , sitting in the back - parlour with [Mary]29-mary , who was busy sewing , [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones dived deep into [his]51-mr. jones books , and cast up [his]51-mr. jones accounts . [He]51-mr. jones allowed for rent , for expenditure , for [household]1838-household , for extras , then [his]51-mr. jones face , brimful of ill - disguised exultation , [he]51-mr. jones said to [[his]51-mr. jones daughter]555-his daughter : "[29-mary] Well , [Mary]29-mary , [dear]1490-dear , ' taint much to boast of , but for a first week , [you]29-mary see , ' taint amiss , either . [I]0-i find , all expenses covered , one pound ten net profit . Now , [you]29-mary know , that makes , first , fifty - two pound a - year ; then half of fifty - two , twenty - six ; add twenty - six to fifty - two , seventy - eight — seventy - eight pound a - year , net - profit . Well , it stands to reason and common sense , that as [I]0-i go on , [my]0-i business will go on improving too ; in short , put it at the lowest — [I]0-i hate exaggeration — well put it at the lowest , and [I]0-i may say that by next [Michaelmas]69-michaelmas , [we]786-we shall have a neat hundred . " "[0-i] Law ! [father]692-father , ca n't [you]692-father say a hundred and fifty at once , " peevishly interrupted [Mary]29-mary . [Mary]29-mary 's will was law . "[692-father] Well , [I]0-i really think [I]0-i can say a hundred and fifty , " ingenuously replied [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones , "[0-i] now , with a hundred and fifty pound for the first year , and just five per cent , as increase of profit for the second . " "[0-i] [I]0-i 'm sure it 'll be ten per cent , " again interrupted [Mary]29-mary , who , from hearing [[her]29-mary father]287-her father , had caught up some of the money terms of this money - making world . "[0-i] Well , [I]0-i should not wonder if it would not , " replied [[her]29-mary docile papa]1841-her docile papa . "[0-i] [We]786-we 'll suppose it , at least ; well that 'd be fifteen pound to add to the hundred and fifty , or , rather , to the three hundred , and then for the next year it would be — let [me]0-i see ! Ah ! " and [he]1841-her docile papa scratched [his]1841-her docile papa head . "[0-i] [I]0-i think [I]0-i am getting into what [they]788-they call compound interest , and , to say the truth , [I]0-i never was [a very quick arithmetician]789-a very quick arithmetician . At all events , it is pretty clear that at the end of ten years , [we]786-we shall stand at the head of something like fifteen hundred pound , and a flourishing house of business , " [he]1841-her docile papa added , glancing towards [the shop—"a[29-mary] flourishing house of business]1842-the shop—"a flourishing house of business , " [he]1841-her docile papa continued , complacently passing [his]1841-her docile papa Angers through [his]1841-her docile papa hair . "[29-mary] [I]0-i think [myself]0-i [you]29-mary do n't look half so well as [you]29-mary used to , and though [Miss Gray]28-miss gray is as nice a person as [one]779-one need wish to meet , [I]0-i think [she]28-miss gray might have perceived it before this ; but interest blinds [us]793-us all — [every one of [us]793-us]794-every one of us , " [he]1844-he added , with a philosophic sigh over the weaknesses of humanity . Law ! bless [you]29-mary , [child]765-child , [I]0-i have got quite beyond troubling [my]0-i poor brains with what [other people]796-other people thinks ; and if [I]0-i choose to keep [[my]0-i daughter]791-my daughter at [home]1499-home now that [I]0-i can afford to do so , why should n't [I]0-i ? It 's a hard case , if , when [a man]601-a man 's well off and comfortable , and getting on better and better every day — it 's a hard case , indeed , if [he]601-a man ca n't keep [[his]601-a man only child]800-his only child with [him]601-a man . " This matter decided , [Mary]29-mary went up to [[her]29-mary room]1845-her room ; [[her]29-mary father]287-her father remained by the fireside , looking at the glowing coals , and dreaming to [his]287-her father heart 's content . "[601-a man] If [I]0-i go on prospering so , " [he]287-her father thought , "[601-a man] why should [I]0-i not take — in time , of course — [some smart young fellow]801-some smart young fellow to help [me]0-i in [the shop]266-the shop ? [they]803-customers hate waiting , " [he]287-her father added , thoughtfully , addressing the fire , and giving it a poke , by way of comment , "[803-customers] [the ladies]805-the ladies always hate it .
