" [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones gave the fire another poke . In the burning coals [he]51-mr. jones saw a pleasing vision rise . [He]51-mr. jones saw [[his]51-mr. jones shop full of [customers]803-customers]1847-his shop full of customers ; [he]51-mr. jones served with slow dignity , assisted by [a "[806-some smart young man] tight , brisk young fellow , " busy as a bee , active as a deer]1849-a " tight , brisk young fellow , " busy as a bee , active as a deer , for it was Saturday night , and [the fair maids and [matrons of the vicinity]1851-matrons of the vicinity]1850-the fair maids and matrons of the vicinity were all impatient . Then from Saturday it was Sunday ; [the shop]266-the shop was closed , [the street]134-the street was silent . [Young Thomson]71-young thomson was brushing [his]71-young thomson coat in [the yard]441-the yard and whistling ; [Mary]29-mary was [upstairs]1855-upstairs dressing ; another five minutes , and [she]29-mary comes down in straw bonnet lined with pink , clean printed muslin frock , mousseline - de - laine shawl , brown boots and blue parasol . [The happy father]1856-the happy father saw [them]1857-them going off together with delighted eyes and brimful heart Then other visions follow ; one of a wedding breakfast at which [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones sings a song , and another of [half a dozen grandchildren]1858-half a dozen grandchildren , all tugging at [his]1856-the happy father skirts , whilst [he]1856-the happy father solemnly rocks [the baby]283-the baby , and as solemnly informs [the infant]1860-the infant : "[810-he] that [he]810-he had done as much for [[its]810-he mother]549-its mother once . " [Peace]72-peace be with such dreams whenever [they]1857-them come to [[the poor man]527-the poor man 's hearth]1862-the poor man 's hearth ! A little surprised at not seeing [Mary]29-mary as usual on the following morning , and thinking [she]29-mary might be unwell , [Rachel Gray]21-rachel sent [Jane]27-jane to enquire . [Jane]27-jane soon returned , [her]27-jane face brimful of news . "[810-he] Well , " said [Rachel]21-rachel , "[810-he] how is [Mary]29-mary ? " And [Jane]27-jane sat down , and took up [her]27-jane work , and became deeply absorbed in a sleeve trimming . [Rachel]21-rachel reddened and looked pained . [She]21-rachel liked [Mary]29-mary ; [the pale , sickly child]1863-the pale , sickly child reminded [her]21-rachel strongly of [[her]21-rachel own lost sister]1864-her own lost sister , and though [she]21-rachel could allow for the natural tartness with which [Jane]27-jane had no doubt fulfilled [her]27-jane errand , yet [she]21-rachel knew that [Jane]27-jane was true , and that as [she]21-rachel represented it , the matter must be . " When [people]1503-people have done an insolent and ungrateful thing , [they]1503-people generally try to persuade [themselves]1503-people that it was a spirited , independent sort of thing ; and so now endeavoured to think [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones and [[his]51-mr. jones daughter]555-his daughter — but in vain . " [Mary]29-mary was too childish , and had ever been too much indulged to care for consistency . "[0-i] It 's natural , [I]0-i suppose , " [he]51-mr. jones thought , "[0-i] it 's natural ; " and when [he]51-mr. jones entered [the shop]266-the shop , where [Mary]29-mary sat sulking behind the counter , and [he]51-mr. jones told [her]29-mary that [she]29-mary might go back to [Miss Gray]28-miss gray 's , and when [he]51-mr. jones saw [her]29-mary face light up with pleasure , [he]51-mr. jones forgot that , though natural , it was not pleasant . [She]22-mrs. gray scarcely looked at [that young lady]1894-that young lady the whole day , and when [she]22-mrs. gray was gone , and [Jane]27-jane had retired to [[her]27-jane little room]445-her little room , and [mother]1485-mother and [daughter]1897-daughter sat together , [Rachel]21-rachel got a lecture . " "[827-you] [She]828-the little hussy is but [a child]1524-a child , " gently observed [Rachel]21-rachel . "[833-the little imperent hussy] [The little imperent hussy]833-the little imperent hussy ! to think of playing [her]828-the little hussy tricks here ! " [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray remained mute . [She]22-mrs. gray looked back in the past for the image of [[her]22-mrs. gray lost child]1898-her lost child . [She]22-mrs. gray saw a pale face , with blue eyes and fair hair , like [Mary]29-mary 's . Never before had the resemblance struck [her]22-mrs. gray ; when it came , it acted with overpowering force on a nature which , though rugged , and stern , and embittered by age and sorrows , was neither cold nor forgetful . [One solitary love , but ardent and impassioned]1899-one solitary love , but ardent and impassioned , had [Sarah Gray]73-sarah gray known , in [her]73-sarah gray life of three - score and ten — the love of [a harsh , but devoted mother]1900-a harsh , but devoted mother for [an only child]1901-an only child . [Rachel]21-rachel was [the sister of [[her]73-sarah gray [Jane]27-jane]1905-her jane]1907-the sister of her jane . Never should [Rachel]21-rachel want , whilst [she]21-rachel had heart and hands to work , and earn [her]21-rachel a bit of bread . ' " [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray rose to leave [the room]182-the room . On the threshold , [she]22-mrs. gray turned back to say in a low , sad voice : "[685-the child] [The child]685-the child may come to - morrow , [Rachel]21-rachel . " [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray had never cared about [Mary Jones]29-mary ; [she]22-mrs. gray had always thought [her]29-mary what [she]29-mary was indeed — [a sickly and peevish child]1917-a sickly and peevish child . But now [her]22-mrs. gray heart yearned towards [the young girl]1766-the young girl , [she]22-mrs. gray [herself]22-mrs. gray would have been loth to confess why . [Mary]29-mary took it as a matter of course , [Jane]27-jane wondered , [Rachel]21-rachel well knew what had wrought such a change ; but [she]21-rachel said nothing , and watched silently . In softened tones , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray now addressed [the young girl]1766-the young girl . If [Rachel]21-rachel ventured to chide [Mary]29-mary , though ever so slightly , [[her]21-rachel step - mother]288-her step - mother sharply checked [her]21-rachel . "[685-the child] Let [the child]685-the child alone , " were [her]288-her step - mother mildest words . As to [Jane]27-jane or [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown , [they]1921-they both soon learned that [Mary Jones]29-mary was not to be looked at with impunity . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray wondered at [them]1921-they , [she]22-mrs. gray did , for teazing the poor little thing . In short , [Mary]29-mary was exalted to the post of favourite to [the ruling powers]1922-the ruling powers , and [she]29-mary filled it with dignity and consequence . But the watchful eye of [Rachel Gray]21-rachel noted other signs . [She]21-rachel saw with silent uneasiness , the fading eye , the faltering step , the weakness daily increasing of [[her]21-rachel step - mother]288-her step - mother ; and [she]21-rachel felt with secret sorrow that [she]21-rachel was soon to lose [this harsh , yet not unloving or unloved companion of [her]21-rachel quiet life]1924-this harsh , yet not unloving or unloved companion of her quiet life . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray complained one day of feeling weak and ailing . [She]22-mrs. gray felt worse the next day , and still worse on the third . And thus , day by day , [she]22-mrs. gray slowly declined without hope of recovery . [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray had a strong , though narrow mind , and a courageous heart . [She]22-mrs. gray heard [the doctor]1925-the doctor 's sentence calmly and firmly ; and virtues which [she]22-mrs. gray had neglected in life , graced and adorned [her]22-mrs. gray last hours and [her]22-mrs. gray dying bed . Meek and patient [she]22-mrs. gray bore suffering and disease without repining or complaint , and granted [herself]22-mrs. gray but one indulgence : the sight and presence of [Mary]29-mary . [The young girl]1766-the young girl was kinder and more attentive to [[her]1766-the young girl old friend]1927-her old friend than might have been expected from [her]1766-the young girl pettish , indulged nature . [She]1766-the young girl took a sort of pride in keeping [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray company , in seeing to [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray , as [she]1766-the young girl called it [Her]1766-the young girl little vanity was gratified in having [the once redoubtable Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray now wholly in [her]1766-the young girl hands , and in some sort a helpless dependent on [her]1766-the young girl good - will and kindness . It may be , too , that [she]1766-the young girl found a not unworthy satisfaction in feeling and proving to the little world around [her]1766-the young girl , that [she]1766-the young girl also was [a person of weight and consequence]1928-a person of weight and consequence . But [her]1766-the young girl childish kindness availed not . The time of [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray had come ; [she]1766-the young girl too was to depart from [a world where toil and few joys]1929-a world where toil and few joys , and some heavy sorrows had been [her]1766-the young girl portion . " And [she]21-rachel did not murmur , even in [her]21-rachel heart . [She]21-rachel did not find it hard that to the end [she]21-rachel should be slighted , and held as one of little worth . A little while after this , [Mrs. Gray]22-mrs. gray spoke again . "[845-dear mother] Where is [Mary]29-mary ? " [she]22-mrs. gray said . Sad and empty seemed [the house]110-the house to [Rachel Gray]21-rachel when [[her]21-rachel mother]174-her mother was gone . [She]21-rachel missed [her]174-her mother chiding voice , [her]174-her mother step , heavy with age , [her]174-her mother very scolding , which long habit had made light to bear . The solitude and liberty once so dear and so hardly won , now became painful and oppressive ; but [Rachel]21-rachel was not long troubled with either . [We]1939-we are told that "[864-he] [he]864-he whom [He]864-he loveth [He]864-he chasteneth ; " and [Rachel]21-rachel was not unloved , for [she]21-rachel , too , was to have [her]21-rachel share of affliction . Spite [her]21-rachel sickly aspect , [she]21-rachel enjoyed good health , and , therefore , when [she]21-rachel rose one morning , shortly after [[her]21-rachel mother]174-her mother 's death , and felt unusually languid and unwell , [Rachel]21-rachel was more surprised than alarmed . "[864-he] [La]4-la , [Miss]865-miss ! how poorly [you]865-miss do look ! " exclaimed [Jane]27-jane , laying down [her]27-jane work with concern . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not feel very well , " replied [Rachel]21-rachel , calmly , "[0-i] but [I]0-i do not feel very ill , either , " [she]0-i added , smiling . [Her]21-rachel looks belied [her]21-rachel words ; vainly [she]21-rachel endeavoured to work ; by the united entreaties of [Jane]27-jane and [Mary]29-mary , [she]21-rachel was at length persuaded to go up to [[her]21-rachel room]1845-her room . [She]21-rachel laid down on [her]21-rachel bed , and tried to sleep , but could not ; [she]21-rachel thought of [[her]21-rachel step - mother]288-her step - mother , so harsh , yet so kind in [her]288-her step - mother very harshness ; of [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father , so cold and unloving ; of [her]21-rachel silent , lonely life , and its narrow cares and narrow duties , above which smiled so heavenly a hope , burning like a clear star above [a dark and rugged valley]1944-a dark and rugged valley ; and with these thoughts and feelings , heightening them to intensity , blended the heat and languor of growing fever . When [Mary]29-mary came up to know if [Rachel Gray]21-rachel wanted anything , [she]29-mary found [her]21-rachel so ill that [she]29-mary could scarcely answer [her]29-mary question . [She]21-rachel grew rapidly worse . [The medical man who was called in]1945-the medical man who was called in , pronounced [her]21-rachel disease a slow fever , not dangerous , but wasting . [Rachel]21-rachel was too ill to speak much ; but [Madame Rose]47-madame rose spared [her]21-rachel the trouble by taking that task on [herself]47-madame rose ; indeed , [she]47-madame rose seemed willing to take a great deal on [herself]47-madame rose , and listless as [Rachel]21-rachel was , [she]21-rachel perceived with surprise that [Madame Rose]47-madame rose was in some measure taking possession of [[her]47-madame rose sick room]1957-her sick room . [She]21-rachel inquired after [Mimi]64-mimi . [Rachel]21-rachel was too ill and languid to resist ; and [Jane]27-jane and [Mary]29-mary , though [they]347-the apprentices resented the intrusion of [the foreigner]1960-the foreigner , were unable to eject [her]47-madame rose , for , by possession , which is acknowledged to be nine - tenths of the law , [Madame Rose]47-madame rose made [her]47-madame rose claim good , until [the enemy]1659-the enemy had abandoned all idea of resistance . And [a devoted nurse]1962-a devoted nurse [she]47-madame rose made , ever attentive , ever vigilant . For three months did [Rachel]21-rachel see , in [[her]21-rachel darkened room]1963-her darkened room , the active little figure of [the Frenchwoman]1964-the frenchwoman , either moving briskly about , or sitting erect in [her]1964-the frenchwoman chair , knitting assiduously , occasionally relieved , it is true , by [Jane]27-jane and [Mary]29-mary . [She]21-rachel saw it when [she]21-rachel lay in the trance of fever and pain , unable to move or speak ; in [her]21-rachel few moments of languid relief , it was still there , and it became so linked , in [her]21-rachel mind , with [[her]21-rachel sick room]1957-her sick room , that , when [she]21-rachel awoke one day free from fever , the delightful sensation that pain was gone from [her]21-rachel , like the weary dream of a troubled night fled in the morning , blended with a sense of surprise and annoyance at missing the nod and the smile of [Madame Rose]47-madame rose . [Rachel]21-rachel looked around [her]21-rachel wondering , and in looking , [she]21-rachel caught sight of the portly and vulgar figure of [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown ; [she]21-rachel saw [her]32-mrs. brown with some surprise , for [she]21-rachel knew that [that lady]518-that lady entertained a strong horror of [a sick room]1967-a sick room . "[0-i] It 's only [me]0-i ! " said [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown , nodding at [her]871-you . "[0-i] [You]871-you are all right now , [[my]0-i girl]1493-my girl . [Rachel]21-rachel felt too weak to dispute [her]21-rachel authority , but when [Jane]27-jane came up , [she]27-jane again inquired after [Madame Rose]47-madame rose . [Jane]27-jane drily said it was all right , and that [Miss Gray]28-miss gray was to keep quiet ; and more than this [she]27-jane would not say . The fever had left [Rachel]21-rachel . [She]21-rachel was now cured , and rapidly got better ; but still , [she]21-rachel did not see [Madame Rose]47-madame rose , and was favoured with more of [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown 's company than [she]21-rachel liked . At length [she]21-rachel one day positively exacted an explanation from [Jane]27-jane , who reluctantly gave it . "[871-you] Law bless [you]871-you , [Miss]1495-miss ! " [she]27-jane said , ' "[1495-miss] tain't worth talking about . " "[32-mrs. brown] But what brought [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown [here]1531-here ? " asked [Rachel]21-rachel , who had heard [her]21-rachel with much surprise . [Jane]27-jane looked embarrassed , but was spared the trouble of replying by the voice of [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown , who imperatively summoned [her]27-jane [downstairs]522-downstairs . [She]27-jane immediately complied , and left [Rachel]21-rachel alone . A mild sun shone in through the open window on [the sick girl]1969-the sick girl ; [she]1969-the sick girl had that day got up , for the first time , and sat in a chair with a book on [her]1969-the sick girl knees . But [she]1969-the sick girl could not read : [she]1969-the sick girl felt too happy , blest in that delightful sense of returning health which long sickness renders so sweet . [Her]1969-the sick girl whole soul overflowed with joy , thankfulness , and prayer , and for once the shadow of sad or subduing thoughts fell not on [her]1969-the sick girl joy . "[32-mrs. brown] Well , [[my]0-i girl]1493-my girl , and how are [you]1493-my girl to - day ? " said the rough voice of [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown , who entered without the ceremony of knocking . [Rachel]21-rachel quietly replied that [she]21-rachel felt well — almost quite well . "[32-mrs. brown] Of course [you]1493-my girl do . So [I]0-i told [Jane]27-jane , all along , but [she]27-jane would n't believe [me]0-i . ' La bless [you]1493-my girl , [girl]879-girl ! " interrupted [Rachel]21-rachel , with a start . "[32-mrs. brown] Why , of course , [my]0-i money . Whose else ? Did n't [you]32-mrs. brown know of it ? " "[32-mrs. brown] Indeed , [I]0-i did not , " replied [Rachel]21-rachel , confounded . "[0-i] La ! what [a muff]1501-a muff [the girl]1536-the girl is ! " good - humouredly observed [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown . "[1501-a muff] And where did [you]0-i think , stupid , that the money [you]0-i have been nursed with these three months came from ? Why , from [my]0-i pocket , of course ; twenty pound three - and - six , besides a quarter 's rent , and another running on . " [Rachel]21-rachel was dismayed at the amount of the debt . When and how should [she]21-rachel be able to pay so large a sum ? Still , rallying from [her]21-rachel first feeling of surprise and dismay , [she]21-rachel attempted to express to [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown [her]21-rachel gratitude for the assistance so generously yielded , and [her]21-rachel hope of being able to repay it some day ; but [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown would not hear [her]21-rachel . "[21-rachel] Nonsense , [Rachel]21-rachel , " [she]0-i said , "[21-rachel] [I]0-i ai n't a - done more than [I]0-i ought to have done for [[my]0-i cousin 's step - daughter]882-my cousin 's step - daughter . And to whom should [Jane]27-jane , when [she]27-jane wanted money , have come , but to [me]0-i ? And as to paying [me]0-i , bless [you]21-rachel ! there 's no hurry , [Rachel]21-rachel . [I]0-i can afford , thank Heaven , to lend twenty pound , and not miss it . " This was kindness — such [Rachel]21-rachel felt it to be ; but , alas ! [she]21-rachel also felt that these was on [her]21-rachel , from that day , the badge of obligation and servitude . [She]21-rachel was still too weak to work ; [she]21-rachel had , dining [her]21-rachel long illness , lost the best part of [[her]21-rachel customers]1970-her customers ; until [her]21-rachel full recovery , [she]21-rachel was , perforce , cast on [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown for assistance , and , of [all persons]1971-all persons , [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown was the last not to take advantage of such a state of things . [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown came when [she]32-mrs. brown liked , said what [she]32-mrs. brown liked , and did what [she]32-mrs. brown liked in [[Rachel]21-rachel 's house]1972-rachel 's house . But , indeed , it was not [[Rachel]21-rachel 's house]1972-rachel 's house — it was [[Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown 's]1974-mrs. brown 's . [Rachel]21-rachel was [there]96-there on sufferance ; [the very bed on which [she]21-rachel slept]1976-the very bed on which she slept was [[Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown 's]1974-mrs. brown 's ; the very chair on which [she]21-rachel sat was [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown 's . So [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown felt , and made every one feel , [Rachel]21-rachel included . The effects of [her]32-mrs. brown rule were soon apparent . Every article of furniture changed its place ; [every household nook]1978-every household nook was carefully examined and improved , and [every luckless individual who entertained a lingering kindness for [Rachel Gray]21-rachel]1979-every luckless individual who entertained a lingering kindness for rachel gray , was affronted , and effectually banished from [the house]110-the house , from irascible [Madame Rose]47-madame rose down to peaceful [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones . [Rachel]21-rachel carried patience to a fault ; through [her]21-rachel whole life , [she]21-rachel had been taught to suffer and endure silently , and now , burdened with the sense of [her]21-rachel debt and obligation , [she]21-rachel knew not how to resist the domestic tyranny of [this new tormentor]1981-this new tormentor . The easiest course was to submit . To [Rachel]21-rachel it seemed that such , in common gratitude , was [her]21-rachel duty ; and , accordingly , [she]21-rachel submitted . But this was a time of probation and trial : as such [she]21-rachel ever looked back to it , in after life . To [Jane]27-jane , [her]21-rachel patience seemed amazing , and scarcely commendable . "[0-i] [I]0-i wonder [you]883-you can bear with [the old creetur]884-the old creetur , that [I]0-i do , " [she]0-i said , emphatically . "[0-i] [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown means kindly , " said [Rachel]21-rachel , "[32-mrs. brown] and [she]32-mrs. brown has been [a kind friend to [me]0-i]885-a kind friend to me , when [I]0-i had [no other friend]886-no other friend . [I]0-i may well hare a little patience . " "[0-i] A little patience ! " echoed [Jane]27-jane , indignantly , "[0-i] a little patience ! when [she]32-mrs. brown 's always at [you]883-you . " But [Rachel]21-rachel would hear no more on the subject . If [she]21-rachel bore with [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown , it was not to murmur at [her]21-rachel behind [her]21-rachel back . Yet [she]21-rachel was not so insensible to what [she]21-rachel endured , but that [she]21-rachel felt it a positive relief when [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown went and paid [one of [[her]32-mrs. brown nieces]1983-her nieces]1982-one of her nieces a visit in [the country]1488-the country , and for a few weeks delivered [the house]110-the house of [her]32-mrs. brown presence . Internally , [Rachel]21-rachel accused [herself]21-rachel of ingratitude because [she]21-rachel felt glad . "[32-mrs. brown] It 's very wrong of [me]0-i , [I]0-i know , " [she]0-i remorsefully thought , "[0-i] but [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i could not help it . " [Her]21-rachel health was now restored . [She]21-rachel had found some work to do ; with time [she]21-rachel knew [she]21-rachel should be able to pay [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown . [Her]21-rachel mind recovered its habitual tone ; old thoughts , old feelings , laid by during the hour of trial and sickness , but never forsaken , returned to [her]21-rachel now , and time , as it passed on , matured a great thought in [her]21-rachel heart . "[0-i] Who knows , " [she]21-rachel often asked [herself]21-rachel , in [her]21-rachel waking dreams , "[0-i] who knows if the hour is not come at last ? [[My]0-i father]1513-my father can not always turn [his]1513-my father face from [me]0-i . Love [me]0-i at once [he]1513-my father can not ; but why should [he]1513-my father not with time ? " Yet it was not at once that [Rachel]21-rachel acted on these thoughts . Never since [he]1513-my father had received [her]21-rachel so coldly , had [she]21-rachel crossed [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father 's threshold ; but often , in the evening , [she]21-rachel had walked up and down before [his]1513-my father door , looking at [him]1513-my father through the shop window with sad and earnest eyes , never seeking for more than that stolen glance , though still with the persistency of a fond heart , [she]21-rachel looked forward to a happier future . And thus [she]21-rachel lingered until one morning , when [she]21-rachel rose , nerved [her]21-rachel heart , and went out ; calmly resolved to bear as [others]109-others , to act . [She]21-rachel went to [[[her]21-rachel father]287-her father 's house]1989-her father 's house . [She]21-rachel found [him]1513-my father sturdy and stern , planing with the vigour of [a man in the prime of life]1990-a man in the prime of life . [His]1513-my father brow became clouded , as [he]1513-my father saw and recognized [[his]1513-my father daughter]555-his daughter 's pale face and shrinking figure . Still [he]1513-my father bade [her]21-rachel come in , for [she]21-rachel stood on the threshold timidly waiting for a welcome ; and [his]1513-my father ungraciousness was limited to the cold question of what had brought [her]21-rachel . "[0-i] [I]0-i am come to see [you]888-you , [father]692-father , " was [her]21-rachel mild reply . And as to this [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray said nothing , [Rachel]21-rachel added : "[692-father] [[My]0-i mother]710-my mother is dead . " "[0-i] [I]0-i know it , and have known it these three months , " [he]1513-my father drily answered . " A frown knit the rugged brow of [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray . " [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray looked steadily at [[his]1513-my father daughter]555-his daughter , and did not reply . But [Rachel]21-rachel , resolved not to be easily disheartened , persisted none the less . [I]0-i dare say [you]74-father are right , that [I]0-i am not worth much ; but still [I]0-i might be useful to [you]74-father . "[0-i] [He]74-father had heard [her]0-i out very quietly , and very quietly [he]74-father replied : " [Rachel]21-rachel , what did [I]74-father go to [America]6-america for ? " To be alone , "[74-father] [he]74-father resumed ; and [he]74-father spoke with some sternness , " to be alone . "[74-father] And [he]74-father went back to [his]74-father planing . The sentence which [he]74-father had uttered , rung in [her]21-rachel heart ; but [she]21-rachel did not venture to dispute its justice . [Her]21-rachel simple pleading had been heard and rejected . More than [she]21-rachel had said , [she]21-rachel could not say ; and it did not occur to [her]21-rachel to urge a second time the homely eloquence which had so signally failed when first spoken . But [she]21-rachel made bold to prefer a timid and humble petition . " Might [she]21-rachel come to see [him]893-the stern , selfish old man ? "[21-rachel] " What for ? "[40-thomas gray] [He]40-thomas gray looked at [her]21-rachel as [she]21-rachel stood there before [him]40-thomas gray , [a pale , sallow , sickly girl]897-a pale , sallow , sickly girl , then [he]40-thomas gray laughed disdainfully , and impatiently motioned [her]21-rachel away , as if [his]40-thomas gray temper were chafed at [her]21-rachel continued presence . Time had worn on : nine months in all had passed away since the opening of the Teapot . [We]905-we must be quite frank : [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones had not always made the one pound ten a week dear profit ; and of course this affected all [his]51-mr. jones calculations : the ten per cent for increase of gain included . There had been weeks when [he]51-mr. jones had not realized more than one pound , others when [he]51-mr. jones made ten shillings , ay and there had been weeks when all [he]51-mr. jones could do — if [he]51-mr. jones did do so — was to make both ends meet . It was odd ; but it was so . [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones was at first much startled ; but , [he]51-mr. jones soon learned to reconcile [himself]51-mr. jones to it . " It stands to reason , "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones philosophically observed to [Mary]29-mary , " it 's business , [you]29-mary see , it 's business . "[51-mr. jones] The words explained all . Another drawback was that [the front room]906-the front room which was worth five shillings a week , as [[his]51-mr. jones landlord]907-his landlord had proved to [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones in [their]908-their very first conversation , and for which [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones had therefore allowed — on the faith of [[his]51-mr. jones landlord]907-his landlord 's word — thirteen pounds a year in [his]51-mr. jones accounts — never let at all . This was the first intimation [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones received of the practical business truth , that it is necessary to allow for losses . [He]51-mr. jones had almost given up all thoughts of letting [this unfortunate room]910-this unfortunate room , and indeed the bill had had time to turn shabby and yellow in the shop window , when one morning [a young man]911-a young man entered [the shop]266-the shop and in a cool deliberate tone said : " Room to let ? "[29-mary] [He]1804-the grocer took [his]1804-the grocer hat , and walked out to seek [Mr. Smithson]77-mr. smithson , [an old and stiff dealer in earthenware , who lived within a stone's - throw of the Teapot]927-an old and stiff dealer in earthenware , who lived within a stone's - throw of the teapot . The day was fine , and [Mr. Smithson]77-mr. smithson was airing [his]77-mr. smithson pans and dishes , and setting them along the pavement , like traps for the feet of [unwary passengers]928-unwary passengers . " Good - morning to [you]77-mr. smithson , "[29-mary] began [Jones]29-mary , in a conciliating tone . " Good - morning ! "[29-mary] replied , or rather , grunted [Mr. Smithson]77-mr. smithson , without taking the trouble to look up . " [I]77-mr. smithson have just come round to inquire about [a young man]911-a young man — [his]911-a young man name is [Joseph Saunders]76-saunders . Do [you]77-mr. smithson know [him]911-a young man ? "[77-mr. smithson] " S'pose [I]77-mr. smithson do ? "[77-mr. smithson] answered [Mr. Smithson]77-mr. smithson too cautious to commit [himself]77-mr. smithson . "[929-the earthenware dealer] drily asked [the earthenware dealer]929-the earthenware dealer . " What for ! "[51-mr. jones] exclaimed [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones , beginning to lose [his]51-mr. jones temper , " why , because [he]911-a young man 's taken [[my]51-mr. jones front room]2034-my front room , and [I]51-mr. jones want to know what sort of a chap [he]911-a young man is , and because , too , [he]911-a young man has referred [me]51-mr. jones to [you]77-mr. smithson — that 's what for . "[51-mr. jones] " Well , then , "[77-mr. smithson] said [Mr. Smithson]77-mr. smithson , " [I]77-mr. smithson 'll just tell [you]77-mr. smithson this : first , [he]911-a young man 'll pay [his]911-a young man rent ; second , [he]911-a young man 'll give no trouble ; third , that 's all . "[77-mr. smithson] With which [Mr. Smithson]77-mr. smithson , who had for a moment looked up , and paused in [his]77-mr. smithson occupation , returned to [his]77-mr. smithson earthenware . " And what does [he]911-a young man do ? "[51-mr. jones] asked [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones , not satisfied with this brief account . " If [you]77-mr. smithson was to stay [here]1531-here from now till to - morrow morning , "[77-mr. smithson] surlily replied [Mr. Smithson]77-mr. smithson , " [you]77-mr. smithson 'd know no more from [me]77-mr. smithson . "[77-mr. smithson] [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones whistled , and walked off , with [his]51-mr. jones hands in [his]51-mr. jones pockets . [He]51-mr. jones had been guilty of the unpardonable sin of not purchasing a shilling 's worth of [Mr. Smithson]77-mr. smithson 's goods since [he]51-mr. jones had come to [the neighbourhood]106-the neighbourhood , and of course [Mr. Smithson]77-mr. smithson felt aggrieved . " Well , [father]692-father , "[29-mary] eagerly exclaimed [Mary]29-mary , as soon as [she]29-mary saw [[her]29-mary father]287-her father ; " who is [he]287-her father ? What is [he]287-her father ? "[51-mr. jones] interrupted [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones , " how am [I]51-mr. jones to know all that ? "[51-mr. jones] With which limited information [Mary]29-mary had , perforce , to remain satisfied . [The new lodger]932-the new lodger proved to be what [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones graphically termed " [a very buttoned - up sort of chap]2038-a very buttoned - up sort of chap ; "[51-mr. jones] [a tall , dark , silent , and reserved man , who paid [his]933-a tall , dark , silent , and reserved man , who paid his rent every week , went out early every morning , came home at ten every night , and vanished every sunday rent every week , went out early every morning , came [home]1499-home at ten every night , and vanished every Sunday]933-a tall , dark , silent , and reserved man , who paid his rent every week , went out early every morning , came home at ten every night , and vanished every sunday . [We]935-us have already hinted that [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones had a spice of curiosity ; this mystery teazed [him]51-mr. jones , and by dint of waylaying [[his]51-mr. jones guest]936-his guest both early and late , [he]51-mr. jones succeeded in ascertaining that [he]51-mr. jones had recently left [his]51-mr. jones situation in [a large house in [the city]938-the city]937-a large house in the city , and that [he]51-mr. jones was in search of another . No more did [Mr. Joseph Saunders]76-saunders choose to communicate ; but this was enough . " Now , "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones thought , " if [I]51-mr. jones could secure [such a young fellow as that]2039-such a young fellow as that ; it would be a capital thing for [me]51-mr. jones , and in time not a bad one for [him]51-mr. jones . Now [I]51-mr. jones should like to know what [man in [the city]938-the city]2042-man in the city will say to [him]51-mr. jones : ' [Saunders]76-saunders , [I]51-mr. jones 'll make a Co. of [you]76-saunders , and [you]76-saunders shall have [[my]51-mr. jones daughter]791-my daughter . ' "[51-mr. jones] Fully impressed with the importance of the proposal [he]51-mr. jones had to make , [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones accordingly walked up one morning to [[[his]51-mr. jones lodger]941-his lodger 's room]942-his lodger 's room ; and after a gentle knock , obtained admittance . " Going , [Sir]1577-sir ? "[51-mr. jones] faintly said [Jones]51-mr. jones . " Why yes ! "[922-the young man] replied [the young man]922-the young man , " [I]922-the young man have found a situation , and so [I]922-the young man am off naturally . [My]922-the young man week is up to - morrow , [I]922-the young man believe , but not having given notice , [I]922-the young man shall pay for next , of course . "[922-the young man] [He]922-the young man thrust [his]922-the young man hand in [his]922-the young man pocket as [he]922-the young man spoke . " Pray do n't mention it , "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones said hurriedly , " [your]51-mr. jones time 's up to - morrow , and so there 's an end of it all . "[51-mr. jones] Which words applied to the end of [his]51-mr. jones hopes , more than anything else . [Mr. Saunders]76-saunders gave [him]51-mr. jones a look of slight surprise , but said quietly : " No , no , [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones , what 's fair is fair . "[76-saunders] [He]922-the young man laid them on the table as [he]922-the young man spoke ; and resumed [his]922-the young man packing . [He]922-the young man forgot to ask what had brought [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones up to [[his]922-the young man room]586-his room , and [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones no longer anxious to tell [him]922-the young man , pocketed [his]922-the young man four shillings and withdrew hastily , under pretence that [he]922-the young man was wanted in [the shop]266-the shop . [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones had not acted in all this without consulting [[his]51-mr. jones daughter]555-his daughter ; [she]555-his daughter had tacitly approved [his]51-mr. jones plans , and when [he]51-mr. jones had imprudently allowed [her]555-his daughter to see how [he]51-mr. jones thought those plans likely to end by a matrimonial alliance between [herself]555-his daughter and [young Saunders]76-saunders , a faint blush had come over the poor little thing 's sallow face , and stooping to shun [[her]555-his daughter father]287-her father 's kind eye , [she]555-his daughter pretended to pick up a needle that had not fallen . And now [she]555-his daughter was waiting , below , for it was early yet , and [she]555-his daughter had not gone to [[Miss Gray]28-miss gray 's]949-miss gray 's — [she]555-his daughter was waiting to know the result of [[her]555-his daughter father]287-her father 's conference with [Mr. Saunders]76-saunders . No wonder that [he]51-mr. jones came down somewhat slowly , and not a little crest - fallen . All [he]51-mr. jones said was : " [He]51-mr. jones 's got a new situation , "[51-mr. jones] and whistling by way of showing [his]51-mr. jones utter unconcern , [he]51-mr. jones entered [the shop]266-the shop , where [a dirty child with its chin resting on the counter]952-a dirty child with its chin resting on the counter , was waiting to be served . [Mary]29-mary too had had [her]29-mary dreams , innocent dreams , made up of the shadow of love , and of the substance of girlish vanity . [The poor child]953-the poor child felt this blow , the first [her]953-the poor child little life had known , and childishly began to cry . [Her]953-the poor child eyes were red when [she]953-the poor child went to work , but [she]953-the poor child sat in shadow , and [Jane]27-jane , who seldom honoured [Miss Jones]29-mary with [her]27-jane notice , saw nothing . [Rachel Gray]21-rachel was too much absorbed in [her]21-rachel own thoughts to heed what passed around [her]21-rachel . It was only on [her]21-rachel return , that finding [Mary]29-mary in tears , [she]21-rachel drew from [her]21-rachel the little tale of [her]21-rachel hope and disappointment . It is not an easy task to console , even the lightest sorrow , for it is not easy to feel sympathy . Yet little as [her]21-rachel grave mind , and earnest heart could understand the troubles of [Mary Jones]29-mary , little as [she]21-rachel could feel in reality for the childish fancy to which [they]954-they owed [their]954-they birth , [Rachel]21-rachel felt for [the young girl]1766-the young girl 's grief , such as it was , and by sympathy and mild reasoning , [she]21-rachel soothed [Mary]29-mary , and sent [her]1766-the young girl [home]1499-home partly consoled . Of course , [Mr. Saunders]76-saunders was gone — [he]76-saunders had left too without any adieu or message . [Mary]29-mary 's vanity was as much hurt as [her]21-rachel heart . [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones was not habitually [a man of keen perceptions]957-a man of keen perceptions , but love is ever quick . It cut [him]51-mr. jones to the heart to see [his]51-mr. jones little [Mary]29-mary so woebegone . [He]51-mr. jones looked at [her]29-mary wistfully , tried to check a sigh , and said as brightly as [he]51-mr. jones could : " Cheer up , [Mary]29-mary ; law bless [[you]29-mary girl]2046-you girl , well have lots of [lodgers]2047-lodgers yet ; and as to that [Saunders]76-saunders , [I]51-mr. jones do n't so much care about it , now [he]76-saunders 's gone . [He]76-saunders was [a clever fellow]2048-a clever fellow , but [he]76-saunders had n't got no capital , and as to taking a Co. without capital , why none but [a good - natured easy fellow like [me]51-mr. jones]2049-a good - natured easy fellow like me would dream of such a thing now a days ; but , as [I]51-mr. jones said , [we]2050-we 'll have lots of [lodgers]2047-lodgers — [lots of [lodgers]2047-lodgers]2052-lots of lodgers . "[51-mr. jones] " [We]2050-we never had but that one all them nine months , "[29-mary] said [Mary]29-mary with some asperity . " [They]2054-they 're all a coming , "[287-her father] said [[her]29-mary father]287-her father gaily , " [They]2054-they 're all a coming . "[287-her father] And [he]287-her father said it in such droll fashion , and winked so knowingly that , do what [she]29-mary could , [Mary]29-mary could not but laugh . [Mary]29-mary was gone ; [Jane]27-jane , had come in but to go up to [[her]27-jane room]1845-her room . [Rachel]21-rachel sat alone in [the little parlour]1885-the little parlour , reading by candle - light . And did [she]21-rachel read , indeed ! Alas no ! [Her]21-rachel will fixed [her]21-rachel eyes on the page , but [her]21-rachel mind received not the impressions it conveyed . The sentences were vague and broken as images in a dream ; the words had no meaning . Outwardly , calm as ever did [Rachel]21-rachel seem , but there was a strange sorrow — a strange tumult in [her]21-rachel heart . That day the hope of years had been wrecked , that day [she]21-rachel had offered [herself]21-rachel , and been finally rejected . In vain [she]21-rachel said to [herself]21-rachel : " [I]21-rachel must submit — it is the will of [God]31-god , [I]21-rachel must submit . "[21-rachel] A voice within [her]21-rachel ever seemed to say : " [Father]692-father , [Father]74-father why hast [thou]2056-thou forsaken [me]21-rachel ! "[21-rachel] until , at length , [Rachel]21-rachel felt as if [she]21-rachel could bear no more . Sorrows endured in silence are ever doubly felt . The nature of [Rachel Gray]21-rachel was silent ; [she]21-rachel had never asked for sympathy ; [she]21-rachel had early been taught to expect and accept in its stead , [[its]961-its bitter step - sister]962-its bitter step - sister Ridicule . Derided , laughed at , [she]21-rachel had learned to dread that the look of [a human being]963-a human being should catch a glimpse of [her]21-rachel sorrows . If [her]21-rachel little troubles were thus treated — how would [her]21-rachel heavier griefs fare ? And now no more than ever did [Rachel]21-rachel trouble any with [her]21-rachel burden . Why should [she]21-rachel ? Who , what was [she]21-rachel that [others]109-others should care whether or not [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father loved [her]21-rachel ! That [he]287-her father did not sufficiently , condemned [her]21-rachel to solitude . The pitying eye of [God]31-god might , indeed , look down upon [her]21-rachel with tenderness and love , but from [[her]21-rachel brethren]966-her brethren [Rachel]21-rachel expected nothing . And thus it was that , on this night , after consoling the idle sorrows of [an indulged child]967-an indulged child , [Rachel]21-rachel , sitting in solitude , found the weight of [her]21-rachel own grief almost intolerable . Like [all shy and nervous persons]968-all shy and nervous persons , [she]21-rachel was deeply excitable . Anger [she]21-rachel knew not ; but emotions as vehement , though more pure , could trouble [her]21-rachel heart . And now [she]21-rachel was moved , and deeply moved , by a sense of injustice and of wrong . [[Her]21-rachel father]287-her father wronged [her]21-rachel — perhaps [he]287-her father knew it not ; but [he]287-her father wronged [her]21-rachel . " [God Almighty]31-god had not given [him]287-her father [a child]1524-a child , [she]21-rachel felt , to treat it thus , with mingled dislike and contempt Were there none to receive [his]287-her father slights and [his]287-her father scorn , but [[his]287-her father own daughter]2058-his own daughter ? "[21-rachel] [She]21-rachel rose , and walked up and down [the room]182-the room with some agitation . Then came calmer and gentler thoughts , moving [her]21-rachel heart until [her]21-rachel tears flowed freely . Had [she]21-rachel not failed that day — had [she]21-rachel not been too cold in [her]21-rachel entreaties , too easily daunted by the first rejection ? Had [she]21-rachel but allowed [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father to see the love , deep and fervent , which burned in [[his]287-her father daughter]555-his daughter 's heart — [he]287-her father would not , [he]287-her father could not so coldly have repelled and cast [her]21-rachel from [him]287-her father . " And why not try again ? "[21-rachel] murmured an inner voice ; " [the kingdom of [Heaven]30-heaven]2059-the kingdom of heaven is taken by storm — and what is [the kingdom of Heaven]2059-the kingdom of heaven , but [the realm of love]2061-the realm of love ? "[21-rachel] At first , this seemed a thought so wild , that [Rachel]21-rachel drew back from it in alarm , as from an abyss yawning at [her]21-rachel feet . But even as [our]973-our looks soon become familiar with images of the wildest danger , so the thought returned ; and [she]21-rachel shrank not back from it . Besides , what had [she]21-rachel to lose ? Nothing ! With a sort of despair , [she]21-rachel resolved to go and seek [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray , and attempt once more to move [him]40-thomas gray . " If [he]40-thomas gray rejects [me]21-rachel now , "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel added , inwardly , " [I]21-rachel shall submit , and trouble [him]40-thomas gray no more . "[21-rachel] The hour was not late ; besides , in [her]21-rachel present mood , the timid [Rachel]21-rachel felt above fear . [She]21-rachel was soon dressed — soon on [[her]21-rachel road]974-her road . This time neither annoyance nor evil befell [her]21-rachel . [She]21-rachel passed like a shadow through [crowds]975-crowds , and like a shadow was unheeded . The night was dark and dreary ; a keen wind whistled along [the streets]237-the streets — but for either cold or darkness [Rachel]21-rachel cared not . [Her]21-rachel thoughts flowed full and free in [her]21-rachel brain ; for once , [she]21-rachel felt that [she]21-rachel could speak ; and a joyful presentiment in [her]21-rachel heart told [her]21-rachel that [she]21-rachel would , and should be heard — and not in vain . Absorbed in those thoughts , [Rachel]21-rachel scarcely knew what speed [she]21-rachel had made , until , with the mechanical impulse of habit , [she]21-rachel found [herself]21-rachel stopping before [[the second hand ironmonger]977-the second hand ironmonger 's shop]978-the second hand ironmonger 's shop . Wakening as from a dream , and smiling at [herself]21-rachel , [she]21-rachel went on . [Rachel]21-rachel had expected to find [the shop of [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray]979-the shop of thomas gray closed , and [himself]40-thomas gray absent ; but the light that burned from [[his]40-thomas gray dwelling]980-his dwelling , and shed its glow on [the opposite houses]981-the opposite houses , made [her]21-rachel heart beat with joy and hope . Timidly , [she]21-rachel looked in through the glass panes ; [the shop]266-the shop was vacant ; [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father was , no doubt , in [the back parlour]640-the back parlour . [Rachel]21-rachel entered ; the door - bell rang . [She]21-rachel paused on the threshold , expecting to see [him]287-her father appear from within , nerving [herself]21-rachel to bear [his]287-her father cold look , and severe aspect ; but [he]287-her father came not [He]287-her father was either up - stairs , or in some other part of [the house]110-the house , or next door with [a neighbour]986-a neighbour . There was a chair in [the shop]266-the shop ; [Rachel]21-rachel took it , sat down , and waited — how long , [she]21-rachel [herself]21-rachel never knew ; for seconds seemed hours , and all true consciousness of time had left [her]21-rachel . At length , [she]21-rachel wondered ; then [she]21-rachel feared — why was [[[her]21-rachel father]287-her father 's house]1989-her father 's house so silent and so deserted ? [She]21-rachel went to the door , and looked down [the street]134-the street . [It]991-it was still and lonely ; [every house]992-every house was shot up ; and even from [the neighbouring thoroughfare]993-the neighbouring thoroughfare , all sounds of motion and life seemed gone . Suddenly [Rachel]21-rachel remembered [the little public - house to which [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father had once sent [her]21-rachel]994-the little public - house to which her father had once sent her . [She]21-rachel had often seen [him]287-her father going to [it]994-the little public - house to which her father had once sent her in the evening ; perhaps [he]287-her father was there now . In the shadow of [the houses]94-the houses , [she]21-rachel glided up to [the tavern]997-the tavern door — [it]998-it stood half open — [she]21-rachel cautiously looked in ; and standing , as [she]21-rachel did in the gloom of [the street]134-the street , [she]21-rachel could do so unseen . [The landlord]1000-the landlord sat dozing in the bar — [not a soul]1001-not a soul was with [him]1000-the landlord . [Rachel]21-rachel glanced at the clock above [his]1000-the landlord head ; it marked a quarter to twelve . Dismayed and alarmed , [she]21-rachel returned to [[[her]21-rachel father]287-her father 's house]1989-her father 's house . It so chanced , that as [she]21-rachel walked on the opposite side of [the narrow street]335-the narrow street , a circumstance that had before escaped [her]21-rachel notice , now struck [her]21-rachel . In [the room above [the shop of [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray]979-the shop of thomas gray]1005-the room above the shop of thomas gray , there burned a light . [She]21-rachel stopped short , and looked at [it]1007-it with a beating heart . [She]21-rachel felt sure [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father was there . [Rachel]21-rachel re - entered [the shop]266-the shop , and again sat down , resolved to be patient ; but [her]21-rachel nervous restlessness soon became intolerable . Seized with an indefinite fear , [she]21-rachel rose , took the light , and entered [the parlour]510-the parlour : [it]510-the parlour was vacant . Passing under a low door which [she]21-rachel found ajar , [she]21-rachel went up [a dark staircase]1011-a dark staircase . [It]1012-it ended with [a narrow landing]1013-a narrow landing , and a solitary door ; [she]21-rachel knocked , and got no reply ; [she]21-rachel tried it , it yielded to [her]21-rachel hand , and opened ; but [Rachel]21-rachel did not cross the threshold ; [she]21-rachel paused upon [it]1007-it , awe - struck at the sight [she]21-rachel saw . [The room]182-the room was [a small one]1015-a small one , poorly famished , with a low and narrow bed , a table and a few chairs . On the mantle - shelf burned a tallow light , dim and lurid for want of snuffing ; its dull glow fell on the motionless figure of [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray . [He]40-thomas gray sat straight and stiff in a wooden chair , with a hand resting on each arm . [His]40-thomas gray face was ghastly pale , and rigid as death ; [his]40-thomas gray eyes stared on the blank wall before [him]40-thomas gray , and seemed void of sight . " [[My]21-rachel father]1513-my father is dead , "[21-rachel] thought [Rachel]21-rachel . [She]21-rachel entered [the room]182-the room and went up to [him]40-thomas gray . But when [she]21-rachel laid [her]21-rachel hand on [his]40-thomas gray arm , a slight convulsive motion showed [her]21-rachel that [he]40-thomas gray still lived . Ay , [he]40-thomas gray lived , of that living death , which is worse than the true . [Paralysis]79-paralysis had fallen upon [him]40-thomas gray without warning . Like [a thief]610-a thief in the night it had come ; and in a few brief seconds it had laid low [the proud man]1018-the proud man 's strength . Of that strength [he]40-thomas gray had boasted in the morning ; twelve hours had not gone round — where was it now ? [Rachel]21-rachel did not lose [her]21-rachel presence of mind . How [she]21-rachel went out , found [a doctor]1019-a doctor , and brought [him]40-thomas gray back , [she]21-rachel never exactly knew ; but [she]21-rachel did it . [The medical man]1020-the medical man looked at [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray , then at [Rachel]21-rachel . " [You]21-rachel are [[his]40-thomas gray daughter]555-his daughter , "[1020-the medical man] [he]1020-the medical man said , kindly . " Yes , [sir]1577-sir , [I]1020-the medical man am . "[1020-the medical man] " Well , then , [[my]1020-the medical man poor girl]2065-my poor girl , [I]1020-the medical man am very sorry for [you]2065-my poor girl — very sorry . [[Your]2065-my poor girl father]736-your father may live years but [I]1020-the medical man can hold out no prospect of recovery . "[1020-the medical man] " None , [sir]1577-sir ? "[21-rachel] faltered [Rachel]21-rachel , looking wistfully in [his]1020-the medical man face . " Not the least . Better [I]21-rachel should tell [you]1020-the medical man so at once , than deceive [you]1020-the medical man . "[21-rachel] But [Rachel]21-rachel would not — could not believe [him]1020-the medical man . The sentence was too hard , too pitiless to be true . " [Father]692-father , [father]692-father ! do [you]1020-the medical man know [me]21-rachel ? "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel cried . [He]1020-the medical man stared vacantly in [her]21-rachel face . Did [he]1020-the medical man know [her]21-rachel ? Perhaps [he]1020-the medical man did . Who can tell how far the spirit lived in that dead body ? But if know [her]21-rachel [he]1020-the medical man did , gone was the time when [he]1020-the medical man could hold intercourse with [that long slighted , and now bitterly avenged daughter]1021-that long slighted , and now bitterly avenged daughter . In vain [she]21-rachel clung weeping around [his]1020-the medical man neck , in vain [she]21-rachel called on [him]1020-the medical man to reply . [He]1020-the medical man merely looked at [her]21-rachel in the same vacant way , and said childishly , " Never mind . "[1020-the medical man] " But [you]1020-the medical man know [me]21-rachel — [you]1020-the medical man know [me]21-rachel , [father]692-father ! "[21-rachel] said [Rachel]21-rachel . Again , [he]1020-the medical man looked at [her]21-rachel vacantly , and still the only words [he]1020-the medical man uttered were , " Never mind . "[1020-the medical man] " [His]631-the old man mind is gone for ever , "[1925-the doctor] said [the doctor]1925-the doctor . [Rachel]21-rachel did not answer . [She]21-rachel clasped [her]21-rachel hands , and looked with wistful sadness on [the old man]631-the old man 's blank face . With a pang [she]21-rachel felt and saw that now , indeed , [her]21-rachel dream was over — that never , never upon earth , should [she]21-rachel win that long hoped - for treasure — [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father 's love . In the grey of the morning , [Rachel]21-rachel brought [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father to [the humble little home which [he]631-the old man had voluntarily forsaken years before]1026-the humble little home which he had voluntarily forsaken years before . [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray was not merely [a paralyzed and helpless old man]1027-a paralyzed and helpless old man , [he]40-thomas gray was also destitute . Little more than what sufficed to cover [his]40-thomas gray current expenses did [Rachel]21-rachel find in [[his]40-thomas gray dwelling]980-his dwelling ; [his]40-thomas gray furniture was old and worthless ; and the good - will of the business scarcely paid the arrears of rent . But [the world]97-the world rarely gives [us]1030-us credit for good motives . It was currently reported that [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray was [a wealthy man]1031-a wealthy man , and that if [Rachel Gray]21-rachel did not let [him]40-thomas gray go to [the workhouse]1032-the workhouse , [she]21-rachel knew why . " As if [she]27-jane could n't let [him]40-thomas gray go , and keep [his]40-thomas gray money too , "[27-jane] indignantly exclaimed [Jane]27-jane , when [she]27-jane heard this slander ; and , as discretion was not [Jane]27-jane 's virtue , [she]27-jane repeated all to [Rachel Gray]21-rachel . [Poor Rachel]36-poor rachel coloured slightly . It seemed strange , and somewhat hard too , that [her]36-poor rachel conduct should be judged thus . But the flush passed from [her]36-poor rachel pale face , and the momentary emotion from [her]36-poor rachel heart . " Let [the world]97-the world think , and say what it likes , "[36-poor rachel] [she]36-poor rachel thought , " [I]36-poor rachel need not , and [I]36-poor rachel will not care . "[36-poor rachel] Not long after [Rachel]21-rachel brought [home]1499-home [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father , [Jane]27-jane left [her]21-rachel . The time of [her]21-rachel apprenticeship was out ; besides , [she]21-rachel was going to marry . [She]21-rachel showed more emotion on [their]1035-their parting , than might have been expected from [her]21-rachel . " God bless [you]21-rachel . [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , "[27-jane] [she]27-jane said several times ; " [God]2072-god bless [you]21-rachel — [you]21-rachel are [a good one]2073-a good one , whatever [the world]97-the world may think . "[27-jane] The praise was qualified , and , perhaps , [Rachel]21-rachel felt it to be so , for [she]21-rachel smiled ; but [she]21-rachel took it as [Jane]27-jane meant it — kindly . Amity and peace marked [their]1035-their separation . [Rachel]21-rachel now remained alone with [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father and [Mary]29-mary . [The young girl]1766-the young girl was not observant . [She]1766-the young girl saw but [a quiet woman]1038-a quiet woman , and [a helpless old man , with grey hair , and stern features blank of meaning]1039-a helpless old man , with grey hair , and stern features blank of meaning , who sat the whole day long by the fire - side , waited on by [[his]1039-a helpless old man , with grey hair , and stern features blank of meaning patient daughter]1040-his patient daughter . Sometimes , indeed , when [Rachel Gray]21-rachel attended on [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father with more than usual tenderness , when [she]21-rachel lingered near [his]287-her father chair , looking wistfully in [his]287-her father face , or with timid and tender hand gently smoothed away [his]287-her father whitened hair from [his]287-her father rugged brow , sometimes , then , [Mary]29-mary looked and wondered , and felt vaguely moved , but [she]29-mary was too childish to know why . And , indeed , the story of [Rachel]21-rachel 's life at this time can not be told . It was beautiful ; but its beauty was not of earth , and to earthly glance can not be revealed . It lay , a divine secret , between [her]21-rachel heart and [God]31-god . This peace was not destined to last [Rachel]21-rachel and [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father sat alone one morning in [the parlour]510-the parlour , when [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown , who had found the street door ajar , burst in without preliminary warning . [She]32-mrs. brown was scarlet , and looked in a towering passion . " [[You]287-her father audacious creatur]2075-you audacious creatur , "[32-mrs. brown] [she]32-mrs. brown screamed ; " [you]287-her father audacious hussey , how dare [you]287-her father bring [that man]2076-that man in [this house]124-this house — in [[my]32-mrs. brown house]2078-my house ! How dare [you]287-her father ? "[32-mrs. brown] " [He]2076-that man is [[my]21-rachel father]1513-my father , "[21-rachel] said [Rachel]21-rachel , confounded , both at the accusation , and at the unexpected appearance of [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown . The reply exasperated [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown . [She]32-mrs. brown had never felt any extraordinary friendship or affection for [[her]32-mrs. brown deceased cousin]1044-her deceased cousin ; but [she]32-mrs. brown had always entertained a very acute sense of [[her]32-mrs. brown cousin]1045-her cousin 's wrongs , and had accordingly honoured [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray with no small share of hatred and vituperation , and that [Rachel]21-rachel should not feel as [she]21-rachel did on the subject , or should presume to remember that [the sinner]1046-the sinner was [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father , was , in [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown 's eyes , an offence of the deepest dye . [She]32-mrs. brown gave [her]32-mrs. brown feelings free vent . [She]32-mrs. brown was [a vulgar woman]1048-a vulgar woman , and had a flow of vulgar eloquence at [her]32-mrs. brown command . [She]32-mrs. brown overwhelmed [Rachel]21-rachel and [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray with sarcasm , scorn and abuse , and [Rachel]21-rachel answered not one word , but heard [her]32-mrs. brown out , still as a statue , and pale as death . [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown , too , was pale , but it was with wrath . " Do [you]21-rachel know , "[32-mrs. brown] [she]32-mrs. brown added , trembling from head to foot with that passion , " do [you]21-rachel know that [I]32-mrs. brown could turn [you]21-rachel out on [the streets]237-the streets , [you]21-rachel and [[your]21-rachel beggarly father]2081-your beggarly father — do [you]21-rachel know that ? "[32-mrs. brown] [Rachel]21-rachel did know it , and groaned inwardly . [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown saw [her]21-rachel agony , and triumphed in the consciousness of [her]32-mrs. brown own power . But the very violence of [her]32-mrs. brown anger had by this time exhausted it ; [she]32-mrs. brown felt much calmer , and took a more rational view of things . " [I]32-mrs. brown am a fool to mind what a simpleton like [you]21-rachel does , "[32-mrs. brown] observed [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown , with that disregard of politeness which was one of [her]32-mrs. brown attributes ; " for , being [a simpleton]401-a simpleton , how can [you]21-rachel but do the acts of [a simpleton]401-a simpleton ? As to bringing [[your]21-rachel father]736-your father [here]1531-here , [you]21-rachel must have been mad to think of it ; for , if [you]21-rachel ca n't support [yourself]21-rachel , how can [you]21-rachel support [him]736-your father ? Well ! and what do [you]21-rachel stand dreaming there for ? Make [me]32-mrs. brown a cup of tea — will [you]21-rachel ? [I]32-mrs. brown am just ready to drop with it all . "[32-mrs. brown] As a proof of [her]32-mrs. brown assertion , [she]32-mrs. brown sank on the chair next [her]32-mrs. brown , took out [her]32-mrs. brown pocket - handkerchief , and began fanning [herself]32-mrs. brown . But , instead of complying with [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown 's orders , [Rachel Gray]21-rachel stood before [that lady]518-that lady motionless and pale . "[1052-he] But before [they]1053-we reached the door , [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown , to the surprise and dismay of [Rachel]21-rachel , went into violent hysterics . [She]21-rachel was [an over - bearing and ill - tempered woman]1054-an over - bearing and ill - tempered woman , but [her]21-rachel heart was not wholly unkind ; and on seeing that [Rachel]21-rachel so readily took [her]21-rachel at [her]21-rachel word , [she]21-rachel was overwhelmed with mingled rage and shame . A fit of weeping and bitter reproaches followed the hysterics ; and [Rachel]21-rachel was convicted of being [the most ungrateful creature on the face of [the earth]1057-the earth]1056-the most ungrateful creature on the face of the earth . In vain [Rachel]21-rachel attempted a justification ; [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown drowned [her]21-rachel in a torrent of speech , and remained [the most injured of [women]1059-women]1058-the most injured of women . The scene ended as such scenes ever end . There was a compromise ; [the victim]1060-the victim made every concession , and [the triumphant tyrant]1061-the triumphant tyrant gained more than [her]21-rachel point . In short , that [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father might not want the shelter of a roof , [Rachel]21-rachel agreed to remain in [the house]110-the house , and [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown kindly agreed to come and live in [it]110-the house , and use [Rachel]21-rachel as [[her]32-mrs. brown servant]1064-her servant and [domestic slave]1065-domestic slave , by which [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown , besides keeping [her]32-mrs. brown firm hold on [Rachel]21-rachel — no slight consideration with [one who loved power beyond everything else]1066-one who loved power beyond everything else — effected a considerable saving in [her]21-rachel income . " Oh ! [[my]21-rachel father]1513-my father — [[my]21-rachel father]1513-my father ! "[21-rachel] [She]21-rachel did not speak aloud , yet [he]287-her father seemed vaguely conscious that something lay on [her]21-rachel mind ; for [he]287-her father shook [his]287-her father head , and uttered [his]287-her father eternal " Never mind — never mind ! And [she]21-rachel did not mind ; but , alas ! what now was [her]21-rachel fate ? Ask it not . [She]21-rachel had made [her]21-rachel sacrifice in the spirit of utter abnegation , and none need count the cost which [she]21-rachel never reckoned . The same cloud of trouble and sorrow that now darkened the daily life of [Rachel Gray]21-rachel , soon gathered over [[her]21-rachel neighbours]1067-her neighbours and [friends]435-friends . With boding and pain , [she]21-rachel watched the coming of a calamity , to [them]1069-them still invisible . [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones got up one morning , and felt exactly as usual . [He]51-mr. jones took down [his]51-mr. jones shutters , and no presentiment warned [him]51-mr. jones of the sight that was going to greet [his]51-mr. jones eyes . The Teapot stood at the corner of [a street]1070-a street which had naturally another corner facing [it]1070-a street ; that corner — let it be angle , if [you]1071-you like , [critical reader]1072-critical reader — had , from time immemorial , been in the possession of [a brown , tottering , untenanted house , whose broken parlour windows [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones had always seen filled with , blank oak shutters , strong enough for security and closing within]1073-a brown , tottering , untenanted house , whose broken parlour windows mr. jones had always seen filled with , blank oak shutters , strong enough for security and closing within . " [I]51-mr. jones 'm [a lost man]2101-a lost man , "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones thought , " [they]1074-half - a - dozen workmen 're making a shop of it . "[51-mr. jones] And so [they]1074-half - a - dozen workmen were , but what sort of [a shop]684-a shop was it to be ? That was the question . [Jones]51-mr. jones lost no time ; [he]51-mr. jones put down [his]51-mr. jones shutter , thrust [his]51-mr. jones hands in [his]51-mr. jones pocket — [his]51-mr. jones usual resource when [he]51-mr. jones wanted to look unconcerned — sauntered awhile down [the street]134-the street , talked to [some children]1078-some children , and finally came back to [the workmen]1079-the workmen . [The workmen]1079-the workmen did not linger over [their]1079-the workmen task , indeed , [Mr. Smithson]77-mr. smithson took care that [they]1079-the workmen should not . Night and morning , the whole day long , [Jones]51-mr. jones saw [him]77-mr. smithson after [them]1079-the workmen ; [he]51-mr. jones watched [him]77-mr. smithson through the pots of Scotch marmelade that decorated the front of [[his]77-mr. smithson shop]1734-his shop window , and internally admired the indefatigable zeal [Mr. Smithson]77-mr. smithson displayed . Humbly , too , [he]51-mr. jones contrasted it with [his]51-mr. jones own deficiencies in that respect " [I]51-mr. jones ai n't got no spirit ; that 's the fact of it , "[51-mr. jones] confessed [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones in [his]51-mr. jones own heart . In a comparatively short space of time , [the bricklayers]1086-the bricklayers had done [their]1086-the bricklayers task ; [they]1086-the bricklayers were succeeded by [the carpenters , who proved as zealous and as active]1087-the carpenters , who proved as zealous and as active . And now fear and trembling once more seized the heart of [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones . What were [those busy carpenters]1088-those busy carpenters about ? why were [they]1088-those busy carpenters fabricating shelves and drawers ? drawers of every size , some small , some large , just such drawers as [he]77-mr. smithson had in [[his]77-mr. smithson shop]1734-his shop ? [He]51-mr. jones questioned one of [their]1088-those busy carpenters body : what was to be sold in [that shop]1090-that shop — did [he]77-mr. smithson know ? [The man]771-the man could not tell , but rather fancied it was to be [an oil and colour shop]1092-an oil and colour shop . Then it was not to be [Mr. Smithson]77-mr. smithson 's own ? Oh , no , certainly ! [Jones]51-mr. jones walked away , a prey to the most tormenting anxiety . Was [the man]771-the man right — was [he]771-the man wrong ? had [he]771-the man spoken the truth ? had [he]771-the man deceived [him]771-the man ? Was [he]771-the man , [Jones]51-mr. jones , now that [his]771-the man business was really improving , was [he]771-the man threatened with [a rival]1094-a rival ? Or was this but a false alarm , the phantom of [his]771-the man fears ? what would [he]771-the man not have given to think so ! [His]771-the man ease was the more distressing , that [he]771-the man dared unburthen [his]771-the man mind to none , to [Mary]29-mary least of any . [She]1095-she , poor little thing , far from sharing [[her]1095-she father]287-her father 's fears , rejoiced in the prospect of [a new shop]1097-a new shop . " It 'll make [the street]134-the street quite gay , "[1095-she] [she]1095-she said to [[her]1095-she father]287-her father , " especially if it 's a linen - draper 's . [I]1095-she wonder if [they]2112-they 'll have pretty bonnets . "[1095-she] [She]1095-she tried to obtain information on this interesting point , but failed completely . Suspense is worse than the worst reality . [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones lost appetite and sleep . Slumber , when it came , was accompanied by such fearful nightmare , that waking thoughts , though bitter , were not , at least , so terrible . [He]51-mr. jones could not forget [the opposite shop]1099-the opposite shop ; in the first place , because [he]51-mr. jones saw [it]1099-the opposite shop every morning with [his]51-mr. jones bodily eyes ; in the second , because it ever haunted that inward eye called by [Wordsworth]81-wordsworth ' the bliss of solitude . ' How far it proved a bliss to [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones , [the reader]1820-the reader may imagine . All this time [the shop]266-the shop had been progressing , and now [bricklayer]1102-bricklayer , [carpenter]1103-carpenter , [glazier]1104-glazier , and [decorator]1105-decorator haying done [their]1106-their work , [it]266-the shop was completed and ready for [[its]266-the shop tenant]1107-its tenant , who , however , seemed in no hurry to appear . This proved the worst time for [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones . To look at [that shop]1090-that shop all the day long , and not to be able to make anything of it ; to wonder whether it were [a friend]362-a friend or [an enemy]1110-an enemy ; whether it would give new lustre to [the street on which [he]51-mr. jones had cast [his]51-mr. jones fortunes , or blast those fortunes in [their]1112-their very birth]1111-the street on which he had cast his fortunes , or blast those fortunes in their very birth , was surely no ordinary trial . Well might [he]51-mr. jones grow thin , haggard , and worn . At length , the crisis came . At the close of November , a dread rumour reached [his]51-mr. jones ears . [The shop]266-the shop was to be [[a grocer]1560-a grocer 's shop]1561-a grocer 's shop , and it was to open a week before Christmas . That same evening , [Mary]29-mary came [home]1499-home crying , and much agitated . [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown , with [her]32-mrs. brown usual kindness , had given information . " Oh , [father]692-father ! "[29-mary] [she]29-mary exclaimed , " [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown says it 's to be [[a grocer]1560-a grocer 's shop]1561-a grocer 's shop . "[29-mary] " So [I]51-mr. jones have heard to - day , "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones replied , a little gloomily . " Never mind , [child]765-child , "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones added , attempting to cheer up , and a rueful attempt it turned out , " never mind , [I]51-mr. jones dare - say there 's room for two . "[51-mr. jones] [He]51-mr. jones said it , but [he]51-mr. jones knew it was not true ; [he]51-mr. jones knew there was room but for one , and that if two came , why , either [both]298-both must perish after a fierce contest , or [one]779-one survive and triumph over the ruin of the other 's all . [He]51-mr. jones knew it , and groaned at the thought . " [I]29-mary wish [you]692-father would n't [father]692-father , "[29-mary] said [Mary]29-mary , again beginning to cry . "[29-mary] [[Her]29-mary father]287-her father shook [his]287-her father head disconsolately . "[29-mary] The words " superior grocer , "[1123-the chief] gently tickled secret ambition . [Mr. Richard Jones]51-mr. jones seriously promised [[his]51-mr. jones daughter]555-his daughter to think about it . [Mary]29-mary had other thoughts , which [she]29-mary did not communicate to [[her]29-mary father]287-her father ; and of these thoughts , [the chief]1123-the chief was to find out what had become of [Mr. Saunders]76-saunders , and return to the old plan of enticing [him]76-saunders into partnership . [She]29-mary was so full of this project , that , partly to get assistance , partly to take a little consequence on [herself]29-mary , [she]29-mary imparted it , under the strictest secrecy , to [Rachel Gray]21-rachel ; and at the close , [she]29-mary pretty clearly hinted , that if [Mr. Joseph Saunders]76-saunders behaved well , [he]76-saunders might , in time , aspire to the honour of [her]29-mary hand . " [[My]29-mary dear]1542-my dear , "[29-mary] [she]29-mary said , hesitatingly , " [you]1542-my dear must not think of anything of the kind ; indeed [you]1542-my dear must not . " [He]287-her father 's a mean — "[29-mary] [she]29-mary began again ; the entrance of [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown interrupted [her]29-mary . [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown was in a very ill humour . " And so , "[32-mrs. brown] [she]32-mrs. brown exclaimed , slamming the door , and irefully addressing [Rachel]21-rachel , " and so [[your]21-rachel beggarly father]2081-your beggarly father has been and broke [my]32-mrs. brown china cup ! " [I]21-rachel tell [you]21-rachel , [I]21-rachel have never had a moment 's peace , ease , and quiet , and never shall have — since [you]21-rachel and [[your]21-rachel beggarly father]2081-your beggarly father entered [this house]124-this house . "[21-rachel] For , by a strange perversion of ideas , [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown persisted in asserting and thinking that it was [Rachel]21-rachel and [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father who had entered [the house]110-the house , and not [she]21-rachel . [She]21-rachel might — but where would the use have been ? [She]21-rachel was free to depart any day [she]21-rachel liked ; and since [she]21-rachel preferred to stay , why not bear it all patiently ? And so [she]21-rachel remained silent , whilst [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown scolded and railed ; for , as [she]32-mrs. brown had said to [Mary]29-mary , " [we]2144-we have all [our]2144-we lot to bear . "[32-mrs. brown] The lesson was lost on [the young girl]1766-the young girl . [He]287-her father already knew all , and gloomily exclaimed , " that it was no more than [he]287-her father expected ; that it was all of a piece ; and that there was neither honesty , gratitude , nor goodness left in [this wicked world]2145-this wicked world . "[287-her father] From which comprehensive remark [we]1132-we can clearly see that [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones is turning misanthropic . And yet the matter was very simple — an everyday occurrence . [Smithson]77-mr. smithson had seen that [he]77-mr. smithson might find it profitable to cut the ground under [Jones]51-mr. jones 's feet . Why should [he]77-mr. smithson not do it ? Is not profit the abject of commerce ? and is not competition the fairest way of securing profit ? [The reader]1820-the reader may easily imagine [Jane]27-jane and [Joseph Saunders]76-saunders married . It was an old engagement Imagine [them]1134-them , too , retained from [their]1134-them wedding tour to [Gravesend]16-gravesend . It is evening ; and on the next morning , " The two Teapots "[1820-the reader] is to open . [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones spent a sleepless night , and took down [his]51-mr. jones shutters as soon as a gray , dull light entered [the street]134-the street . It availed little ; only [a dirty child]1136-a dirty child came in for a pennyworth of brown sugar . It was half - past eight when [Saunders]76-saunders opened [[his]76-saunders shop]1734-his shop ; and just about that time a chill , drizzling rain began to fall . The morning was miserable , and only a few wretched figures flitted about [the wet street]1138-the wet street . [No one]113-no one entered the " Teapot ; "[113-no one] but then [not a soul]1001-not a soul either crossed the threshold of [the rival shop]1141-the rival shop . And thus the dull morning wore on until the church clock struck ten . A sprinkling of [customers]803-customers then entered [the shop of [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones]1143-the shop of richard jones . The oration proved very successful ; altogether , the day was successful . The two Teapots remained vacant ; the Teapot was thronged . [[All Jones]51-mr. jones 's liege subjects]1153-all jones 's liege subjects were anxious to prove [their]1153-all jones 's liege subjects loyalty ; and though , when the gas was lit , [Jones]51-mr. jones could discern a few dark figures within [[[his]51-mr. jones rival]1154-his rival 's shop]1155-his rival 's shop , [Jones]51-mr. jones did not care . [Jones]51-mr. jones felt quite satisfied " that it was all right , "[51-mr. jones] until [he]51-mr. jones cast up [his]51-mr. jones accounts at the end of the week . To [his]51-mr. jones surprise , [he]51-mr. jones found that [his]51-mr. jones expenditure was barely covered , and that , somehow or other , [his]51-mr. jones gains had considerably lessened . [He]51-mr. jones reckoned over and over , and still [he]51-mr. jones came to the same result . " Well , ' taint of much consequence for one week , "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones thought , a little impatiently , and [he]51-mr. jones put the books by . But the next week 's examination revealed a still deeper gap . [Jones]29-mary scratched [his]51-mr. jones head , and pulled a long face . It was not that [he]51-mr. jones minded the loss , for it was a trifling one after all ; but be had a secret dread , and it stood in the background of [his]51-mr. jones thoughts , like a ghost in [a dark room]1158-a dark room , haunting [him]51-mr. jones . Week after week passed , and what had been a speck on the horizon , became a dark and threatening cloud .
