"[36-poor rachel] [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones did not reply one word ; [he]51-mr. jones fell into [a brown study]1176-a brown study ; at the close of it [he]51-mr. jones sighed , and looking up , said earnestly : " [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , let [me]51-mr. jones have some of that tea , will [you]28-miss gray ? and [I]51-mr. jones 'll see [myself]51-mr. jones what it 's like . "[51-mr. jones] " Of course [you]51-mr. jones will , "[21-rachel] said [Rachel]21-rachel , brightening , " [you]51-mr. jones shall have it directly — directly , [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones . "[21-rachel] And without loss of time [she]21-rachel hastened [home]1499-home , and almost immediately appeared again , bringing [him]51-mr. jones the tea [herself]21-rachel , and earnestly declaring that [she]21-rachel was sure [he]51-mr. jones had only to taste it , to set all right , to which [Jones]51-mr. jones answered not a word , but rather gloomily thanked [her]21-rachel for the trouble [she]21-rachel had taken . When [he]51-mr. jones was once more alone , [he]51-mr. jones smelt the tea , shook [his]51-mr. jones head and frowned ; then [he]51-mr. jones put it away until evening came round , when [he]51-mr. jones gave it to [Mary]29-mary , and without further explanation , simply told [her]29-mary that was the tea [they]1178-they were going to have this evening . [Unconscious Mary]29-mary made the tea . " [La]4-la ! [Father]74-father , "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel exclaimed , as [she]21-rachel poured the boiling water upon it , " what beautiful tea [you]74-father 've got ; it 's quite fragrant . "[21-rachel] " Is it ? "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones echoed , faintly , " Why , of course it is , "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel said , pettishly , " [I]21-rachel am sure that fellow opposite ai n't got nothink like it . "[21-rachel] [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones leaned [his]51-mr. jones brow on [his]51-mr. jones hand , and checked a groan . But when the tea was drawn , when it was poured out , when [he]51-mr. jones raised the cup to [his]51-mr. jones lips and tasted it , [the man]771-the man 's courage forsook [him]51-mr. jones ; [he]51-mr. jones put down the cup , and cried like [a child]1524-a child . " [Father]692-father ! [father]692-father ! "[29-mary] exclaimed [Mary]29-mary , frightened and bewildered . " Oh ! [[my]51-mr. jones darling]1571-my darling ! "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones cried , " [we]2180-we 're ruined — [we're]2180-we lost!—that tea is [Joseph Saunders]76-saunders 's tea ; and [he]76-saunders gives it for four shillings , and it 's better than [my]51-mr. jones five . And [I]51-mr. jones ca n't give it , nor [I]51-mr. jones ca n't get it neither , "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones added , despairingly ; " for [I]51-mr. jones have not got credit , and little cash ; and [I]51-mr. jones buy dear , and dear [I]51-mr. jones must sell , or starve ! "[51-mr. jones] Of this speech , all [Mary]29-mary understood , was that the tea [she]29-mary had been making was tea from [[Mr. Saunders]76-saunders 's shop]1181-mr. saunders 's shop . [She]29-mary deliberately rose , poured the contents of the teapot on the ashes in the hearth ; the contents of [her]29-mary own teacup , then of [[her]29-mary father]287-her father 's quickly followed ; then [she]29-mary sat down , folded [her]29-mary arms , and uttered a grim : " There ! [I]29-mary only wish [I]29-mary could serve [him]76-saunders so , "[29-mary] [she]29-mary added after a pause . But what [Mary]29-mary meant by this wish — to pour out [Joseph Saunders]76-saunders like [his]76-saunders own tea , seems rather a fantastic image , even for hate — [the present writer]1183-the present writer does not venture to determine . " It 's all over ! "[51-mr. jones] sadly said [Jones]51-mr. jones ; " [we]2181-we ca n't compete with [him]76-saunders . [I]51-mr. jones 'll shut up [shop]1589-shop , and [we]2181-we 'll go to [some other neighbourhood]2183-some other neighbourhood , and live in [our]2181-we old way . After all , [I]51-mr. jones 'll not be a richer nor [a poorer man]2184-a poorer man than before [[my]51-mr. jones cousin]2185-my cousin left [me]51-mr. jones the sixty pound . "[51-mr. jones] " [You]51-mr. jones ai n't got no spirit ! "[29-mary] cried [Mary]29-mary , turning scarlet with anger . " Give in to that [fellow!—I'd]2186-fellow!—i'd have more spirit than that , "[29-mary] [she]29-mary added with mighty scorn . [[Her]29-mary father]287-her father attempted to remonstrate ; but [the wilful little thing]1185-the wilful little thing would not listen to facts or to reason . [She]29-mary was sure [Saunders]76-saunders could not keep up much longer — that [she]29-mary was . [They]1186-they had only to wait , and wear [him]76-saunders out . Alas ! it is very hard to tear out ambition and pride from the heart of [man]392-man , rich or poor . In an evil hour , [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones yielded . And now , alas ! fairly began the Teapot 's downward course . Every effort of [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones to rise , only made [him]51-mr. jones sink the deeper . To use a worn out , though expressive phrase , [he]51-mr. jones stirred heaven and earth to get better tea ; but the spell to conjure it forth was wanting . [Jones]51-mr. jones had very correctly stated the case to [[his]51-mr. jones daughter]555-his daughter — [he]51-mr. jones had not credit ; [he]51-mr. jones had little or no cash ; what [he]51-mr. jones purchased in small quantities , [he]51-mr. jones bought dear ; and [he]51-mr. jones sold as [he]51-mr. jones bought . And thus , unable to compete with superior , capital and energy , [he]51-mr. jones declined day by day . But if [he]51-mr. jones fell , it was not without a struggle . [He]51-mr. jones turned desperate , and resorted to a desperate expedient ; [he]51-mr. jones sold [his]51-mr. jones goods at prime cost , and left [himself]51-mr. jones without profit . But [Jones]51-mr. jones did not care ; all [he]51-mr. jones wanted was to crush [[his]51-mr. jones opponent]1189-his opponent — that object accomplished , and [he]51-mr. jones once more [sole master of [the field]1191-the field]1190-sole master of the field , [he]51-mr. jones could make [his]51-mr. jones own price , and gradually retrieve lost time , and heal the wounds received in the battle . Business requires a cool head ; competition has its limits , beyond which yawns the bottomless pit of ruin . [Jones]51-mr. jones lost [his]51-mr. jones temper , and with it [his]51-mr. jones judgment . Not satisfied with the faint change for the better , produced by the first measure , [he]51-mr. jones impatiently resolved " to settle [that Saunders]2187-that saunders , "[51-mr. jones] by a second and still bolder stroke . [He]51-mr. jones filled [[his]51-mr. jones shop]1734-his shop - windows with placards , on which prices were marked , with notes of admiration . [He]51-mr. jones pressed into [his]51-mr. jones service a dozen of [little boys , whose sole business was to slip bills under doors]1193-little boys , whose sole business was to slip bills under doors , and to throw them down areas , or to force them into the hands of [unconscious passengers]1194-unconscious passengers ; and [he]51-mr. jones crowned an these arts by selling under prime cost . [The customers]1195-the customers could not resist this tender appeal to [their]1195-the customers feelings ; [they]1195-the customers came back one and all — the Teapot once more was full — [the two Teapots]1196-the two teapots was deserted ; and [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones was triumphant . [We]1197-we profess no particular regard for [Joseph Saunders]76-saunders ; but [we]1197-we can not deny that [he]76-saunders played [his]76-saunders cruel game skilfully and well . [He]76-saunders did not bring down [his]76-saunders prices one farthing . Without emotion [he]51-mr. jones saw [[his]51-mr. jones shop]1734-his shop forsaken — [he]51-mr. jones knew [his]51-mr. jones own strength ; [he]51-mr. jones knew , too , the weakness of [[his]51-mr. jones enemy]1199-his enemy . " Oh ! It 's that dodge [you]76-saunders are after , "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones thought , thrusting [his]51-mr. jones tongue in [his]51-mr. jones cheek . " Well , then , it has beggared many [a man]601-a man before [you]76-saunders ; and [we]2189-we shall see how long [you]76-saunders 'll keep it up — that 's all . "[51-mr. jones] And to whosoever liked to hear , [Saunders]76-saunders declared that [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones was selling at loss , and that [he]76-saunders ( [Saunders]76-saunders ) could not afford to do so ; and was sorry [the old man]631-the old man would be so obstinate . " Where was the use , when [he]631-the old man could not go on ? "[76-saunders] Nothing did [Jones]51-mr. jones more harm than this assertion , and the knowledge that it was a literal truth ; for though [people]1503-people worship cheapness , that goddess of modern commerce , it is only on condition that [she]1202-she shall be a reality , not a fiction ; that [she]1202-she shall rest on the solid basis of gains , howsoever small ; not on the sand foundation of loss , that certain forerunner of failure . [Jones]51-mr. jones could not , of course , long keep up the plan of selling under cost ; [he]51-mr. jones was obliged to give it up . With it , ceased [his]51-mr. jones fallacious and momentary prosperity . " [I]76-saunders thought so , "[76-saunders] soliloquized [Saunders]76-saunders . [Reader]391-reader , if [you]391-reader think that [we]1204-we mean to cast a stone at [the great shop]1205-the great shop , [you]391-reader are mistaken . [We]1204-we deal not with pitiless political economy , with its laws , with their workings . [The great shop]1205-the great shop must prosper ; ' tis in the nature of things ; and [the little shop]1207-the little shop must perish—'tis in [their]1207-the little shop nature too . [We]1204-we but lament this sad truth , that on [[God]31-god 's earth]1208-god 's earth , which [God]31-god made for all , there should be so little room for [the poor man]527-the poor man ; for [his]527-the poor man pride , [his]527-the poor man ambition , [his]527-the poor man desires , which [he]527-the poor man has in common with [the rich man]524-the rich man ; [we]1204-we but deplore what all , alas ! know too well ; that the crown of creation , a soul , [a man by [God]31-god 's Almighty mind]1211-a man by god 's almighty mind , fashioned and called forth into being , by [Christ]86-christ 's priceless blood purchased and redeemed to Heaven , should be a thing of so little worth — ay , so much , so very much less worth than some money , in [this strange world of [ours]1204-we]1212-this strange world of ours . [Few]452-few pitied [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones in [his]51-mr. jones fall . [His]51-mr. jones little ambition was remembered as a crime ; for success had not crowned it . [His]51-mr. jones little vanities were so many deadly sins ; for gold did not hide or excuse [them]1214-them . To [the dregs]1215-the dregs , [the unhappy man]1216-the unhappy man drank the latter draught which rises to the lips of [the fallen]1217-the fallen , when [they]1217-the fallen see [the world]97-the world deserting [them]1217-the fallen to worship [a rival]1094-a rival . [A usurper]1220-a usurper had invaded [[his]51-mr. jones narrow realm]1221-his narrow realm , and crushed [him]51-mr. jones ; [his]51-mr. jones little story was a true page from that great book of History , which [we]1204-we need not read to know how power decays , or to learn of [man]392-man 's fickleness , and fortune 's frowns . Alas ! History , if [we]1204-we did but know it , lies around [us]1204-we , as [mankind]1223-mankind lives in the meanest wretch [we]1204-we meet , and perchance despise . It is a bitter thing to behold [our]1204-we own ruin ; it is a cruel thing to look on powerless and despairing ; and both now fell to the lot of [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones . [He]51-mr. jones had ventured all , and lost all . [He]51-mr. jones was doomed — [he]51-mr. jones knew it ; [every one]1702-every one knew it . But , alas ! the cup of [his]51-mr. jones woes was not full . [Mary]29-mary had always been delicate . One chill evening [she]29-mary took cold ; a cough settled on [her]29-mary chest ; sometimes it seemed gone , then suddenly it returned again . " [She]29-mary felt very well , "[29-mary] [she]29-mary said ; and , strange to say , [[her]29-mary father]287-her father thought so too . [Rachel]21-rachel was the first to see that something was wrong . " [Mary]29-mary , "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel said to [her]29-mary , one morning , " what ails [you]29-mary ? "[29-mary] [They]1226-they were alone ; [Rachel]21-rachel looked at [the young girl]1766-the young girl ; [her]1766-the young girl eyes glittered ; [her]1766-the young girl cheeks were red with a hectic flush ; [her]1766-the young girl breathing was quick and oppressive . " Why , [Miss]2192-miss , [you]2192-miss are crying ! "[29-mary] [she]29-mary exclaimed , amazed . " Am [I]21-rachel ? "[21-rachel] And even as [she]29-mary spoke , [her]29-mary head sank on the bosom of [Rachel]21-rachel — [she]29-mary had fainted . " [I]21-rachel must go now , "[21-rachel] said [Rachel]21-rachel , " but [I]21-rachel shall come back this evening , and bring [my]21-rachel work . "[21-rachel] [Jones]51-mr. jones did not heed [her]21-rachel ; [he]51-mr. jones looked stupified and like [one bereft of sense]1247-one bereft of sense , but [Mary]29-mary laughed and replied , " Oh ! do [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , come and take tea with [us]2207-us . "[29-mary] [Rachel]21-rachel promised that [she]21-rachel would try , kissed [her]29-mary and left . With great difficulty [she]21-rachel obtained from [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown the permission to return . They on whom the light of [this world]597-this world shone not , were rarely in the favour of [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown . And only on condition of being [home]1499-home early did [she]32-mrs. brown allow [Rachel]21-rachel to depart . Before leaving , [she]21-rachel went up to [her]21-rachel other 's chair , [he]51-mr. jones was not now quite so helpless as at first , and did not require [her]21-rachel constant presence or assistance ; though [he]51-mr. jones still did not know [her]21-rachel . " [I]21-rachel shall try and not be too long away , "[21-rachel] said [Rachel]21-rachel in a low voice . " Never mind , "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones muttered , shaking [his]51-mr. jones head , " never mind . "[51-mr. jones] " There 's [a precious old fool]2208-a precious old fool for [you]21-rachel ! "[32-mrs. brown] said [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown laughing coarsely . A flush of pain crossed [Rachel]21-rachel 's cheek , but to have replied , would have been to draw down a storm on [her]21-rachel head ; [she]21-rachel silently left [the house]110-the house . [She]21-rachel found [Mary]29-mary feverish , restless , and full of projects . [She]21-rachel would get up early the next day , and make up for lost time . [She]21-rachel remembered all the work [she]21-rachel had to do , and which [she]21-rachel had unaccountably neglected . [[Her]21-rachel father]287-her father 's shirts to mend , [her]21-rachel own wardrobe to see to ; [the next room]1252-the next room to clean up , for [a second lodger]1253-a second lodger had never been found ; in short , to hear [her]21-rachel , it seemed as if [her]21-rachel life had only begun , and that this was the day of its opening . In vain [Rachel]21-rachel tried to check [her]29-mary soothingly ; [Mary]29-mary talked on and was so animated and so merry , that [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father , who came up every five minutes to see how [she]21-rachel was , could not believe [her]21-rachel to be so very ill as [Miss Gray]28-miss gray thought , or [the Doctor]1925-the doctor had hinted . Indeed , when at nine [Rachel]21-rachel left , and [he]287-her father let [her]21-rachel down [stairs]373-stairs , [he]287-her father seemed quite relieved . " [The child]685-the child 's only growing , "[287-her father] [he]287-her father said to [Rachel]21-rachel , " only growing ; a little rest and a little medicine , and [she]685-the child 'll be all right again . "[287-her father] But scarcely was [Rachel]21-rachel out of the door , when [she]21-rachel burst into tears . " [[My]21-rachel poor little [Mary]29-mary]2210-my poor little mary , "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel thought , " [[my]21-rachel poor little [Mary]29-mary]2210-my poor little mary ! "[21-rachel] It was rather late when [Rachel]21-rachel knocked timidly at the door , [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown opened to [her]21-rachel , and there was a storm on [her]21-rachel brow . " Well , [ma'am]1506-ma'am , "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel began ; " well , [ma'am]1506-ma'am ! "[21-rachel] " Oh ! pray do not — do not ! "[21-rachel] imploringly exclaimed [Rachel]21-rachel , clasping [her]21-rachel hands . For [her]21-rachel excessive patience had of late rendered [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown 's violent temper wholly ungovernable . Irritated by the very meekness which met [her]32-mrs. brown wrath , [she]32-mrs. brown had , with the instinct of aggression , found the only vulnerable point of [Rachel]21-rachel — [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father . This was , indeed , the heel of [Achilles]88-achilles . All the shafts of [the enemy]1659-the enemy 's railing that fell harmless on [the childish old man]1259-the childish old man , rebounded on [[his]1259-the childish old man daughter]555-his daughter with double force : deep and keen they sank in [her]21-rachel hearty and [every one]1702-every one inflicted its wound . And thus it was that [Rachel]21-rachel had learned to look with terror to [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown 's wrath — that [she]21-rachel now shrank from it with fear and trembling , and implored for mercy . But there is no arguing with ill - temper . [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown would neither give mercy , nor hear reason . Had [she]32-mrs. brown not lent twenty pound three and six to [Rachel]21-rachel ? Was not [Rachel]21-rachel beholden to [her]32-mrs. brown for food , shelter , [chemist]1262-chemist 's bill , and [physician]1263-physician 's fees ? and should not , therefore , [her]32-mrs. brown will be [Rachel]21-rachel 's law , and [her]32-mrs. brown pleasure be [Rachel]21-rachel 's pleasure ? [Poor Rachel]36-poor rachel , [her]36-poor rachel patience was great , but now [she]36-poor rachel felt as if it must fail ; as if [she]36-poor rachel could not , even for the sake of a roof 's shelter , endure more from [one to whom no tie of love or regard]1264-one to whom no tie of love or regard bound [her]36-poor rachel — nothing but the burdening sense of an obligation which [she]36-poor rachel had not sought , and for which [she]36-poor rachel had already paid so dearly . [She]36-poor rachel clasped [her]36-poor rachel thin hands — [she]36-poor rachel looked with [her]36-poor rachel mild brown eyes in the face of [[her]36-poor rachel tormentor]244-her tormentor , and [her]36-poor rachel lips quivered with the intensity of the feelings that moved [her]36-poor rachel to reply , and repel insult and contumely , and with the strength of will that kept [her]36-poor rachel silent . At length , [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown grew tired , for [her]32-mrs. brown ill - temper had this quality — it was vehement , not slow and irritating , the infliction ceased — [Rachel]21-rachel remained alone . [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown had taken possession of [the room that had once been [Rachel]21-rachel 's]1266-the room that had once been rachel 's . [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray slept in [the back parlour]640-the back parlour ; and in order to remain within reach of aid , [Rachel]21-rachel slept on the floor of [the front room]906-the front room . In [this room]1269-this room it was that [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown had left [her]21-rachel . [Softly Rachel]21-rachel went and opened the door of [[[her]21-rachel father]287-her father 's room]1271-her father 's room ; it was dark and quiet ; but in its stillness , [she]21-rachel heard [his]287-her father regular breathing — [he]287-her father slept , and little , did [he]287-her father know how much that calm sleep of [his]287-her father cost [[his]287-her father daughter]555-his daughter . [She]21-rachel closed the door , and sat down in [[her]21-rachel own room]1273-her own room ; but [she]21-rachel thought not of sleep ; [the tempter]1274-the tempter was with [her]21-rachel in that hour . [Her]21-rachel heart was full of bitterness — full even to overflowing . On [a dark and dreary sea]1275-a dark and dreary sea , [her]21-rachel lot seemed cast ; [she]21-rachel saw not the guiding star of faith over [her]21-rachel head . [She]21-rachel saw not before [her]21-rachel the haven of blessed peace . The words " [Thy]2214-thy will be done , "[21-rachel] fell from [her]21-rachel lips ; they were not in [her]21-rachel heart . Nothing was there , nothing but wounded pride , resentment , and the sense of unmerited wrong . In vain , thinking of [[her]21-rachel tyrant]1276-her tyrant , [Rachel]21-rachel said to [herself]21-rachel , " [I]21-rachel forgive [that woman]2215-that woman — [I]21-rachel forgive [her]2215-that woman freely . "[21-rachel] [She]21-rachel felt that [she]21-rachel did not ; that anger against [this pitiless tormentor of [her]21-rachel life]1277-this pitiless tormentor of her life smouldered in [her]21-rachel heart like the red coal living beneath pale ashes ; and [Rachel]21-rachel was startled , and justly , to feel that so strange and unusual an emotion , anger against another , had found place in [her]21-rachel bosom , and that though [she]21-rachel bade it go , it stayed , and would not depart . To be gentle is not to be passionless . The spirit of [Rachel]21-rachel had been early subdued , too much subdued for [her]21-rachel happiness ; but it was too noble ever to have been quenched . It still burned within [her]21-rachel , a flame pure and free , though invisible . But now , alas ! the vapours of earthly passion dimmed its brightness : and it was darkened with human wrath . Through such moments of temptation and trial all have passed ; and then it is , indeed , when [we]1278-we are not blinded by pride , that [we]1278-we feel [our]1278-we miserable weakness , a weakness for which there is but one remedy , but then it is a divine one — the strength of [God]31-god . That strength [Rachel]21-rachel now invoked . De Profundis , from the depths of [her]21-rachel sorrow [she]21-rachel cried out to [the Lord]1489-the lord , not that [her]21-rachel burden might grow less , but that [her]21-rachel strength to bear it , to endure and forgive , might increase eyen with it And strength was granted unto [her]21-rachel . It came , not at once , not like the living waters that flowed from [the arid rock]1280-the arid rock , when [the prophet]1281-the prophet spoke , but slowly , like [the heavenly manna that fell softly in the silence of the night]1282-the heavenly manna that fell softly in the silence of the night , and was gathered ere the sun rose above [the desert]1283-the desert . [Rachel]21-rachel felt — oh , pure and blessed feeling!—that [her]21-rachel heart was free from bitterness and gall ; that [she]21-rachel could forgive [the offender]1284-the offender , to seventy times seven ; that [she]21-rachel could pray for [her]1284-the offender — not with the lip - prayer of [the self - righteous Pharisee]1285-the self - righteous pharisee , but with the heartfelt orisons of [the poor , sinning , and penitent publican]1286-the poor , sinning , and penitent publican ; and again and again , and until the tears flowed down [her]21-rachel cheek , [she]21-rachel blessed [God]31-god , [the sole Giver of so mighty and superhuman a grace]1287-the sole giver of so mighty and superhuman a grace . And well it was for [Rachel Gray]21-rachel , that [she]21-rachel forgave [[her]21-rachel enemy]1288-her enemy that night . Well it was , indeed , that the next sun beheld not [her]21-rachel wrath . Before that sun rose , [the poor , erring woman]1289-the poor , erring woman had given in [her]1289-the poor , erring woman account of every deed , and every word uttered in the heat of anger:—Mrs . [Brown]32-mrs. brown had gone to [[her]1289-the poor , erring woman room]1845-her room strong and well . [She]1289-the poor , erring woman was found dead and cold in [her]1289-the poor , erring woman bed the next morning . [A coroner]1291-a coroner 's inquest was held , and a verdict of " sudden death "[1289-the poor , erring woman] recorded . And a will , too , was found in a tea - caddy , by which [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown formally bequeathed all [her]32-mrs. brown property to [Rachel Gray]21-rachel , " as a proof , "[21-rachel] said the will , " of [her]32-mrs. brown admiration and respect . "[21-rachel] On hearing the words , [Rachel]21-rachel burst into tears . " Thank [God]31-god ! That [I]21-rachel forgave [her]32-mrs. brown ! "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel exclaimed , " thank [God]31-god ! "[21-rachel] Well indeed might [she]21-rachel thank [the Divine bestower of all forgiveness]1292-the divine bestower of all forgiveness . The legacy was not after all a large one . [Mrs. Brown]32-mrs. brown 's annuity died with [her]1289-the poor , erring woman ; [she]1289-the poor , erring woman left little more money than buried [her]1289-the poor , erring woman decently ; the ground lease of [the house in which [she]1289-the poor , erring woman had originally resided]1293-the house in which she had originally resided was almost out , and the bequest was in reality limited to [the present abode of [Rachel]21-rachel]1294-the present abode of rachel ; but invaluable to [her]21-rachel indeed , was [the shelter of [that humble home]1296-that humble home]1295-the shelter of that humble home , now [her]21-rachel own for ever . And when all was over ; when the grave had closed on [one , who not being at peace]1297-one , who not being at peace [herself]1297-one , who not being at peace , could not give peace to [others]109-others , when [Rachel]21-rachel and [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father remained alone in [the little house]1708-the little house , now hushed and silenced from all rude and jarring sounds , safe from all tyrannical interference , [Rachel]21-rachel felt , with secret thankfulness , that if [her]21-rachel lot was not happy , according to human weakness , it was blest with peace and quiet , and all the good that from [them]1301-them spring . If a cloud still lingered over it , it was only because , looking at [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father , [she]21-rachel remembered the unfulfilled desire of [her]21-rachel heart ; and if on days otherwise now marked with peace , there sometimes fell the darkness of a passing shadow , it was only when [she]21-rachel saw and felt too keenly the sorrows of [others]109-others . [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones still hoped : " [Mary]29-mary was so young ! "[51-mr. jones] [He]51-mr. jones would hope . But it was not to be ; [he]51-mr. jones had but tasted the cup of [his]51-mr. jones sorrows ; to [the dregs]1215-the dregs was [he]51-mr. jones to drink it ; the earthly idol on which [he]51-mr. jones had set [his]51-mr. jones heart was to be snatched from [him]51-mr. jones ; [he]51-mr. jones was to waken one day to the bitter knowledge : " there is no hope ! "[51-mr. jones] How [he]51-mr. jones felt [we]1305-we know not , and can not tell : [none]1306-none have a right to describe that grief save [they]1307-they [who have passed through it]1308-who have passed through it ; [we]1305-we dare not unveil [the father]1309-the father 's heart : [we]1305-we deal but with the external aspect of things , and sad and bitter enough it was . In [a silent shop]1310-a silent shop , where the sugar seemed to shrink away in the casks , where [the tea - chests]1311-the tea - chests looked hollow , where dust gathered on the counter , on the shelves , in the corners , everywhere ; where all looked blasted and withered by [the deadly upas tree opposite]1312-the deadly upas tree opposite , [you]1313-you might have seen [a haggard man who stood there day after day]1314-a haggard man who stood there day after day , waiting for [customers that came not]1315-customers that came not , and who from behind [[his]51-mr. jones shop]1734-his shop windows drearily watched [the opposite shop]1099-the opposite shop , always full ; thriving , fattening on [his]51-mr. jones ruin ; or who , sadder sight to [his]51-mr. jones eyes and heart , looked at [the little back parlour]1318-the little back parlour , where on [her]1309-the father sick bed [[his]51-mr. jones dying daughter]1319-his dying daughter lay . [Mary]29-mary , as [her]29-mary illness drew towards its close , became fanciful , [she]29-mary insisted on having [her]29-mary bed brought down to [the back parlour]640-the back parlour , and would leave [her]29-mary door open , " in order to mind [the shop]266-the shop , "[29-mary] [she]29-mary said . If anything could hasten [[her]29-mary father]287-her father 's ruin , this did it : [the few customers whom [he]51-mr. jones had left]1322-the few customers whom he had left , gradually dropped off , scared away by [that sick girl]1323-that sick girl , looking at [them]1322-the few customers whom he had left with [her]1323-that sick girl eager , glittering eyes . [He]51-mr. jones sat by [her]1323-that sick girl one evening in a sad and very bitter mood . [She]1323-that sick girl was ill , very ill , and for three days [not a soul]1001-not a soul had crossed the threshold of [[his]51-mr. jones shop]1734-his shop . [His]51-mr. jones love and [his]51-mr. jones ambition were passing away together from [his]51-mr. jones life . " [Father]692-father , "[29-mary] querulously said [Mary]29-mary , " why did [you]692-father shut [the shop]266-the shop so early ? "[51-mr. jones] [Rachel Gray]21-rachel shook with nervous emotion from head to foot [She]21-rachel was pained — [she]21-rachel was distressed at the question . As when in a dream [we]1333-we struggle to move and can not , [our]1333-we will being fettered by the slumber of the body , so [Rachel]21-rachel felt then , so alas ! for [her]21-rachel torment [she]21-rachel felt almost always ; conscious of truths sublime , beautiful and consoling , but unable to express them in speech . " [God]31-god is good , "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel said again , clinging to that truth as to [her]21-rachel anchor of safety . Again [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones smiled . " And [[my]51-mr. jones child]2201-my child , [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , "[51-mr. jones] [he]51-mr. jones said , lowering [his]51-mr. jones voice so that [his]51-mr. jones words could not reach [the next room]1252-the next room , " going by inches before [my]51-mr. jones very eyes ; yet [I]51-mr. jones must look on and not go mad . This explanation apparently satisfied [Mary]29-mary , who began to talk of other things . [She]29-mary knew not [she]29-mary was dying ; whence should the knowledge have come to [a mere child]1336-a mere child like [her]29-mary . [None]1306-none had told [her]29-mary the truth . And [she]29-mary was passing away into eternity , unconscious — [her]29-mary heart , [her]29-mary thoughts , [her]29-mary soul full of the shadows of life . [Rachel]21-rachel saw and knew it , and it grieved [her]21-rachel . [They]1342-them were alone , " yes , now , "[21-rachel] thought [Rachel]21-rachel , " now is the time to speak . " It is not a long story , "[21-rachel] said [Rachel]21-rachel timidly , " and here it is ; [a king]1610-a king was once hunting alone in a wood , when [he]1610-a king heard a very beautiful voice singing very sweetly ; [he]1610-a king went on and saw [a poor leper]2241-a poor leper . "[21-rachel] " What 's [a leper]2242-a leper ? "[29-mary] interrupted [Mary]29-mary . ' But [the leper]2250-the leper replied , ' it is because [I]29-mary am in this state that [I]29-mary sing , for as [my]29-mary body decays , [I]29-mary know that the hour of [my]29-mary deliverance draws nigh , that [I]29-mary shall leave [this miserable world]2251-this miserable world , and go to [[my]29-mary Lord]2252-my lord and [[my]29-mary God]2253-my god . ' "[29-mary] [Mary]29-mary looked at [Rachel]21-rachel surprised at the impressive and earnest tone with which [she]29-mary spoke . "[29-mary] " [We]2255-we are [all lepers]2256-all lepers , "[21-rachel] gently said [Rachel]21-rachel , " for [we]2255-we are [all sinners]2257-all sinners , and sin is to the soul what leprosy is to the body ; it defiles it , and [we]2255-we all should be glad to die ; for [Christ]86-christ has conquered death , and with death sin ends , and [our]2255-we true life , the life in [God]31-god begins . "[21-rachel] [Mary]29-mary raised [herself]29-mary on one elbow . [She]29-mary looked at [Rachel]21-rachel fixedly , earnestly ; " [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , "[29-mary] [she]29-mary said ; " what do [you]28-miss gray mean ? "[29-mary] [Rachel]21-rachel did not reply — [she]21-rachel could not . " Why do [you]28-miss gray tell [me]29-mary all these things ? "[29-mary] continued [Mary]29-mary . And still [Rachel]21-rachel could not speak . " [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , "[29-mary] said [Mary]29-mary , " am [I]29-mary going to die ? "[29-mary] [She]29-mary looked wistfully in [Rachel]21-rachel 's face , and the beseeching tone of [her]29-mary young childish voice seemed to pierce [Rachel]21-rachel 's heart ; but [she]21-rachel had began ; could not , [she]21-rachel dared not go back . [She]21-rachel rose , [she]21-rachel clasped [her]21-rachel hands , [she]21-rachel trembled from head to foot , tears streamed down [her]21-rachel cheek ; [her]21-rachel voice faltered so that [she]21-rachel could scarcely speak , but [she]21-rachel mastered it , clear and distinct the words came out . " [Mary]29-mary , [we]2258-we must all obey the will of [God]31-god ; [we]2258-we came into [this world]597-this world at [His]31-god will , at [His]31-god will [we]2258-we must leave it . Oh , passion ! eloquent pages have been wasted on [thy]1380-thy woes ; volumes have been written to tell [mankind]1223-mankind of [thy]1380-thy delights and [thy]1380-thy torments . To no other tale will youth bend [its]1382-its greedy ear , of no other feelings will [man]392-man acknowledge the power to charm [his]392-man spirit and [his]392-man heart . "[50-mrs. smith] Ay , [the shop]266-the shop was shut . [The shop which [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones had opened with so much pride]1396-the shop which richard jones had opened with so much pride — [the shop which [he]51-mr. jones had ever linked with [[his]51-mr. jones child]528-his child]1397-the shop which he had ever linked with his child , closed on the day of [her]528-his child death , and never reopened . [He]51-mr. jones did not care . [His]51-mr. jones little ambition was wrecked ; [his]51-mr. jones little pride was broken ; [his]51-mr. jones little cruise of love had been poured forth upon [the earth]1057-the earth by [God]31-god 's own hand ; it was empty and dry ; arid sand and dust had drunk up [its]1057-the earth once sweet waters . What [a man without ambition , pride , and lore]1400-a man without ambition , pride , and lore may be , [he]1400-a man without ambition , pride , and lore had become in the one day that bereaved [him]1400-a man without ambition , pride , and lore . Pity not [him]1400-a man without ambition , pride , and lore , [reader]391-reader ; [his]1400-a man without ambition , pride , and lore tale is told ; pity [him]1400-a man without ambition , pride , and lore whose bitter story of hope and disappointment but begins as [I]0-i write , and as [you]1402-you read . For mortal hand has not sounded the bitter depth of such woes . In [them]1403-they live the true tragic passions that else seem to have passed from [the earth]1057-the earth ; passions that could rouse the meekest to revenge and wrath , if daily dew from heaven fell not on poor parched hearts , as nightly it comes down from the skies above , on thirsting earth . A time may come when [the London churchyard]1405-the london churchyard shall be remembered as a thing that has been and is no more ; but now who knows it not ? Who need describe the serried gravestones that mark the resting places in [this sad field of death]1406-this sad field of death ; who need tell how [they]1403-they stare at [busy passers by]1407-busy passers by through [their]1403-they iron grating — how [they]1403-they look ghastly , like [the guest of the Egyptian feast , dead in the midst of tumult and riotous life]1408-the guest of the egyptian feast , dead in the midst of tumult and riotous life . Dreary are [they]1403-they when the sun shines on [them]1403-they , and [their]1403-they rank weeds , the sun which [those beneath]1409-those beneath feel not , but more dreary by far when the drizzling rain pours down the dark church walls and filters into [the sodden earth]1410-the sodden earth . And in [such a place]1411-such a place , and on such a day did [they]1403-they make [the grave of [Mary Jones]29-mary]1412-the grave of mary jones . [Two mourners]1413-two mourners stood by : [a woman]564-a woman and [a man]601-a man . When all was over , when earth had closed over [the grave]1416-the grave and its contents , [the man]771-the man sat down on [a neighbouring gravestone]1418-a neighbouring gravestone , and looked at that red mound which held [his]771-the man all , with a dreary stolid gaze of misery and woe . [Rachel]21-rachel bent over [him]771-the man , and gently laid [her]21-rachel hand on [his]771-the man shoulder . " [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones , [you]771-the man must come ! "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel said . [He]771-the man made no reply , [he]771-the man did not rise , and when [she]21-rachel took [his]771-the man hand to lead [him]771-the man away , [he]771-the man yielded without resistance . [She]21-rachel took [him]771-the man to [[her]21-rachel own house]1419-her own house . Kindly and tenderly [she]21-rachel led [him]771-the man , like [a little child]1379-a little child , and [a child]1524-a child [he]771-the man seemed to have become , helpless , inert — without will , without power . [[His]771-the man own home]356-his own home was a wreck , the prey of creditors , who found but little there , yet sufficient , for [their]1423-their claims were few , to save [him]771-the man from disgrace . [Rachel Gray]21-rachel gave [him]771-the man [the room where [[his]771-the man child]528-his child once had slept , where [he]771-the man had come in to look at [her]528-his child in [her]528-his child sleep]1424-the room where his child once had slept , where he had come in to look at her in her sleep , and fondly bent over [her]528-his child pillow : [he]771-the man burst into tears as [he]771-the man entered it ; and those tears relieved [him]771-the man , and did [him]771-the man good . At the end of two days [he]771-the man rallied from [his]771-the man torpor ; [he]771-the man awoke , [he]771-the man remembered [he]771-the man was [a man born to work]1426-a man born to work , to earn [his]771-the man daily bread , and bear the burden of life . [He]771-the man went out one morning , and looked for employment . Something [he]771-the man found to do ; but what it was [he]771-the man told not [Rachel]21-rachel . When [she]21-rachel gently asked , [he]771-the man shook [his]771-the man head and smiled bitterly . " It do n't matter . [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , "[771-the man] [he]771-the man said ; " it do n't matter . "[771-the man] No doubt it was some miserable , poorly paid task . Yet [he]771-the man only spoke the truth , when [he]771-the man said it mattered little . [He]771-the man lived and laboured , like [thousands]1427-thousands ; but [he]771-the man cared not for to - day , and thought not of to - morrow ; the Time of Promise and of Hope had for ever departed . What though [he]771-the man should feel want , so long as [he]771-the man could pay [his]771-the man weekly rent to [Rachel Gray]21-rachel , [he]771-the man cared not . There is an end to all things ; and as for [his]771-the man old age , should [he]771-the man grow old , had [he]771-the man not [the parish]1428-the parish and [the workhouse]1032-the workhouse ? And so [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones could drag on through life , of all hopes , save the heavenly hope , forsaken . But [Heaven]30-heaven chose to chastise and humble still further , [this already chastised and sorely humbled man]1430-this already chastised and sorely humbled man . [He]771-the man fell ill , and remained for weeks on [his]771-the man sick bed , a burden cast on the slender means of [Rachel Gray]21-rachel . In vain [he]771-the man begged and prayed to be sent to [the workhouse]1032-the workhouse or [some hospital]1432-some hospital ; [Rachel]21-rachel would not hear of it . [She]21-rachel kept [him]771-the man , [she]21-rachel attended on [him]771-the man with all the devotedness of [a daughter]1518-a daughter ; between [him]771-the man and [[her]1518-a daughter father]287-her father [she]21-rachel divided [her]21-rachel time . [Earnestly Jones]51-mr. jones prayed for death : the boon was not granted ; [he]771-the man recovered . [They]1435-they sat together and alone one evening in [the quiet little parlour]1436-the quiet little parlour — alone , for [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray was [no one]113-no one , when there came a knock at the door , and [the visitor]1438-the visitor admitted by [Rachel]21-rachel , proved to be [Joseph Saunders]76-saunders . " [Mr. Jones]51-mr. jones is within , "[76-saunders] hesitatingly said [Rachel]21-rachel " And [I]76-saunders just want to speak to [him]51-mr. jones , "[76-saunders] briefly replied [Saunders]76-saunders , " so that 's lucky . "[76-saunders] [He]76-saunders walked into [the parlour]510-the parlour as [he]76-saunders spoke ; [Rachel]21-rachel followed , wondering what was to be the issue . On seeing [[his]76-saunders enemy]1199-his enemy , [poor Jones]51-mr. jones reddened slightly but the flush soon died away , and in a meek , subdued voice , [he]76-saunders was the first to say " good evening . "[76-saunders] " Sorry to hear [you]51-mr. jones have been ill , "[76-saunders] said [Saunders]76-saunders sitting down , " but [you]51-mr. jones are coming round , ai n't [you]51-mr. jones ? "[76-saunders] " [I]76-saunders am much better , "[76-saunders] was the quiet reply . " Got anything to do ? "[76-saunders] bluntly asked [Saunders]76-saunders . "[76-saunders] [Poor Richard Jones]90-poor richard jones ! This was the end of all [his]90-poor richard jones dreams , [his]90-poor richard jones schemes , [his]90-poor richard jones anger , [his]90-poor richard jones threatened revenge ! And yet , strange to say , [he]90-poor richard jones felt it very little . Every strong and living feeling lay buried in a grave . [His]90-poor richard jones soul was as a thing dead within [him]90-poor richard jones ; [his]90-poor richard jones pride had crumbled into dust , as [Mary]29-mary would have said : [his]90-poor richard jones spirit was gone . The humiliation of accepting [Joseph Saunders]76-saunders proposal,—and , however strange , it was certainly well and kindly meant — [Richard Jones]90-poor richard jones did not consider . [He]90-poor richard jones looked at the advantages , and found them manifest ; there lay the means of paying [Rachel]21-rachel , of covering [his]90-poor richard jones few debts , and of securing to [his]90-poor richard jones wearied life the last and dearly - bought boon of repose . Awhile [he]90-poor richard jones reflected , then said aloud : " [I]90-poor richard jones shall be very glad of it , [I]90-poor richard jones am very much obliged to [you]76-saunders , [Mr. Saunders]76-saunders . "[90-poor richard jones] " Well , then , it 's done , "[76-saunders] said [Mr. Saunders]76-saunders , rising , " good night , [Jones]90-poor richard jones , cheer up , [old fellow]2312-old fellow . And whilst [I]51-mr. jones am waiting for that day , [you]21-rachel do not think [I]51-mr. jones care about what befalls [me]51-mr. jones . "[51-mr. jones] Once more [Rachel]21-rachel was alone . Once more solitude and the silence of [the quiet street]352-the quiet street , shrouded [her]21-rachel in . A new life now began for [Rachel Gray]21-rachel . Like a plant long bent by adverse winds , [she]21-rachel slowly recovered elasticity of spirit , and lightness of heart . What [she]21-rachel might have been , but for the gloom of [her]21-rachel youth , [Rachel]21-rachel never was ; but as the dark cloud , which had long hung over [her]21-rachel , rolled away , as [she]21-rachel could move , speak , eat , and think unquestioned in [[her]21-rachel little home]1443-her little home , a gleam of sunshine , pale but pure , shone over [her]21-rachel life with that late - won liberty . [Her]21-rachel speech became more free , [her]21-rachel smile was more frequent , [her]21-rachel whole manner more open and cheerful . [Rachel]21-rachel lived , however , both by taste and by long habit , in great retirement , and saw but [few people]104-few people . Indeed , almost [[her]21-rachel only visitors]1445-her only visitors were [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones and [Madame Rose]47-madame rose . [The little Frenchwoman]874-the little frenchwoman now and then dropped in , looked piteously at [Thomas Gray]40-thomas gray , shrugged [her]874-the little frenchwoman shoulders , nodded , winked , and did everything to make [herself]874-the little frenchwoman understood , but talk English ; and [Rachel]21-rachel listened to [her]874-the little frenchwoman , and laughed gaily at the strange speech and strange ways of [[her]21-rachel little friend]1447-her little friend . [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones was [a still more frequent visitor]1448-a still more frequent visitor . [He]51-mr. jones came to receive , not to give sympathy . [The society of [Rachel Gray]21-rachel]1449-the society of rachel gray was to [him]51-mr. jones a want of [his]51-mr. jones life , for to [her]21-rachel alone [he]51-mr. jones could talk of [Mary]29-mary ; [he]51-mr. jones spoke and [she]21-rachel listened , and in listening gave the best and truest consolation . Now and then , not often , for [Rachel]21-rachel felt and knew that such language frequently repeated wearies the ear of [weak humanity]1450-weak humanity , [she]21-rachel ventured to soothe [his]51-mr. jones grief with such ailments as [she]21-rachel could think of . And [her]21-rachel favorite one , one which [she]21-rachel often applied to [herself]21-rachel and [her]21-rachel own troubles was : " [We]2319-we receive blessings from the hand of [God]31-god , shall [we]2319-we not also take sorrow when it pleases [Him]51-mr. jones to inflict it ? "[21-rachel] " Very true . [Miss Gray]28-miss gray , very true , "[51-mr. jones] humbly assented [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones . "[51-mr. jones] And thus like a hidden stream flowed on the life of [Rachel Gray]21-rachel , silent , peaceful and very still . It slept in the shadow of [the old grey street]1451-the old grey street , in [the quiet shelter of [a quiet home]1453-a quiet home]1452-the quiet shelter of a quiet home , within the narrow circle of plain duties . Prayer , Love , Meditation and Thought graced it daily . It was humble and lowly in the eyes of [man]392-man ; beautiful and lovely in the sight of [God]31-god . And thus quiet and happy years had passed away , and nothing had arrested [their]1455-their monotonous flow . It was evening , [Rachel]21-rachel and [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father were alone in [the little parlour]1885-the little parlour . " [Father]74-father ! "[21-rachel] [she]21-rachel cried , " do [you]74-father know [me]21-rachel ? "[21-rachel] In speech [he]40-thomas gray answered not , but it seemed to [her]21-rachel that in [his]40-thomas gray look [she]21-rachel read conscious kindness . "[51-mr. jones] Somewhat late that same evening , [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones knocked at [Rachel]21-rachel 's door . As [she]21-rachel opened to [him]51-mr. jones the light [she]21-rachel held shone on [her]21-rachel face , and though [he]51-mr. jones was not [an observant man]1464-an observant man , [he]51-mr. jones was struck with [her]21-rachel aspect . There was a flush on [her]21-rachel cheek , a light in [her]21-rachel eyes , a smile on [her]21-rachel lips , a radiance and a joy in [Rachel]21-rachel 's face which [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones had never seen [there]96-there before . [He]51-mr. jones looked at [her]21-rachel inquiringly , but [she]21-rachel only smiled and showed [him]51-mr. jones in . And now , [reader]391-reader , one last picture before [we]1467-we part . It is evening , as [you]1468-you know , and [three]1469-three are sitting in [the little parlour of [Rachel Gray]21-rachel]1470-the little parlour of rachel gray . An autumn evening it is , somewhat chill with a bright fire burning in the grate , and lighting up with flickering flame the brown furniture and [narrow room]1471-narrow room . And of [these three who sit there]1472-these three who sit there , one is [a grey , childish old man in an arm - chair]1473-a grey , childish old man in an arm - chair ; another , [a man who is not old , but whose hair has turned prematurely white with trouble and sorrow]1474-a man who is not old , but whose hair has turned prematurely white with trouble and sorrow ; [the third]1475-the third is [a meek , thoughtful woman with a book on [her]1475-the third knees , who sits silently brooding over the words [her]1475-the third lips have uttered]1476-a meek , thoughtful woman with a book on her knees , who sits silently brooding over the words her lips have uttered ; for [she]1475-the third has been reading how [the Lord]1489-the lord gives and how [the Lord]1489-the lord takes away , and how [we]1467-we yet must bless the name of [the Lord]1489-the lord . The good seed of these words has not been shed on a barren soil . As [Richard Jones]51-mr. jones sits and dreams of [[his]51-mr. jones lost darling]1480-his lost darling , [he]51-mr. jones also dreams of [their]1481-their joyful meeting some day on [the happier shore]1482-the happier shore , and perhaps now that time has passed over [his]51-mr. jones loss and that its first bitterness has faded away , perhaps [he]51-mr. jones confesses with humble and chastened heart , that meet and just was the doom which snatched from [him]51-mr. jones [his]51-mr. jones earthly idol , and , for a while , took away the too dearly loved treasure of [his]51-mr. jones heart . And [Rachel Gray]21-rachel , too , has [her]21-rachel thoughts . As [she]21-rachel looks at [[her]21-rachel father]287-her father , and whilst thankful for what [she]21-rachel has obtained , as [she]21-rachel yet longs , perhaps , for the full gift [she]21-rachel never can possess ; if [her]21-rachel heart feels a pang , if repining it questions and says : " Oh ! why have [I]21-rachel not too [a father]681-a father to love and know [me]21-rachel , not imperfectly , but fully — completely , "[21-rachel] a sweet and secret voice replies : " [You]2324-you had set [your]2324-you heart on human love , and because [you]2324-you had set [your]2324-you heart upon it , it was not granted to [you]2324-you .
